quotes.message: Protect your good image from the eyes of negative viewers, who may look at your good appearance with an ugly fiendish eye, and ruin your positive qualities with their chemical infested tongues.
quotes.name: Michael Bassey Johnson

quotes.message: Don't let people pull you into their storms. Pull them into your peace.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: People who project negativity typically have low self-esteem. They feel badly about themselves, and their negativity is simply a reflection of those feelings.
quotes.name: Hendrie Weisinger

quotes.message: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
quotes.name: Michael Jordan

quotes.message: Expect while reaching for the stars, people to whirl by with their dark clouds and storm upon you.
quotes.name: Anthony Liccione

quotes.message: When you are pursuing your dreams, they will call you CRAZY because they are LAZY. They never know you are a HERO who just jumped away from step ZERO. Stay away from negative people; they will only pollute you.
quotes.name: Israelmore Ayivor

quotes.message: Don't let negative and toxic people rent space in your head. Raise the rent and kick them out.
quotes.name: Robert Tew

quotes.message: Avoid negative people, for they are the greatest destroyers of self confidence and self-esteem.
quotes.name: Auliq Ice

quotes.message: You cannot expect to live a positive life if you hang with negative people.
quotes.name: Joel Osteen

quotes.message: Some people grumble that roses have thorns; I am grateful that thorns have roses.
quotes.name: Alphonse Karr

quotes.message: Stop letting people who do so little for you control so much of your mind, feelings and emotions.
quotes.name: Will Smith

quotes.message: If they disrespect you to your face imagine what they're doing behind your back.
quotes.name: Sonya Parker

quotes.message: People who try to bring you down everyday aren't important in your life, so you better treat their opinions as such.
quotes.name: Terry Mark

quotes.message: It is easier to avoid the effects of others' negativity when we question if an action or attitude is appropriately directed at us. If it isn't, we can choose to sidestep it and let it pass.
quotes.name: Sue Patton Theole

quotes.message: Sensitive souls draw in the negativity of others because they are so open.
quotes.name: John Gray

quotes.message: Never make negative comments or spread rumors about anyone.
quotes.name: Brian Koslow

quotes.message: Dwelling on the negative simply contributes to its power.
quotes.name: Shirley MacLaine

quotes.message: Negative people need drama like oxygen. Stay positve, it will take their breath away.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: There are two types of people who will tell you that you cannot make a difference in this world: those who are afraid to try and those who are afraid you will succeed.
quotes.name: Ray Goforth

quotes.message: You will face your greatest opposition when you are closest to your biggest miracle.
quotes.name: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.message: No matter how good you are, someone is always going to be against you. But never let them be the limit of your success.
quotes.name: Terry Mark

quotes.message: Whatever you do, good or bad, people will always have something negative to say.
quotes.name: W.H. Auden

quotes.message: If you attach to the negative behavior of others it brings you down to their level.
quotes.name: Guru Singh

quotes.message: He who walks with wise men will be wise, but the companion of fools will suffer harm, Let go of the friends who are no longer uplifting you. Spend time with people who inspire you to be better.
quotes.name: Proverbs 13:20

quotes.message: A negative and toxic person never feels teased with the genuine presence of the pretenders in his network and he always feels pleased with the absence of the genuine leader in his circle.
quotes.name: Anuj Somany

quotes.message: The whole world can gossip about you, and if you don't take it personally you are immune.
quotes.name: Don Miguel Ruiz

quotes.message: You can, you should, and if you're brave enough to start, you will.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: There is little difference in people, but that little difference makes a big difference. The little difference is attitude. The big difference is whether it is positive or negative.
quotes.name: W. Clement Stone

quotes.message: I don't have time to distinguish between the unfortunate and the incompetent.
quotes.name: General Curtis Le May

quotes.message: If toxic people can't stop your mission, they will set out to distract you while you are maintaining your mission.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Toxic people cannot tolerate consideration of others.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: When you share something about yourself with toxic people, they immediately turn the account into a story about them.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Sharing doesn't exist when communicating with toxic people.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Toxic people come in all flavors.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: When people are toxic, they are masters at feigning innocence, of playing the victim, pretending to be less fortunate than others, and claiming that life has treated everyone better than it has treated them.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Instead of trying to make toxic people happy or satisfied, live to help reliable people serve and worship God.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Instead of trying to make toxic people happy or satisfied, live to help reliable people serve and worship God.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Sometimes, you can't walk away from toxic people entirely.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Toxic individuals drain us of joy, energy, and peace.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Because toxic people exist, we need to learn how to play defense.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Toxic relationships leave us drained, and we all experience them.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Toxic people ruin family gatherings. They assault friendships. They can run businesses into the ground.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Resolve today that the toxic people won't take you down or even distract you.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: When a toxic person is attacking you, you don't have to participate.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: If someone is trying to control you, that itself is toxic.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: If someone is trying to control you, that itself is toxic.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Toxic people aren't just difficult people. They're not 'unsaved' people. They're not merely unpleasant people. The toxic people we're talking about are the kind of people who are basically taking you down and destroying your mission.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: Toxic people are often ruled by selfishness and spite. They are usually draining instead of encouraging, and they use people instead of loving them.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: When a toxic person doesn't get his or her way, their next gambit is often to make your motives sound sinister.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: When healthy persons are in conflict with the world, they automatically assume that they are at fault, but when toxic people are in conflict with the world, they automatically assume the world to be at fault.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: The healthy people who desire to take responsibility for their lives are said to drive themselves crazy while toxic people drive everyone else crazy.
quotes.name: Gary Thomas

quotes.message: I have come to realize that toxic people will never take acountability for their actions.
quotes.name: Dr. Sherrie Campbell

quotes.message: A toxic person is never at fault - or so he or she thinks.
quotes.name: Dr. Sherrie Campbell

quotes.message: Toxic people cannot fanthom that other people have needs of their own.
quotes.name: Dr. Sherrie Campbell

quotes.message: Toxic people operate more like a funnel than a waterproof bucket.
quotes.name: Dr. Sherrie Campbell

quotes.message: Toxic people do not think. operate, or play by the same rules we do, and our failing to recognize this sets us up by default for manipulation and unhappiness.
quotes.name: Dr. Sherrie Campbell

quotes.message: Toxic people do not care about the results of their actions because they are driven by an all-consuming need for fuel.
quotes.name: Dr. Sherrie Campbell

quotes.message: Toxic people are largely untreatable.
quotes.name: Dr. Sherrie Campbell

quotes.message: Toxic people spread destruction and death to those who come in contact with them.
quotes.name: Dr. Sherrie Campbell

quotes.message: Toxic people will pollute everything around them. Don't hesitate. Fumigate.
quotes.name: Mandy Hale

quotes.message: You can't fix or repair or save toxic people.
quotes.name: Mandy Hale

quotes.message: Toxic men can distress women who are rich, poor, beautiful, plain, fat, thin, tall or short. They can make miserable women from any religion, race or culture anywhere in the world.
quotes.name: Mandy Hale

quotes.message: Toxic men not only make you feel bad, they make you look bad.
quotes.name: Mandy Hale

quotes.message: Having a toxic man in your life can affect your physical appearance and how you come across to others.
quotes.name: Mandy Hale

quotes.message: Individual commitment to a group effort -- that is what makes a team work, a company work, a society work, a civilization work.
quotes.name: Vince Lombardi

quotes.message: It was character that got us out of bed, commitment that moved us into action, and discipline that enabled us to follow through.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: Commitment in the face of conflict produces character.
quotes.name: Unknown

quotes.message: The quality of a person's life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.
quotes.name: Vince Lombardi

quotes.message: The three great essentials to achieve anything worth while are, first, hard work; second, stick-to-itiveness; third, common sense.
quotes.name: Thomas A Edison

quotes.message: The successful person makes a habit of doing what the failing person doesn't like to do.
quotes.name: Thomas A Edison

quotes.message: Only one who devotes himself to a cause with his whole strength and soul can be a true master. For this reason mastery demands all of a person.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: The only limit to your impact is your imagination and commitment.
quotes.name: Anthony Robbins

quotes.message: I know the price of success: dedication, hard work, and an unremitting devotion to the things you want to see happen.
quotes.name: Frank Lloyd Wright

quotes.message: People have a hard time letting go of their suffering. Out of a fear of the unknown, they prefer suffering that is familiar.
quotes.name: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.message: Nothing in the universe can stop you from letting go and starting over.
quotes.name: Guy Finley

quotes.message: Holding on to anger, resentment and hurt only gives you tense muscles, a headache and a sore jaw from clenching your teeth. Forgiveness gives you back the laughter and the lightness in your life.
quotes.name: Joan Lunden

quotes.message: Forgive, forget. Bear with the faults of others as you would have them bear with yours.
quotes.name: Phillips Brooks

quotes.message: It's not an easy journey, to get to a place where you forgive people. But it is such a powerful place, because it frees you.
quotes.name: Tyler Perry

quotes.message: It's one of the greatest gifts you can give yourself, to forgive. Forgive everybody.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: People can be more forgiving than you can imagine. But you have to forgive yourself. Let go of what's bitter and move on.
quotes.name: Bill Cosby

quotes.message: When we give ourselves the chance to let go of all our tension, the body's natural capacity to heal itself can begin to work.
quotes.name: Nhat Hanh

quotes.message: In the process of letting go you will lose many things from the past, but you will find yourself.
quotes.name: Deepak Chopra

quotes.message: To let go is to release the images and emotions, the grudges and fears, the clingings and disappointments of the past that bind our spirit.
quotes.name: Jack Kornfield

quotes.message: It is important that we forgive ourselves for making mistakes. We need to learn from our errors and move on.
quotes.name: Steve Maraboli

quotes.message: You've gotta know when it's time to turn the page.
quotes.name: Tori Amos

quotes.message: We need to learn to let go as easily as we grasp and we will find our hands full and our minds empty.
quotes.name: Leo F. Buscaglia

quotes.message: I can have peace of mind only when I forgive rather than judge.
quotes.name: Gerald Jampolsky

quotes.message: When a deep injury is done us, we never recover until we forgive.
quotes.name: Alan Paton

quotes.message: To forgive is to set a prisoner free and discover that the prisoner was you.
quotes.name: Lewis B. Smedes

quotes.message: We may not know how to forgive, and we may not want to forgive; but the very fact we say we are willing to forgive begins the healing practice.
quotes.name: Louise Hay

quotes.message: Forgo your anger for a moment and save yourself a hundred days of trouble.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Forgiving is an act of mercy toward an offender. We are no longer controlled by angry feelings toward this person.
quotes.name: Robert D. Enright

quotes.message: Forgiveness works directly on the emotion of anger (and related constructs such as resentment, hostility, or hatred) by diminishing its intensity or level within the mind and heart.
quotes.name: Richard Fitzgibbons

quotes.message: To forgive is to set yourself free, to acknowledge that it does no good to hate. Hate really, really destroys both the other person and yourself. That realization is what I think taught me about forgiveness, and so I try to live by it.
quotes.name: Ruby Bridges Hall

quotes.message: The practice of peace and reconciliation is one of the most vital and artistic of human actions.
quotes.name: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.message: You're only human. Let's break free of this gravity of judgment. And fly high on the wings of forgiveness.
quotes.name: India.Arie

quotes.message: Be angry, and yet do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger.
quotes.name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.message: Forgive all who have offended you, not for them, but for yourself.
quotes.name: Harriet Nelson

quotes.message: To forgive is the highest, most beautiful form of love. In return, you will receive untold peace and happiness.
quotes.name: Robert Muller

quotes.message: I believe that things should be let go once they are discussed. Apology accepted. End of story.
quotes.name: Brad Goreski

quotes.message: Let go of offence. Let go of fear. Let go of revenge.
quotes.name: Joel Osteen

quotes.message: Anger makes dull men witty, but it keeps them poor.
quotes.name: Francis Bacon

quotes.message: When angry, count ten before you speak; if very angry a hundred.
quotes.name: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.message: Anger in its time and place . May assume a kind of grace. . It must have some reason in it . And not last beyond a minute.
quotes.name: Charles Lamb

quotes.message: It's my rule never to lose me temper till it would be dethrimental to keep it.
quotes.name: Sean O'Casey

quotes.message: When angry, count four; when very angry, swear.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Anger is the only thing to put off till tomorrow.
quotes.name: Slovakian Proverb

quotes.message: Temper is the one thing you can’t get rid of by losing it.
quotes.name: Jack Nicholson

quotes.message: Take this remark from Richard, poor and lame, what'er's begun in anger ends in shame.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: A wrathful man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger appeaseth strife.
quotes.name: Proverbs 15:18

quotes.message: It is a bigger miracle to be patient and refrain from anger than it is to control the demons which fly through the air.
quotes.name: St. John Cassian

quotes.message: There is nothing that can be done with anger that cannot be done better without it.
quotes.name: Dallas Willard

quotes.message: Resentment is when you let your hurt become hate. Resentment is when you allow what is eating you to eat you up. Resentment is when you poke, stoke, feed, and fan the fire, stirring the flames and reliving the pain. Resentment is the deliberate decision to nurse the offense until it becomes a black, furry, growling grudge.
quotes.name: Max Lucado

quotes.message: Hot heads and cold hearts never solved anything.
quotes.name: Billy Graham

quotes.message: When angry, count four; when very angry, swear.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Consider how much more you often suffer from your anger and grief than from those very things for which you are angry and grieved.
quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: Bitterness is like cancer. It eats upon the host. But anger is like fire. It burns all clean.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your wrath.
quotes.name: Ephesians 4:26

quotes.message: He who conquers his anger has conquered an enemy.
quotes.name: German Proverb

quotes.message: Kick a stone in anger and you will hurt your own foot.
quotes.name: Korean Proverb

quotes.message: Anger dwells only in the bosom of fools.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: Let us not look back in anger, nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
quotes.name: James Thurber

quotes.message: Man should forget his anger before he lies down to sleep.
quotes.name: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.message: Always write angry letters to your enemies. Never mail them.
quotes.name: James Fallows

quotes.message: Do not weep; do not wax indignant. Understand.
quotes.name: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.message: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
quotes.name: Phyllis Diller

quotes.message: It’s smart to be patient, but it’s stupid to lose your temper.
quotes.name: Proverbs 14:29

quotes.message: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.
quotes.name: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.message: There is no sin nor wrong that gives a man such a foretaste of hell in this life as anger and impatience.
quotes.name: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.message: To build one’s activity on love and non-violence demands the greatest inner purification; one must constantly rid one’s heart of inordinate desires, fears, and anxieties, but above all, one must cleanse oneself of anger.
quotes.name: William Johnston

quotes.message: If you are patient in one moment of anger, you will escape a hundred days of sorrow.
quotes.name: Chinese Saying

quotes.message: One who controls occurring anger as one would a chariot gone off the track, that one I call a charioteer; other people just hold the reins.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you arc the one who gets burned.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: For he who gives no fuel to fire puts it out, and likewise he who does not in the beginning nurse his wrath and does not puff himself up with anger takes precautions against it and destroys it.
quotes.name: Plutarch

quotes.message: The wise conquer by strength, rather than anger. The malevolent fall by their own rage.
quotes.name: Tibetan Saying

quotes.message: Although you may spend your life killing, . You will not exhaust all your foes. . But if you quell your own anger, . Your real enemy will be slain.
quotes.name: Siddha Nagarjuna

quotes.message: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: When you allow thoughts of anger ... to exercise sway, they have a corroding and poisoning effect upon the organism; they will pull it down, and if allowed to continue will eventually tear it to pieces by externalizing themselves in particular forms of disease.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Trine

quotes.message: Anger is a normal emotion if it is expressed when felt. Then it is over with. If one keeps a lid on it, it develops into resentment or hate. Sooner or later, resentment and hate explode, destroying others, or they are held in, destroying oneself.
quotes.name: Dr. Bernie Siegel

quotes.message: If you don't find a way to express your anger, in a direct, constructive way, it will leak out as indirect, covert hostility, or it will eventually burst forth as explosive rage or violence. It might well attract you to angry people, with the unconscious intention of triggering your own anger.
quotes.name: Shakti Gawain

quotes.message: People who carry a lot of anger inside without being aware of it and without expressing it are more likely to be attacked, verbally or even physically, by other angry people, and often for no apparent reason. They have a strong emanation of anger that certain people pick up subliminally and that triggers their own latent anger.
quotes.name: Eckhard Tolle

quotes.message: What I've learned about being angry with people is that it generally hurts you more than it hurts them.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: When there is anger or frustration in you or around you, instead of focusing on the anger, focus on the seed of compassion, focus on love and resolution. The thought form of resolution in itself sets up a resonant field that enables the mind to perceive methods of resolution.
quotes.name: Dhyani Ywahoo

quotes.message: Bitterness is anger gone sour, an attitude of deep discontent that poisons our souls and destroys our peace.
quotes.name: Billy Graham

quotes.message: As you get older, though, you realize there are fire extinguishers. You do have an ability to control the flames.
quotes.name: Chaka Khan

quotes.message: In anger, you look ten years older.
quotes.name: Hedda Hopper

quotes.message: Anger is like milk, it should not be kept too long.
quotes.name: Phyllis Bottome

quotes.message: My recipe for dealing with anger and frustration: Set the kitchen timer for 20 minutes, cry, rant, and rave, and at the sound of the bell, simmer down and go about business as usual.
quotes.name: Phyllis Diller

quotes.message: My recipe for dealing with anger and frustration: Set the kitchen timer for 20 minutes, cry, rant, and rave, and at the sound of the bell, simmer down and go about business as usual.
quotes.name: Phyllis Diller

quotes.message: Let go of anger. Let go of pride. When you are bound by nothing you can go beyond your sorrow.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: Letting go of anger and hate requires us to give up the hope for a different past, along with the hope of a fantasized future. What we gain is a life more in the present, where we are not mired in prolonged anger and resentment that doesn't serve us.
quotes.name: Harriet Lerner

quotes.message: When we forgive we let go of anger that eats away every day at our happiness. Forgiveness empowers you to let go of the pain from the past. It doesn’t mean you forget what happened but rather refuse to allow past experiences be a burden you carry into every day.
quotes.name: Michael Nulty

quotes.message: 'Did I offer peace today? Did I bring a smile to someone? Did I offer healing? Did I let go of anger and resentment? Did I love? Did I forgive? These are the real questions. Trust that the littlest gesture will bear fruits here in this world and life to come.
quotes.name: Henri Nouwen

quotes.message: Though I am often in the depths of misery, there still calmness, pure harmony, and music inside me.
quotes.name: Vincent Van Gogh

quotes.message: There were still the periods of darkness, the spasms of panic; but now he knew they were not real, and because he knew this he overcame them.
quotes.name: V.S. Naipaul

quotes.message: Depression is when you have lots of love, but no one's taking.
quotes.name: Douglas Coupland

quotes.message: Depression is unfocused self-pity.
quotes.name: Bill Wilson

quotes.message: Depression is the inability to construct a future.
quotes.name: Dr. Rollo May

quotes.message: A lot of people don't realize that depression is an illness. I don't wish it on anyone, but if they would know how it feels, I swear they would think twice before they just shrug it.
quotes.name: Jonathan Davis

quotes.message: That's the thing about depression: A human being can survive almost anything, as long as she sees the end in sight. But depression is so insidious, and it compounds daily, that it's impossible to ever see the end. The fog is like a cage without a key.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quotes.message: Depression occurs when one looks back with no pride, and looks forward with no hope.
quotes.name: Robert Frost

quotes.message: Depression is melancholy minus its charms, the animation, the fits.
quotes.name: Susan Sontag

quotes.message: Instead of seeing depression as a dysfunction, it is a functioning phenomenon. It stops you cold, sets you down, makes you damn miserable.
quotes.name: James Hillman

quotes.message: Depression is something that makes you lose your sight.
quotes.name: Michael Schenker

quotes.message: Depression scares people off. It makes me laugh that it has that kind of effect.
quotes.name: Siobhan Fahey

quotes.message: I don’t think anybody's continually happy, uh, except idiots, you know. You know, you have to have little moments of depression.
quotes.name: Rube Goldberg

quotes.message: If you feel depressed you shouldn't go out on the street because it will show on your face and you'll give it to others. Misery is a communicable disease.
quotes.name: Martha Graham

quotes.message: People with depression have something very valuable to teach us... how to live when it doesn't ever feel good.
quotes.name: Kay Warren

quotes.message: There are wounds that never show on the body that are deeper and more hurtful than anything that bleeds.
quotes.name: Laurell K. Hamilton

quotes.message: It's like being in a glass elevator in the middle of a crowded mall; you see everything and would love to join in, but the door won't open so you can't.
quotes.name: Lisa Moore Sherman

quotes.message: It's not always the tears that measure the pain. Sometimes it's the smile we fake.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Depression is like being in a totally round room and looking for a corner to sit in.
quotes.name: Laura Sloate

quotes.message: The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.
quotes.name: Mother Teresa

quotes.message: Telling a depressed person to be happy is the same as telling a cancer patient to cure themselves.
quotes.name: Dissentient

quotes.message: Often the people with the strongest hearts carry the heaviest ones.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: You sometimes think you want to disappear, but all you really want is to be found.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Depression begins with disappointment. When disappointment festers in our soul, it leads to discouragement.
quotes.name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.message: You largely constructed your depression. It wasn't given to you. Therefore, you can deconstruct it.
quotes.name: Albert Ellis

quotes.message: Depression is like falling so deep down the rabbit hole you forget what the sky looks like.
quotes.name: Robin Brodsky Curtin

quotes.message: Tears are often the telescope by which men see far into heaven.
quotes.name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.message: The worst kind of pain is when you're smiling just to stop the tears for falling.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: No one is depressed when they're being chased by a bear.
quotes.name: Adam Carolla

quotes.message: Depression is living in a body that fights to survive, with a mind that tries to die.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: If you are chronically down, it is a lifelong fight to keep from sinking.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quotes.message: There is no greater sorrow than to recall in misery the time when we were happy.
quotes.name: Dante

quotes.message: Having depression is being in an abusive relationship with yourself.
quotes.name: Emily Dotterer

quotes.message: If we admit our depression openly and freely, those around us get from it an experience of freedom rather than the depression itself.
quotes.name: Dr. Rollo May

quotes.message: Sometimes It's easier to pretend that you don't care, than to admit it's killing you.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Do not be depressed. Do not let your weakness make you impatient. Instead, let the serenity of your spirit shine through your face. Let the joy of your mind burst forth.
quotes.name: Peter Damian

quotes.message: Being depressed is like being grounded except it's your brain ruining your life instead of your mom.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: If depression is creeping up and must be faced, learn something about the nature of the beast: You may escape without a mauling.
quotes.name: Dr. R. W. Shepherd

quotes.message: A new study found that people who are depressed have a greater risk of stroke. Well that should cheer them up.
quotes.name: Jay Leno

quotes.message: When women are depressed, they eat or go shopping. Men invade another country. It's a whole different way of thinking.
quotes.name: Elayne Boosler

quotes.message: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
quotes.name: Jim Rohn

quotes.message: You need self-confidence and determination: feeling depressed and losing hope will never really help to correct any situation.
quotes.name: Dalai Lama

quotes.message: It's a bit like walking down a long, dark corridor never knowing when the light will go on.
quotes.name: Neil Lennon

quotes.message: Depression is feeling like you've lost something but having no clue when or where you last had it. Then one day you realize what you lost is yourself.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: I'm tired of trying, sick of crying, I know I've been smiling, but inside I'm dying.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Having depression is like seeing a rainbow in grayscale.
quotes.name: Hazel Strickland

quotes.message: Depression is a prison where you are both the suffering prisoner and the cruel jailer.
quotes.name: Dorothy Rowe

quotes.message: You handle depression in much the same way you handle a tiger.
quotes.name: R. W. Shepherd

quotes.message: You are allowed to feel messed up and inside out. It doesn't mean you're defective - it just means you're human.
quotes.name: David Mitchell

quotes.message: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
quotes.name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.message: Losing your life is not the worst thing that can happen. The worst thing is to lose your reason for living.
quotes.name: Jo Nesbo

quotes.message: Hiding in my room, safe within my womb, I touch no one and no one touches me. I am a rock, I am an island. And a rock feels no pain; And an island never cries.
quotes.name: Paul Simon

quotes.message: Before any great achievement, some measure of depression is very usual.
quotes.name: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.message: The only thing more exhausting than being depressed is pretending that you're not.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: When you feel worried and depressed, consciously form a smile on your face and act upbeat until the happy feeling becomes genuine.
quotes.name: Jonathan Lockwood Huie

quotes.message: Sometimes it's heavy like you're carrying an elephant. Sometimes it's dark; you wonder if you'll ever see light. Sometimes it's bleak; you wonder if you'll make it through. And some days there are no words to describe it.
quotes.name: Tonia Funk Brassell

quotes.message: Having depression is like being trapped in a really bad thunderstorm. You don't know when it's going to hit, you never know how long it's going to last, and when it finally passes, you're left to survey the damages and pick up the pieces.
quotes.name: Tiffany Johnson

quotes.message: Depression is like a bruise that never goes away. A bruise in your mind.
quotes.name: Jeffrey Eugenides

quotes.message: Depression is frustrating. It's knowing there's so much to be grateful for and happy about and to enjoy, but you just can't get there.
quotes.name: Allie Griffin

quotes.message: Depression is like quicksand â€” the more you try to escape on your own, the deeper you sink. Use the supports, tools and resources thrown at you from those on the outside.
quotes.name: Jamie Awtry McClintic

quotes.message: Depression is nourished by a lifetime of ungrieved and unforgiven hurts.
quotes.name: Penelope Sweet

quotes.message: There is nothing more depressing, than having everything, and still feeling sad.
quotes.name: Janet Jackson

quotes.message: Depression is like drowning. Except you can see everyone else around you breathing.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: My unhappiness has become a steady, calm quiet sort of misery. It is always with me and when for a moment something or other stirs me from its immediate ravages (thank God that is still possible) — I wonder at its absence.
quotes.name: Lorraine Hansberry

quotes.message: I am now so depressed I have not an Idea to put to paper — my hand feels like lead — and yet it is an unpleasant numbness it does not take away the pain of existence.
quotes.name: John Keats

quotes.message: I am so angry with myself because I cannot do what I should like to do, and at such a moment one feels as if one were lying bound hand and foot at the bottom of a deep dark well, utterly helpless.
quotes.name: Vincent Van Gogh

quotes.message: The gray drizzle of horror induced by depression takes on the quality of physical pain. But it is not an immediately identifiable pain, like that of a broken limb. It may be more accurate to say that despair, owing to some evil trick played upon the sick brain by the inhabiting psyche, comes to resemble the diabolical discomfort of being imprisoned in a fiercely overheated room. And because no breeze stirs this caldron, because there is no escape from this smothering confinement, it is entirely natural that the victim begins to think ceaselessly of oblivion.
quotes.name: William Styron

quotes.message: Sometimes one has simply to endure a period of depression for what it may hold of illumination if one can live through it, attentive to what it exposes or demands.
quotes.name: May Sarton

quotes.message: Depression is a disorder of the ‘I,’ failing in your own eyes relative to your goals.
quotes.name: Martin Seligman

quotes.message: I am now the most miserable man living.
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: There are different degrees of feeling when you have a Black Dog in your life. At one end of the scale you may feel sad, flat, teary, or blue, and at the other, you are devoid of feeling altogether and life is overwhelmingly difficult.
quotes.name: Matthew Johnstone

quotes.message: Everything passes away — suffering, pain, blood, hunger, pestilence. The sword will pass away too, but the stars will still remain when the shadows of our presence and our deeds have vanished from the earth. There is no man who does not know that.
quotes.name: Mikhail Bulgakov

quotes.message: Depression is the flaw in love. To be creatures who love, we must be creatures who can despair at what we lose, and depression is the mechanism of that despair.
quotes.name: Andrew Solomon

quotes.message: My depression had grown on me as that vine had conquered the oak; it had been a sucking thing that had wrapped itself around me, ugly and more alive than I. It had had a life of its own that bit by bit asphyxiated all of my life out of me. At the worst stage of major depression, I had moods that I knew were not my moods: they belonged to the depression, as surely as the leaves on that tree's high branches belonged to the vine.
quotes.name: Andrew Solomon

quotes.message: I knew that the sun was rising and setting, but little of its light reached me. I felt myself sagging under what was much stronger than I; first I could not use my ankles, and then I could not control my knees, and then my waist began to break under the strain, and then my shoulders turned in, and in the end I was compacted and fetal, depleted by this thing that was crushing me without holding me. Its tendrils threatened to pulverize my mind and my courage and my stomach, and crack my bones and desiccate my body. It went on glutting itself on me when there seemed nothing left to feed it.
quotes.name: Andrew Solomon

quotes.message: It wearies me, you say it wearies you; . But how I caught it, found it, or came by it . What stuff 'tis made of, whereof it is born . I am to learn; . And such a want-wit sadness makes of me, . That I have much ado to know myself.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: I felt a Funeral, in my Brain, . And Mourners to and fro . Kept treading — treading — till it seemed .
quotes.name: Emily Dickinson

quotes.message: Instead of medication, . I want sunshine . & birdsongs . — the kind of laughter . that begins in my chest . & tumbles . out & across . my frame like waves . lapping at the shore of a beach.
quotes.name: M.J. Fievre

quotes.message: Well, I can usually come our of it when I have the blues, . But now I'm so depressed that I have nothing more to lose.
quotes.name: Bill Granse

quotes.message: Of course, despair is not your friend . or your enemy, you mustn't blame him! . He is your persistent creditor, and you? . You are the gambler with your soul as the stakes.
quotes.name: Lin Huiyin

quotes.message: The sickness of desire, that in dark days . Looks on the imagination of despair, . Forgetteth man, and stinteth God his praise; . Nor but in sleep findeth a cure for care.
quotes.name: Robert Seymour Bridges

quotes.message: It gives, to think that our immortal being . No more shall need such garments; and yet man, . As long as he shall be the child of earth, . Might almost 'weep to have' what he may lose, . Nor be himself extinguished, but survive, . Abject, depressed, forlorn, disconsolate.
quotes.name: William Wordsworth

quotes.message: Oh, though oft depressed and lonely, . All my fears are laid aside, . If I but remember only .
quotes.name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.message: There was no water in my eyes, but my spirits were depressed . And my heart lay like a sodden, soggy doughnut in my breast.
quotes.name: Eugene Field

quotes.message: Dispirited became our friend — .
quotes.name: William Schwenck Gilbert

quotes.message: A grief that kept her ever brooding yet . And wholly melancholy and depressed, — . Nor yet could she find sleep by night nor rest .
quotes.name: James Whitcomb Riley

quotes.message: I sat depressed; till, later, . My Love came; . But something in the chamber . Dimmed our flame, — .
quotes.name: Thomas Hardy

quotes.message: Exasperated, a drunk that sees things doubled, . I stumbled home, slammed the door, terrified, . sick, depressed, mind feverish and troubled, . wounded by mystery, the absurd, outside! . In vain my reason tried to take command, . its efforts useless in the tempest’s roar, . my soul, a mastless barge, danced, and danced, .
quotes.name: Charles Baudelaire

quotes.message: But I'm not crazy, I'm just a little unwell . I know right now you can't tell . But stay awhile and maybe then you'll see . A different side of me . I'm not crazy, I'm just a little impaired . I know right now you don't care . But soon enough you're gonna think of me .
quotes.name: Robert Thomas

quotes.message: I'm holding on . Why is everything so heavy? . Holding on . So much more than I can carry . I keep dragging around what's bringing me down .
quotes.name: Brad Delson; Chester Bennington; Julia Michaels; Justin Tranter; Mike Shinoda; Dave Farrell

quotes.message: I don't like my mind right now . Stacking up problems that are so unnecessary . Wish that I could slow things down .
quotes.name: Brad Delson; Chester Bennington; Julia Michaels; Justin Tranter; Mike Shinoda; Dave Farrell

quotes.message: I never had a place to call my own . I never had a home . Ain't nobody callin' my phone . Where you been? Where you at? What's on your mind? .
quotes.name: Alessia Caracciolo; Arjun Ivatury; Khalid Robinson; Sir Robert Bryson Hall II

quotes.message: There are peaks, there are valleys. But they're all kind of carved and smoothed out, and it feels like a low level of despair you live in. Where you're not getting any answers, but you're living OK. And you can smile at the office. You know? But it's a low level of despair.
quotes.name: Jim Carrey

quotes.message: I look inside myself and see my heart is black . I see my red door and must have it painted black . maybe then I’ll fade away and not have to face the facts .
quotes.name: Keith Richards; Mick Jagger

quotes.message: I hurt myself today . To see if I still feel . I focus on the pain . The only thing that's real . The needle tears a hole . The old familiar sting . Try to kill it all away .
quotes.name: Trent Reznor

quotes.message: There's a black crow sitting across from me . His wiry legs are crossed . He's dangling my keys, he even fakes a toss . Whatever could it be .
quotes.name: Justin Deyarmond Edison Vernon

quotes.message: In my dark times I've still got some problems I know . Driving too fast but just moving to slow . And I've got something I've been trying to let go .
quotes.name: Jason Quenneville; Edward Christopher Sheeran; Abel Tesfaye

quotes.message: Every night I just want to go out, . Get out of my head . Every day I don't want to get up, .
quotes.name: Paul McCartney

quotes.message: Hide my head I want to drown my sorrow .
quotes.name: Roland Orzabal

quotes.message: All alone it was always there you see . And even on my own . It was always standing next to me . I can see it coming from the edge of the room . Creeping in the streetlight holding my hand in the pale gloom .
quotes.name: James Ellis Ford; Florence Leontine Mary Welch

quotes.message: Life can get you down so I just numb the way it feels . I drown it with a drink and out-of-date prescription pills . And all the ones that love me they just left me on the shelf . No farewell .
quotes.name: Amy Victoria Wadge; Edward Christopher Sheeran; Timothy Lee McKenzie

quotes.message: The worst part of depression is that it dulls every positive feeling but intensifies every negative one. Joy is muted; sorrow is amplified.
quotes.name: Oslo Redgrave via Twitter

quotes.message: Mom, my depression is a shape shifter . One day it is as small as a firefly in the palm of a bear . The next it's the bear .
quotes.name: Sabrina Benaim

quotes.message: Nothing is really wrong and everything is really wrong.
quotes.name: Ken Willidau

quotes.message: I suffer from post-everything depression. Particularly after signing off the Internet.
quotes.name: Ken Willidau

quotes.message: You know you're depressed when you have daymares.
quotes.name: Ken Willidau

quotes.message: Do I look depressed? People are yelling 'jump' at me, walking through the mall.
quotes.name: Ken Willidau

quotes.message: What, then, is depression? It is hysteria of the spirit.
quotes.name: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.message: There is something unexplainable in depression [Tungsind]. A person with a sorrow or a worry knows why he sorrows or worries. If a depressed person is asked what the reason is, what it is that weighs [tynge] on him, he will answer: I do not know; I cannot explain it. Therein lies the limitlessness of depression.
quotes.name: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.message: [D]epression is something real that one does not delete with the stroke of the pen.
quotes.name: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.message: To destroy an undesirable rate of mental vibration, concentrate on the opposite vibration to the one to be suppressed... What is the source of sadness but feebleness of the mind? What gives it power but the want of reason? Rouse yourself to the combat, and it quits the field before you strike.
quotes.name: Khemetic Saying

quotes.message: Depression never brings me what I want; . My virtue will be warped and marred by it. . If there is a remedy when trouble strikes, . What reason is there for despondency? . And if there is no help for it, .
quotes.name: Shantideva

quotes.message: Despair is a mental state which exaggerates not only our misery but also our weakness.
quotes.name: Marquis De Vauvenargues

quotes.message: It is despair, and despair alone, that begets heroic hope, absurd hope, mad hope.
quotes.name: Miguel de Unamuno

quotes.message: Many an attack of depression is nothing but the expression of regret at having to be virtuous.
quotes.name: Wilhelm Stekel

quotes.message: Men have been depressed now for many years in their male and resplendent selves, depressed into dejection and almost abjection.
quotes.name: D.H. Lawrence

quotes.message: Despair is the absolute extreme of self-love. It is reached when a man deliberately turns his back on all help from anyone else in order to taste the rotten luxury of knowing himself to be lost.
quotes.name: Thomas Merton

quotes.message: Distress tends to make you feel constricted in your personal identity, but if you are thinking of the distress of the whole of humanity, or even just the sadness of people around you in your everyday life, you begin to realize how puny your concern for yourself is.
quotes.name: Vilayat Khan

quotes.message: Hopelessness can arise, I think, only from an inability to face the present, to live in the present, to live as a responsible being among other beings in this sacred world here and now, which is all we have, and all we need to found our hope upon.
quotes.name: Ursula Le Guin

quotes.message: Depression can be a signal to reexamine assumptions and change strategies—a slowing down to reorient. If we are to deal effectively with problems, we have to see them realistically. And we have to define our purpose... The best antidepressants are expression and action—engagement in the struggle. That way depression is not an end, but a meaningful beginning.
quotes.name: Marilyn Ferguson

quotes.message: While I breathe, I hope.
quotes.name: Latin Proverb

quotes.message: Never despair but if you do, work on in despair.
quotes.name: Edmund Burke

quotes.message: Darkness is only driven out with light, not more darkness.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.message: Expect to have hope rekindled. Expect your prayers to be answered in wondrous ways. The dry seasons in life do not last. The spring rains will come again.
quotes.name: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quotes.message: It is both a blessing and a curse to feel everything so very deeply.
quotes.name: David Jones

quotes.message: You say you're depressed—all I see is resilience.
quotes.name: David Mitchell

quotes.message: What mental health needs is more sunlight, more candor, more unashamed conversation.
quotes.name: Glenn Close

quotes.message: I am living in a nightmare, from which from time to time I wake in sleep.
quotes.name: Ursula Le Guin

quotes.message: I am in that temper that if I were under water I would scarcely kick to come to the top.
quotes.name: John Keats

quotes.message: It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane.
quotes.name: Philip K. Dick

quotes.message: I saw the world from the stars' point of view, and it looked unbearably lonely.
quotes.name: Shaun David Hutchinson

quotes.message: In addition to my other numerous acquaintances, I have one more intimate confidant... My depression is the most faithful mistress I have known—no wonder, then, that I return the love.
quotes.name: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.message: Into the darkness they go, the wise and the lovely.
quotes.name: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quotes.message: I was so scared to give up depression, fearing that somehow the worst part of me was actually all of me.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Wurtzel

quotes.message: One need not be a chamber to be haunted.
quotes.name: Emily Dickinson

quotes.message: You are so brave and quiet, I forget you are suffering.
quotes.name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.message: I became insane with long intervals of horrible sanity.
quotes.name: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.message: One of the hardest things was learning that I was worth recovery.
quotes.name: Demi Lovato

quotes.message: A person is, among all else, a material thing, easily torn and not easily mended.
quotes.name: Ian McEwan

quotes.message: Mental pain is less dramatic than physical pain, but it is more common and also more hard to bear.
quotes.name: C.S. Lewis

quotes.message: Our Generation has had no Great war, no Great Depression. Our war is spiritual. Our depression is our lives.
quotes.name: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.message: It is very hard to explain to people who have never known serious depression or anxiety the sheer continuous intensity of it. There is no off switch.
quotes.name: Matt Haig

quotes.message: If you are depressed, you are living in the past. If you are anxious, you are living in the future. If you are at peace you are living in the present.
quotes.name: Lao Tzu

quotes.message: The sun stopped shining for me is all. The whole story is: I am sad. I am sad all the time and the sadness is so heavy that I can’t get away from it. Not ever.
quotes.name: Nina LaCour

quotes.message: The pupil dilates in darkness and in the end finds light, just as the soul dilates in misfortune and in the end finds God.
quotes.name: Victor Hugo

quotes.message: Depression on my left, loneliness on my right. They don’t need to show me their badges. I know these guys very well.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.message: At times, I feel overwhelmed and my depression leads me into darkness.
quotes.name: Dorothy Hamill

quotes.message: Depression taught me the importance of compassion and hard work, and that you can overcome enormous obstacles.
quotes.name: Rob Delaney

quotes.message: Perhaps depression is caused by asking oneself too many unanswerable questions.
quotes.name: Miriam Toews

quotes.message: It’s so difficult to describe depression to someone who’s never been there, because it’s not sadness. I know sadness. Sadness is to cry and to feel. But it’s that cold absence of feeling—that really hollowed-out feeling.
quotes.name: J.K. Rowling

quotes.message: A depressing and difficult passage has prefaced every page I have turned in life.
quotes.name: Charlotte Brontë

quotes.message: The five stages – denial, anger, bargaining, depression, and acceptance – are a part of the framework that makes up our learning to live with the one we lost. They are tools to help us frame and identify what we may be feeling. But they are not stops on some linear timeline in grief.
quotes.name: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quotes.message: Concern should drive us into action and not into a depression. No man is free who cannot control himself.
quotes.name: Pythagoras

quotes.message: Enthusiasm is followed by disappointment and even depression, and then by renewed enthusiasm.
quotes.name: Murray Gell-Mann

quotes.message: It’s recession when your neighbor loses his job; it’s a depression when you lose yours.
quotes.name: Harry Truman

quotes.message: That terrible mood of depression of whether it’s any good or not is what is known as The Artist’s Reward.
quotes.name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.message: Grief is depression in proportion to circumstance; Depression is grief out of proportion to circumstance.
quotes.name: Andrew Solomon

quotes.message: Pain is always emotional. Fear and depression keep constant company with chronic hurting.
quotes.name: Siri Hustvedt

quotes.message: The opposite of play is not work – the opposite of play is depression.
quotes.name: Stuart Brown

quotes.message: All depression has its roots in self-pity, and all self-pity is rooted in people taking themselves too seriously.
quotes.name: Tom Robbins

quotes.message: This is my depressed stance. When you’re depressed, it makes a lot of difference how you stand. The worst thing you can do is straighten up and hold your head high because then you’ll start to feel better. If you’re going to get any joy out of being depressed, you’ve got to stand like this.
quotes.name: Charles Shultz

quotes.message: Noble deeds and hot baths are the best cures for depression.
quotes.name: Dodie Smith

quotes.message: There is no normal life that is free of pain. It’s the very wrestling with our problems that can be the impetus for our growth.
quotes.name: Fred Rogers

quotes.message: There will always be suffering. But we must not suffer over the suffering.
quotes.name: Alan Watts

quotes.message: Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge.
quotes.name: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.message: Only stepping out of the old ruts will bring new insights.
quotes.name: Andy Grove

quotes.message: Before you diagnose yourself with depression or low self-esteem, first make sure that you are not, in fact, just surrounded by assholes.
quotes.name: William Gibson

quotes.message: When people don’t know exactly what depression is, they can be judgmental.
quotes.name: Marion Cotillard

quotes.message: When you’re surrounded by all these people, it can be lonelier than when you’re by yourself. You can be in a huge crowd, but if you don’t feel like you can trust anyone or talk to anybody, you feel like you’re really alone.
quotes.name: Fiona Apple

quotes.message: One swallow does not make a summer, neither does one fine day; similarly one day or brief time of happiness does not make a person entirely happy.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: Do not brood over your past mistakes and failures as this will only fill your mind with grief, regret and depression. Do not repeat them in the future.
quotes.name: Swami Sivananda

quotes.message: If you want to conquer the anxiety of life, live in the moment, live in the breath.
quotes.name: Amit Ray

quotes.message: Don’t try to solve serious matters in the middle of the night.
quotes.name: Philip K. Dick

quotes.message: Life is ten percent what you experience and ninety percent how you respond to it.
quotes.name: Dorothy M. Neddermeyer

quotes.message: A melancholy-looking man, he had the appearance of one who has searched for the leak in life’s gas-pipe with a lighted candle.
quotes.name: P.G. Wodehouse

quotes.message: Crying is one of the highest devotional songs. One who knows crying, knows spiritual practice. If you can cry with a pure heart, nothing else compares to such a prayer. Crying includes all the principles of Yoga.
quotes.name: Kripalvanandji

quotes.message: I didn’t want my picture taken because I was going to cry. I didn’t know why I was going to cry, but I knew that if anybody spoke to me or looked at me too closely the tears would fly out of my eyes and the sobs would fly out of my throat and I’d cry for a week. I could feel the tears brimming and sloshing in me like water in a glass that is unsteady and too full.
quotes.name: Sylvia Plath

quotes.message: The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true.
quotes.name: James Branch Cabell

quotes.message: Tonight, once more, life sinks its teeth into my heart.
quotes.name: Simone De Beauvoir

quotes.message: Nothing can cure the soul but the senses, just as nothing can cure the senses but the soul.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: Being sad and being depressed are two different things. Also, people going through depression don’t look so, while someone sad will look sad. The most common reaction is, ‘How can you be depressed? You have everything going for you.
quotes.name: Deepika Padukone

quotes.message: Recovering from the suicide of a loved one, you need all the help you can get, so I very much recommend a meditation program. The whole picture of how to recover from this has to do with body, mind, and spirit. That’s applicable to any kind of depression.
quotes.name: Judy Collins

quotes.message: The deepest fear we have, ‘the fear beneath all fears,’ is the fear of not measuring up, the fear of judgment. It’s this fear that creates the stress and depression of everyday life.
quotes.name: Tullian Tchividjian

quotes.message: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, ‘There now, hang on, you’ll get over it.’ Sadness is more or less like a head cold – with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.
quotes.name: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.message: I’ve got a bad case of the 3:00 am guilts – you know, when you lie in bed awake and replay all those things you didn’t do right? Because, as we all know, nothing solves insomnia like a nice warm glass of regret, depression and self-loathing.
quotes.name: D.D. Barant

quotes.message: It’s my experience that people are a lot more sympathetic if they can see you hurting, and for the millionth time in my life I wish for measles or smallpox or some other easily understood disease just to make it easier on me and also on them.
quotes.name: Jennifer Niven

quotes.message: I don’t want to see anyone. I lie in the bedroom with the curtains drawn and nothingness washing over me like a sluggish wave. Whatever is happening to me is my own fault. I have done something wrong, something so huge I can’t even see it, something that’s drowning me. I am inadequate and stupid, without worth. I might as well be dead.
quotes.name: Margaret Atwood

quotes.message: A big part of depression is feeling really lonely, even if you’re in a room full of a million people.
quotes.name: Lilly Singh

quotes.message: Depression, for me, has been a couple of different things – but the first time I felt it, I felt helpless, hopeless, and things I had never felt before. I lost myself and my will to live.
quotes.name: Ginger Zee

quotes.message: Depression is being colorblind and constantly told how colorful the world is.
quotes.name: Atticus

quotes.message: Maybe we all have darkness inside of us and some of us are better at dealing with it than others.
quotes.name: Jasmine Warga

quotes.message: Before you were born I carried you under my heart. From the moment you arrived in this world until the moment I leave it, I will always carry you in my heart.
quotes.name: Mandy Harrison

quotes.message: A new baby is like the beginning of all things—wonder, hope, a dream of possibilities.
quotes.name: Eda J. Le Shan

quotes.message: A mother's joy begins when new life is stirring inside...when a tiny heartbeat is heard for the very first time, and a playful kick reminds her that she is never alone.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Life is tough enough without having someone kick you from the inside.
quotes.name: Rita Rudner

quotes.message: Now my belly is as noble as my heart.
quotes.name: Gabriela Mistral

quotes.message: I begin to love this creature, and to anticipate her birth as a fresh twist to a knot, which I do not wish to untie
quotes.name: Mary Wollstonecraft

quotes.message: A baby is an inestimable blessing.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Feeling fat lasts nine months but the joy of becoming a mom lasts forever.
quotes.name: Nikki Dalton

quotes.message: You never understand life until it grows inside of you.
quotes.name: Sandra C. Kassis

quotes.message: Babies are always more trouble than you thought - and more wonderful.
quotes.name: Charles Osgood

quotes.message: It was the tiniest thing I ever decided to put my whole life into.
quotes.name: Terri Guillemets

quotes.message: There is such a special sweetness in being able to participate in creation.
quotes.name: Pamela S. Nadav

quotes.message: Happiness is on the way.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Baby in the tummy, it's all up to mommy. But once the baby's had, it's bragging rights for Dad.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Honey is sweet. A little baby is even sweeter.
quotes.name: Asian saying

quotes.message: You are the closest I will ever come to magic.
quotes.name: Suzanne Finnamore

quotes.message: A grand adventure is about to begin.
quotes.name: Winnie the Pooh

quotes.message: For now in mommy's tummy...Forever in her heart...
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: A baby is God’s opinion that life should go on.
quotes.name: Carl Sandburg

quotes.message: A baby is something you carry inside you for nine months, in your arms for three years and in your heart till the day you die.
quotes.name: Mary Mason

quotes.message: A baby will make love stronger, days shorter, nights longer, bankroll smaller, home happier, clothes shabbier, the past forgotten, and the future worth living for.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: A mother is always the beginning. She is how things begin.
quotes.name: Amy Tan

quotes.message: A woman has two smiles that an angel might envy, the smile that accepts a lover before words are uttered, and the smile that lights on the first born baby, and assures it of a mother’s love.
quotes.name: Thomas Chandler Haliburton

quotes.message: Absolutely. It is the most powerful creation for you to be able have life growing inside of you. There is no bigger gift, nothing more empowering.
quotes.name: Beyoncé

quotes.message: All the time we wondered and wondered, who is this person coming, growing, turning, floating, and swimming deep, deep inside.
quotes.name: Crescent Dragonwagon

quotes.message: An angel in the book of life wrote down my baby’s birth. Then whispered as she closed the book, “too beautiful for earth”.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Babies are bits of star-dust blown from the hand of God. Lucky is the woman who knows the pangs of birth for she has held a star.
quotes.name: Larry Barretto

quotes.message: Before you were conceived I wanted you. Before you were born I loved you. Before you were here an hour I would die for you. This is the miracle of Mother’s Love.
quotes.name: Maureen Hawkins

quotes.message: Birth is not only about making babies. Birth is about making mothers… strong, competent, capable mothers who trust themselves and know their inner strength.
quotes.name: Barbara Katz Rothman

quotes.message: Birth takes a woman’s deepest fears about herself and shows her that she is stronger than them.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Birthing is the most profound initiation to spirituality a woman can have.
quotes.name: Robin Lim

quotes.message: Even when freshly washed and relieved of all obvious confections, children tend to be sticky.
quotes.name: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.message: Every child born into the world is a new thought of God, an ever-fresh and radiant possibility.
quotes.name: Kate Douglas Wiggin

quotes.message: Everything grows rounder and wider and weirder, and I sit here in the middle of it all and wonder who in the world you will turn out to be.
quotes.name: Carrie Fisher

quotes.message: Getting a burp out of your little thing is probably the greatest satisfaction I've come across. It's truly one of life's most satisfying moments.
quotes.name: Brad Pitt

quotes.message: Giving birth and being born brings us into the essence of creation, where the human spirit is courageous and bold and the body, a miracle of wisdom.
quotes.name: Harriette Hartigan

quotes.message: Having a baby changes the way you view your in-laws. I love it when they come to visit now. They can hold the baby and I can go out.
quotes.name: Matthew Broderick

quotes.message: Having a baby is a life-changer. It gives you a whole other perspective on why you wake up every day.
quotes.name: Taylor Hanson

quotes.message: Having kids—the responsibility of rearing good, kind, ethical, responsible human beings—is the biggest job anyone can embark on.
quotes.name: Maria Shriver

quotes.message: I am going to send an angel in front of you, to guard you on the way and to bring you to the place that you have prepared.
quotes.name: Exodus 23: 20

quotes.message: I believe the choice to become a mother is the choice to become one of the greatest spiritual teachers there is.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: I loved you from the very start, you stole my breath, embraced my heart. Our life together has just begun, you’re part of me, my little one.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: If I had my life to live over, instead of wishing away nine months of pregnancy, I’d have cherished every moment and realized that the wonderment growing inside me was the only chance in life to assist God in a miracle.
quotes.name: Erma Bombeck

quotes.message: In giving birth to our babies, we may find that we give birth to new possibilities within ourselves.
quotes.name: Myla and Jon Kabat-Zinn

quotes.message: Life is always a rich and steady time when you are waiting for something to happen or to hatch.
quotes.name: E.B. White

quotes.message: Loving a baby is a circular business, a kind of feedback loop. The more you give the more you get and the more you get the more you feel like giving.
quotes.name: Penelope Leach

quotes.message: Motherhood is the biggest gamble in the world. It is the glorious life force. It’s huge and scary—it’s an act of infinite optimism.
quotes.name: Gilda Radner

quotes.message: No influence is so powerful as that of the mother.
quotes.name: Sarah Josepha Hale

quotes.message: One definition of insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: Pregnancy is a kind of miracle. Especially so in that, it proves that a man and woman can conspire to force God to create a new soul.
quotes.name: Robert Anton Wilson

quotes.message: Sometimes the smallest things take up the most room in your heart.
quotes.name: Winnie the Pooh

quotes.message: The moment a child is born, the mother is also born. She never existed before. The woman existed, but the mother, never. A mother is something absolutely new.
quotes.name: Rajneesh

quotes.message: The natural state of motherhood is unselfishness. When you become a mother, you are no longer the center of your own universe. You relinquish that position to your children.
quotes.name: Jessica Lange

quotes.message: The pain you have been feeling can’t compare to the joy that's coming.
quotes.name: Romans 8: 18

quotes.message: To be pregnant is to be vitally alive, thoroughly woman, and distressingly inhabited. Soul and spirit are stretched – along with body – making pregnancy a time of transition, growth, and profound beginnings.
quotes.name: Anne Christian Buchanan

quotes.message: We have a secret in our culture, and it’s not that birth is painful. It’s that women are strong.
quotes.name: Laura Stavoe Harm

quotes.message: Whether your pregnancy was meticulously planned, medically coaxed, or happened by surprise, one thing is certain – your life will never be the same.
quotes.name: Catherine Jones

quotes.message: With every newborn baby, a little sun rises.
quotes.name: Irmgard Erath

quotes.message: I'd rather be a could-be if I cannot be an are; because a could-be is a maybe who is reaching for a star. I'd rather be a has-been than a might-have-been, by far; for a might have-been has never been, but a has was once an are.
quotes.name: Milton Berle

quotes.message: An inexhaustible good nature is one of the most precious gifts of heaven, spreading itself like oil over the troubled sea of thought, and keeping the mind smooth and equable in the roughest weather.
quotes.name: Washington Irving

quotes.message: No pessimist ever discovered the secret of the stars, or sailed to an uncharted land, or opened a new doorway for the human spirit.
quotes.name: Helen Keller

quotes.message: The cynic knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: Seek out that particular mental attribute which makes you feel most deeply and vitally alive, along with which comes the inner voice which says, 'This is the real me,' and when you have found that attitude, follow it.
quotes.name: James Truslow Adams

quotes.message: The greatest discovery of my generation is that man can alter his life simply by altering his attitude of mind.
quotes.name: James Truslow Adams

quotes.message: A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effort.
quotes.name: Herm Albright

quotes.message: There are no menial jobs, only menial attitudes.
quotes.name: William John Bennett

quotes.message: Writing has laws of perspective, of light and shade just as painting does, or music. If you are born knowing them, fine. If not, learn them. Then rearrange the rules to suit yourself.
quotes.name: Truman Capote

quotes.message: A happy person is not a person in a certain set of circumstances, but rather a person with a certain set of attitudes.
quotes.name: Hugh Downs

quotes.message: Weakness of attitude becomes weakness of character.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: The last of the human freedoms - to choose one's attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one's own way.
quotes.name: Dr Viktor E Frankl

quotes.message: Your mental attitude is someting you can control outright and you must use self-discipline until you create a Positive Mental Attitude -- your mental attitude attracts to you everything that makes you what you are.
quotes.name: Napolean Hill

quotes.message: Certain thoughts are prayers. There are moments when; whatever be the attitude of the body, the soul is on its knees.
quotes.name: Victor Hugo

quotes.message: Any fact facing us is not as important as our attitude toward it, for that determines our success or failure.
quotes.name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.message: Never solve a problem from its original perspective.
quotes.name: Charles Thompson

quotes.message: Happiness is an attitude of mind, born of the simple determination to be happy under all outward circumstances.
quotes.name: J Donald Walters

quotes.message: Life is too short to spend your precious time trying to convince a person who wants to live in gloom and doom otherwise. Give lifting that person your best shot, but don't hang around long enough for his or her bad attitude to pull you down. Instead, surround yourself with optimistic people.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: I am still determined to be cheerful and happy, in whatever situation I may be; for I have also learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances.
quotes.name: Martha Washington

quotes.message: In the depths of winter I finally learned there was in me an invincible summer.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: A will finds a way.
quotes.name: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.message: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
quotes.name: Reinhold Niebuhr

quotes.message: Every exit is an entry somewhere.
quotes.name: Tom Stoppard

quotes.message: Setting too good an example is a kind of slander seldom forgiven.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile, hoping it will eat him last.
quotes.name: Winston Churchill

quotes.message: I've learned ... that even when I have pains, I don't have to be one.
quotes.name: Andy Rooney

quotes.message: The control center of your life is your attitude.
quotes.name: Norman Cousins

quotes.message: Things turn out best for the people who make the best out of the way things turn out.
quotes.name: Art Linkletter

quotes.message: Talents, to strike the eye of posterity, should be concentrated: rays powerless while they are scattered, burn in a point.
quotes.name: Robert Eldridge Aris Willmott

quotes.message: Talent is a dreadfully cheap commodity, cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: A talent somewhat above mediocrity, shrewd and not too sensitive, is more likely to rise in the world than genius.
quotes.name: Charles Cooley

quotes.message: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.
quotes.name: John Wooden

quotes.message: Every man has his own vocation, talent is the call.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: I'd rather have a lot of talent and a little experience than a lot of experience and a little talent.
quotes.name: John Wooden

quotes.message: Talent isn't genius, and no amount of energy can make it so. I want to be great, or nothing. I won't be a commonplace dauber, so I don't intend to try any more.
quotes.name: Louisa May Alcott

quotes.message: Everybody is talented because everybody who is human has something to express.
quotes.name: Brenda Ueland

quotes.message: Talent is a matter of quantity. Talent does not write on page, it writes three hundred.
quotes.name: Jules Renard

quotes.message: Your talent determines what you can do. Your motivation determines how much you are willing to do. Your attitude determines how well you do it.
quotes.name: Lou Holtz

quotes.message: Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads.
quotes.name: Erica Jong

quotes.message: Everyone has talent at twenty-five. The difficulty is to have it at fifty.
quotes.name: Edgar Degas

quotes.message: Talent without working hard is nothing.
quotes.name: Cristiano Ronaldo

quotes.message: However you make your living is where your talent lies.
quotes.name: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.message: If you ever find that you're the most talented person in the room, you need to find another room.
quotes.name: Austin Kleon

quotes.message: Children's talent to endure stems from their ignorance of alternatives.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: Never confuse the size of your paycheck with the size of your talent.
quotes.name: Marlon Brando

quotes.message: Talent is a dull knife that will cut nothing unless it is wielded with great force.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: Talent for talent's sake is a bauble and a show. Talent working with joy in the cause of universal truth lifts the possessor to new power as a benefactor.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: We must believe that we are gifted for something, and that this thing, at whatever cost, must be attained.
quotes.name: Marie Curie

quotes.message: It takes little talent to see clearly what lies under one's nose, a good deal of it to know in which direction to point that organ.
quotes.name: W. H. Auden

quotes.message: This is how I define talent; it is a gift that God has given us in secret, which we reveal without knowing it.
quotes.name: Montesquieu

quotes.message: Talent is a tenant in the house owned by genius.
quotes.name: Austin O'Malley

quotes.message: Talent is never static. It's always growing or dying.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: There are two kinds of talent, man-made talent and God-given talent. With man-made talent you have to work very hard. With God-given talent, you just touch it up once in a while.
quotes.name: Pearl Bailey

quotes.message: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
quotes.name: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.message: The idea that talent is directly proportional to your trophy cabinet is one I oppose.
quotes.name: Alex Turner

quotes.message: Talent is nothing but a prolonged period of attention and a shortened period of mental assimilation.
quotes.name: Constantin Stanislavski

quotes.message: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
quotes.name: Henry Van Dyke

quotes.message: Talent means nothing, while experience, acquired in humility and with hard work, means everything.
quotes.name: Patrick Süskind

quotes.message: The most gifted natures are perhaps also the most trembling.
quotes.name: Andre Gide

quotes.message: Talent is always conscious of its own abundance, and does not object to sharing.
quotes.name: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quotes.message: It is a happy talent to know how to play.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Talent develops in quiet places, character in the full current of human life.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me.
quotes.name: Erma Bombeck

quotes.message: In the battle of existence, Talent is the punch; Tact is the clever footwork.
quotes.name: Wilson Mizner

quotes.message: We are told that talent creates its own opportunities. But it sometimes seems that intense desire creates not only its own opportunities but its own talents.
quotes.name: Eric Hoffer

quotes.message: Talent is cheaper than table salt. What separates the talented individual from the successful one is a lot of hard work.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: There is no substitute for talent. Industry and all the virtues are of no avail.
quotes.name: Aldous Huxley

quotes.message: Artistic talent is a gift from God and whoever discovers it in himself has a certain obligation: to know that he cannot waste this talent, but must develop it.
quotes.name: Pope John Paul II

quotes.message: Access to talented and creative people is to modern business what access to coal and iron ore was to steel-making.
quotes.name: Richard Florida

quotes.message: The greatest talents often lie buried out of sight.
quotes.name: Plautus

quotes.message: Talent is commonly developed at the expense of character.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: I believe that every person is born with talent.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: Not he deserves praise that has talents, but he that uses them.
quotes.name: Ivan Panin

quotes.message: It's not the act of arrogance to draw, it's humbling you must use your God-given talent. And of all the people I sketch, in most cases I feel I have to measure up to the subject.
quotes.name: LeRoy Neiman

quotes.message: Bloom where you're planted.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Curiosity killed the cat.
quotes.name: E. O'Neill

quotes.message: Don't bite off more than you can chew.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Even though you have ten thousand fields, you can eat but one measure of rice a day.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: Every man has his price.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Gold is the devil's fishhook.
quotes.name: Italian

quotes.message: If passion drives, let reason hold the reins.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: If you don't want trouble, don't go looking for it.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: It's better to find a whole worm in your apple than half a worm.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Never pick up what you didn't put down.
quotes.name: Virgin Islander

quotes.message: Never trouble trouble 'til trouble troubles you.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Nor eye in a letter, nor hand in a purse, nor ear in the secret of another.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: The bigger they are, the harder they fall.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: The crow may be caged but his thoughts are in the cornfield.
quotes.name: Belizean
