quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: Tolerance is the positive and cordial effort to understand another's beliefs, practices, and habits without necessarily sharing or accepting them.
quotes.name: Joshua Liebman

quotes.message: Tolerance and celebration of individual differences is the fire that fuels lasting love.
quotes.name: Tom Hannah

quotes.message: Tolerance is the oil which takes the friction out of life.
quotes.name: Wilbert E. Scheer

quotes.message: Tolerance is giving to every other human being every right that you claim for yourself.
quotes.name: Robert Green Ingersoll

quotes.message: Tolerance only for those who agree with you is no tolerance at all.
quotes.name: Ray Davis

quotes.message: What is tolerance?--it is the consequence of humanity. We are all formed of frailty and error; let us pardon reciprocally each other's folly--that is the first law of nature.
quotes.name: Voltaire

quotes.message: Tolerance comes of age. I see no fault committed that I myself could not have committed at some time or other.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
quotes.name: Ralph W. Sockman

quotes.message: Tolerance becomes a crime when applied to evil.
quotes.name: Thomas Mann

quotes.message: Sometimes true tolerance requires an extraordinary strength, which we are often too weak to exercise.
quotes.name: Fausto Cercignani

quotes.message: Unlimited tolerance must lead to the disappearance of tolerance. If we extend unlimited tolerance even to those who are intolerant, if we are not prepared to defend a tolerant society against the onslaught of the intolerant, then the tolerant will be destroyed, and tolerance with them. [...] We should therefore claim, in the name of tolerance, the right not to tolerate the intolerant.
quotes.name: Karl Popper

quotes.message: Compassion and tolerance are not a sign of weakness, but a sign of strength.
quotes.name: Tenzin Gyatso

quotes.message: The responsibility of tolerance lies with those who have the wider vision.
quotes.name: George Eliot

quotes.message: Toleration is good for all, or it is good for none.
quotes.name: Edmund Burke

quotes.message: Tolerance is the virtue of the man without convictions.
quotes.name: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.message: Tolerance is the eager and glad acceptance of the way along which others seek the truth.
quotes.name: Sir Walter Besant

quotes.message: Tolerance is a very dull virtue. It is boring. Unlike love, it has always had a bad press. It is negative. It merely means putting up with people, being able to stand things.
quotes.name: E. M. Forster

quotes.message: Tolerance implies a respect for another person, not because he is wrong or even because he is right, but because he is human.
quotes.name: John Cogley Commonweal

quotes.message: Tolerance is another word for indifference.
quotes.name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.message: The highest result of education is tolerance.
quotes.name: Helen Keller

quotes.message: Tolerance implies a gratuitous assumption of the inferiority of other faiths to one's own.
quotes.name: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.message: We tend to idealize tolerance, then wonder why we find ourselves infested with losers and nut cases.
quotes.name: Patrick Nielsen Hayden

quotes.message: Tolerance can lead to learning something.
quotes.name: Jakob Dylan

quotes.message: Tolerance is the first principle of community; it is the spirit which conserves the best that all men think.
quotes.name: Helen Keller

quotes.message: Tolerance it a tremendous virtue, but the immediate neighbors of tolerance are apathy and weakness.
quotes.name: James Goldsmith

quotes.message: Tolerance is held to be a condition of mind which is encouraged by, and is necessary for, civilization.
quotes.name: Arthur Keith

quotes.message: Tolerance always has limits - it cannot tolerate what is itself actively intolerant.
quotes.name: Sidney Hook

quotes.message: Tolerance is the ability to forgive those who tend to speak before thinking.
quotes.name: Catherine Pulsifer

quotes.message: Tolerance isn't about not having beliefs. It's about how your beliefs lead you to treat people who disagree with you.
quotes.name: Timothy Keller

quotes.message: Tolerance of intolerance is cowardice.
quotes.name: Ayaan Hirsi Ali

quotes.message: Tolerance is nothing more than patience with boundaries.
quotes.name: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.message: The human family is very diverse, with many different beliefs and cultures and ways of life. Many conflicts in our world are caused when people are intolerant of the ways that others see the world. Learning tolerance is an important cornerstone to creating a better world.
quotes.name: Robert Alan Silverstein

quotes.message: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: One of the greatest disasters of our time is our universal acceptance of the word 'tolerance' as a great virtue.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: We are in favor of tolerance, but it is a very difficult thing to tolerate the intolerant and impossible to tolerate the intolerable.
quotes.name: George Dennison Prentice

quotes.message: Toleration is the greatest gift of the mind; it requires the same effort of the brain that it takes to balance oneself on a bicycle.
quotes.name: Helen Keller

quotes.message: Tolerance is the virtue of men who don't believe in anything.
quotes.name: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.message: Tolerance is often championed by people who nothing to stand for.
quotes.name: Woodrow Kroll

quotes.message: How do we create a harmonious society out of so many kinds of people? The key is tolerance--the one value that is indispensable in creating community.
quotes.name: Barbara Jordan

quotes.message: Tolerance is the only real test of civilization.
quotes.name: Arthur Helps

quotes.message: The reward of tolerance is the presence of peace of mind.
quotes.name: Ky Vanchhay

quotes.message: I have seen great intolerance shown in support of tolerance.
quotes.name: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.message: Nothing is more conducive to peace of mind than not having any opinion at all.
quotes.name: G. C. Lichtenberg

quotes.message: Tolerance is you saying something crazy and me smiling and saying, 'That's nice.
quotes.name: Penn Jillette

quotes.message: I think more tolerance, more people having more access to a chance to be literate, and a chance to stay healthy makes for a more peaceful planet.
quotes.name: Henry Rollins

quotes.message: Those wearing tolerance for a label call other views intolerable.
quotes.name: Phyllis McGinley

quotes.message: The word 'tolerance' once meant we all have the right to argue rationally for our deepest convictions in the public arena. Now it means those convictions are not even subject to rational debate.
quotes.name: Nancy Pearcey

quotes.message: If a problem is fixable, if a situation is such that you can do something about it, then there is no need to worry. If it's not fixable, then there is no help in worrying. There is no benefit in worrying whatsoever.
quotes.name: Dalai Lama XIV

quotes.message: People become attached to their burdens sometimes more than the burdens are attached to them.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
quotes.name: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.message: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power of our will.
quotes.name: Epictetus

quotes.message: Let our advance worrying become advance thinking and planning.
quotes.name: Winston Churchill

quotes.message: If you believe that feeling bad or worrying long enough will change a past or future event, then you are residing on another planet with a different reality system.
quotes.name: William James

quotes.message: The only thing you will ever accomplish by worrying is to elevate your stress levels.
quotes.name: Catherine Pulsifer

quotes.message: Worry a little bit every day and in a lifetime you will lose a couple of years. If something is wrong, fix it if you can. But train yourself not to worry. Worry never fixes anything.
quotes.name: Mary Hemingway

quotes.message: Worry is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged, it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.
quotes.name: Arthur Somers Roche

quotes.message: He is rich who owns the day, and no one owns the day who allows it to be invaded with fret and anxiety.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: The more you pray, the less you'll panic. The more you worship, the less you worry. You'll feel more patient and less pressured.
quotes.name: Rick Warren

quotes.message: Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow.
quotes.name: Swedish Proverb

quotes.message: If you can't sleep, then get up and do something instead of lying there worrying. It's the worry that gets you, not the lack of sleep.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Happy is the man who has broken the chains which hurt the mind, and has given up worrying once and for all.
quotes.name: Ovid

quotes.message: The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Present fears are less than horrible imaginings.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: How much pain have cost us the evils that have never happened.
quotes.name: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.message: Worrying about it takes precious time and attention away from your priorities and increases your feelings of dissatisfaction about life.
quotes.name: Christina Winsey-Rudd

quotes.message: My life has been full of terrible misfortunes most of which never happened.
quotes.name: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.message: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: There is a great difference between worry and concern. A worried person sees a problem, and a concerned person solves a problem.
quotes.name: Harold Stephens

quotes.message: There is nothing that wastes the body like worry, and one who has any faith in God should be ashamed to worry about anything whatsoever.
quotes.name: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.message: Therefore do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.
quotes.name: Matthew 6:34

quotes.message: And which of you by being anxious can add a single hour to his span of life?
quotes.name: Luke 12:25

quotes.message: Anxiety in a man's heart weighs him down, but a good word makes him glad.
quotes.name: Proverbs 12:25

quotes.message: If your teeth are clenched and your fists are clenched, your lifespan is probably clenched.
quotes.name: Adabella Radici

quotes.message: Whatever is going to happen will happen, whether we worry or not.
quotes.name: Ana Monnar

quotes.message: Fear is pain arising from the anticipation of evil.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: Worrying sucks.
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: Is excessive worrying a life style of choice or by reason?
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: From my own personal experiences, worrying will not only stress you, but could possibly lead to serious health complications.
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: I began to accept that worrying is nothing but a sick unrealistic delusion that I had allowed to control me.
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: Worry will not help us change the situation overnight.
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: You will remain defeated when in worry.
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: Worry will destroy you if you allow it to.
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: Let worry no longer disrupt or control your happiness.
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: Worry will hinder you from becoming the best version of yourself.
quotes.name: Porchia Danielle

quotes.message: If you devoted half as much time and energy to solving your problems as you do to worrying about them, you wouldn't have any worries.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: Worrying is just a vicious habit you have learned.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: Find out precisely what is the problem you are worrying about.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: The toughest opponent I ever fought was worry.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: I realized that I had learn to stop worrying, or worry would sap my vitality and undermine my success.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: What a fool you are to be worrying about something than hasn't happened and may never happen.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: I kept reminding myself that losing sleep and worrying would destroy my health.
quotes.name: Dale Carnegie

quotes.message: One of the ways worriers have learned to cope is by not telling others about our worrying for fear they will start worrying.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: Somehow, we believe we are such good cons that if we don't tell others about our worrying they will not know that we are worrying.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: It's difficult to see our worry as self-centered even when we are worrying about ourselves.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: Since much worry can go under the guise of worrying about others, we get away with it.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: We are worrying about something that may or may not happen. When we are mentally and emotionally preparing for something that might happen, we withdraw into ourselves and become self-absorbed.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: When we are worrying about something that might happen, we are not trusting that we simply do have all the wisdom and information about this particular issue and ultimately things will work out as they will whether it is what we thought we wanter or not.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: Life is too short for worrying.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: Worrying is the one skill that can be applied to everything in life.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: We complain about our worrying, but let someone say something bad about worrying or try to take it away from us and we are ready to challenge Goliath himself.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: The process of worrying includes such issues as how people worry, when they worry, where they worry, and how worry affects them.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: The content of worrying is what people worry about - well, almost everything - children, money, self-esteem, health, what other people think of them, the weather, promotions, the future, the past, the present.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: We sort our lives into carefully labeled boxes: things we definitely need to worry about; things we may need to worry about; things we already have worried about and it didn't do any good; things we worried about where there was a definite payoff; things we are worried about worrying about; things that we definitely do not need to worry about.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: Somehow, worrying doesn't have the same status as 'doing'.
quotes.name: Anne Wilson Schaef

quotes.message: The result was that we spent time vividly worrying about a terrible problem that was almost guaranteed not to happen.
quotes.name: David A. Carbonell

quotes.message: Something is worrying me, yeah and that something is driving me in misery, oh. I can tell the way things change.
quotes.name: Otis Redding

quotes.message: Ain't no need to worrying. What the night is gonna bring because it will be all over in the morning.
quotes.name: The Winans

quotes.message: You keep worrying about yourself. Yeah, you keep worrying about yourself. Oh, it leads to nowhere else. If you keep worry, worry, worrying.
quotes.name: Nizlopi

quotes.message: Why you keep on worrying yourself? Keep worrying yourself, so much. If your love is mine then let me know.
quotes.name: Toots & the Maytals

quotes.message: No more worrying, worrying and pains. No more crying, shedding tears like rain.
quotes.name: Bunny Wailer

quotes.message: As soon as I stop worrying (soon as I stopped worrying). Worrying how the story ends (When I let go).
quotes.name: DeWayne Woods

quotes.message: Stop worrying over nothing. Stop worrying over me.
quotes.name: Tegan and Sara

quotes.message: Although people often have the experience of worrying for long periods of time throughout the day, there are actually very few new worries surfacing during that time.
quotes.name: David A. Carbonell

quotes.message: Worrying is like rocking in a chair -it's something to do, but you don't get anywhere.
quotes.name: Lisa Gutierrez

quotes.message: Worrying is a waste of time and energy.
quotes.name: Andrée Nicole

quotes.message: I feel I will have nothing to worry about if I could just stop worrying.
quotes.name: Joseph Julius Bonkowski

quotes.message: Don't worry about worrying; it's as simple as that.
quotes.name: Joseph Julius Bonkowski

quotes.message: Worrying is stupid. It's like walking around with an umbrella waiting for it to rain.
quotes.name: Wiz Khalifa

quotes.message: If you are worrying, quit; if you haven't started, don't.
quotes.name: John MacArthur

quotes.message: Stop worrying.
quotes.name: John MacArthur

quotes.message: Providing for tomorrow is good, but worrying about tomorrow is a sin because God is the God of tomorrow just as He is the God of today.
quotes.name: Lamentations 3:23

quotes.message: By worrying about tomorrow, many believers miss the victory God would give them today,
quotes.name: John MacArthur

quotes.message: Instead of worrying about problems we cannot solve, we should say, 'Lord, you are bigger than history. You own everything in the entire universe. You can do anything you want to do. You love me and promise I will never be without the things I need.
quotes.name: John MacArthur

quotes.message: In matters of truth and justice, there is no difference between large and small problems, for issues concerning the treatment of people are all the same.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: The dead cannot cry out for justice. It is a duty of the living to do so for them.
quotes.name: Lois McMaster Bujold

quotes.message: There may be times when we are powerless to prevent injustice, but there must never be a time when we fail to protest.
quotes.name: Elie Weasel

quotes.message: Social justice cannot be attained by violence. Violence kills what it intends to create.
quotes.name: Pope John Paul II

quotes.message: Justice will not be served until those who are unaffected are as outraged as those who are.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: We are not to simply bandage the wounds of victims beneath the wheels of injustice, we are to drive a spoke into the wheel itself.
quotes.name: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quotes.message: If one really wishes to know how justice is administered in a country, one does not question the policemen, the lawyers, the judges, or the protected members of the middle class. One goes to the unprotected--those, precisely, who need the law's protection most!--and listens to their testimony.
quotes.name: James Baldwin

quotes.message: Men often mistake killing and revenge for justice. They seldom have the stomach for justice.
quotes.name: Robert Jordan

quotes.message: Justice? -- You get justice in the next world. In this one you have the law.
quotes.name: William Gaddis

quotes.message: Courage is of no value unless accompanied by justice; yet if all men became just, there would be no need for courage.
quotes.name: Agesilaus the Second

quotes.message: Justice requires that to lawfully constituted Authority there be given that respect and obedience which is its due; that the laws which are made shall be in wise conformity with the common good; and that, as a matter of conscience all men shall render obedience to these laws.
quotes.name: Pope Pius XI

quotes.message: Laws catch flies but let hornets go free.
quotes.name: Scottish

quotes.message: Justice is the constant and perpetual will to allot to every man his due.
quotes.name: Domitus Ulpian

quotes.message: Justice consists not in being neutral between right and wrong, but in finding out the right and upholding it, wherever found, against the wrong.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: Little thieves are hanged but great ones escape.
quotes.name: 14th Century French Proverb

quotes.message: Justice is conscience, not a personal conscience but the conscience of the whole of humanity.
quotes.name: Alexander Solzhenitsyn

quotes.message: Equal justice under law is not merely a caption on the facade of the Supreme Court building, it is perhaps the most inspiring ideal of our society. It is one of the ends for which our entire legal system exists...it is fundamental that justice should be the same, in substance and availability, without regard to economic status.
quotes.name: Lewis Powell, Jr.

quotes.message: If we do not maintain justice, justice will not maintain us.
quotes.name: Francis Bacon

quotes.message: The failure to invest in civil justice is directly related to the increase in criminal disorder. The more people feel there is injustice the more it becomes part of their psyche.
quotes.name: Wilhelm Joseph

quotes.message: Throughout history, it has been the inaction of those who could have acted, the indifference of those who should have known better, the silence of the voice of justice when it mattered most, that has made it possible for evil to triumph.
quotes.name: Haile Selassie

quotes.message: Justice is the means by which established injustices are sanctioned.
quotes.name: Anatole France

quotes.message: This thing that men call justice, this blind snake that strikes men down in the dark, mindless with fury, keep your hand back from it, pass by in silence.
quotes.name: Maxwell Anderson

quotes.message: The just man is not the product of a day, but of a long brooding and a painful birth. To become a power for peace, a man must first pass through experiences which lead him to see things in their different aspects: it is necessary that he have a wide horizon, and breathe various atmospheres--in a word, from crossing, one after another, paths and points of view the most diverse, and sometimes the most contradictory, he must acquire the faculty of putting himself in the place of others and appreciating them.
quotes.name: Charles Wagner

quotes.message: The need for justice grows out of the conflict of human interests. That is to say, if there were no conflict of interests among mankind we should never have invented the word justice, nor conceived the idea for which it stands.
quotes.name: Thomas Nixon Carver

quotes.message: Justice is always violent to the party offending, for every man is innocent in his own eyes.
quotes.name: Daniel Defoe

quotes.message: Justice is the tolerable accommodation of the conflicting interests of society, and I don't believe there is any royal road to attain such accommodation concretely.
quotes.name: Judge Learned Hand

quotes.message: The whole history of the world is summed up in the fact that, when nations are strong, they are not always just, and when they wish to be just, they are no longer strong.
quotes.name: Winston Churchill

quotes.message: Injustice is relatively easy to bear; it is justice that hurts.
quotes.name: H.L. Mencken

quotes.message: Justice should remove the bandage from her eyes long enough to distinguish between the vicious and the unfortunate.
quotes.name: Robert G. Ingersoll

quotes.message: Justice in the life and conduct of the State is possible only as first it resides in the hearts and souls of the citizens
quotes.name: Plato

quotes.message: Peace is not the absence of war but the presence of justice.
quotes.name: Harrison Ford

quotes.message: Where there are too many policemen, there is no liberty. Where there are too many soldiers, there is no peace. Where there are too many lawyers, there is no justice.
quotes.name: Lyn Yutang

quotes.message: The administration of justice is the firmest pillar of government
quotes.name: George Washington

quotes.message: Law in origin was merely a codification of the power of dominant groups, and did not aim at anything that to a modern man would appear to be justice
quotes.name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.message: The best safeguard against fascism is to establish social justice to the maximum extent possible.
quotes.name: Arnold Toynbee

quotes.message: Justice has nothing to do with what goes on in a courtroom; Justice is what comes out of a courtroom
quotes.name: Clarence Darrow

quotes.message: In the halls of justice, the only justice is in the halls.
quotes.name: Lenny Bruce

quotes.message: You know, the courts may not be working any more, but as long as everyone is videotaping everyone else, justice will be done.
quotes.name: Marge Simpson

quotes.message: Justice is incidental to law and order.
quotes.name: John Edgar Hoover

quotes.message: A sense of justice is a noble fancy.
quotes.name: Esaias Tegnér

quotes.message: The foundation of justice is good faith.
quotes.name: Cicero

quotes.message: The love of justice is, in most men, nothing more than the fear of suffering injustice
quotes.name: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: Extreme justice is often injustice.
quotes.name: Jean Racine

quotes.message: The deceitful have no friends.
quotes.name: Hindi

quotes.message: Justice is a contract of expediency, entered upon to prevent men harming or being harmed.
quotes.name: Epicurus

quotes.message: A rule isn't unfair if it applies to everyone.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: The end doesn't justify the means.
quotes.name: Ovid

quotes.message: Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends.
quotes.name: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.message: Ladies who play with fire must remember that smoke gets in their eyes.
quotes.name: Mae West

quotes.message: Truth never damages a cause that is just.
quotes.name: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.message: It is better to risk saving a guilty person than to condemn an innocent one.
quotes.name: Voltaire

quotes.message: The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice.
quotes.name: Theodore Parker

quotes.message: For there is but one essential justice which cements society, and one law which establishes this justice. This law is right reason, which is the true rule of all commandments and prohibitions. Whoever neglects this law, whether written or unwritten, is necessarily unjust and wicked.
quotes.name: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.message: Never forget that justice is what love looks like in public.
quotes.name: Cornel West

quotes.message: I have always found that mercy bears richer fruits than strict justice
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: Each of us is more than the worst thing we’ve ever done.
quotes.name: Bryan Stevenson

quotes.message: Rats and roaches live by competition under the laws of supply and demand; it is the privilege of human beings to live under the laws of justice and mercy.
quotes.name: Wendell Berry

quotes.message: Halls of justice painted green . Money talking . Power wolves beset your door .
quotes.name: Kirk Hammett

quotes.message: Brothers are we, marching on the roads of time . From this broken land and the days that defined us . All men are free, justice is a sword we hold . Trusting in the knights noble vow In the brotherhood that binds us.
quotes.name: Jones

quotes.message: We lay our case before you . Let your hammer fall . Tip the scales of justice . Liberty for all.
quotes.name: Petery Rooney Byford

quotes.message: A city of justice, a city of love, a city of peace . For everyone of us . We all need it, can't live without it.
quotes.name: Robert S. Kelly

quotes.message: Wheels of Justice turning . Bring me home to you . If justice has true meaning . I'll spend my days with you.
quotes.name: James Reeder

quotes.message: No way out gotta stand strong . Can't you see that I'm not wrong . That's the way it is and can't you see . Street justice for you and me.
quotes.name: Harley Flanagan

quotes.message: So must we rev'rence God, as first to knows . Justice from Him, not from ourselves, doth flow . God those accepts who to mankind are friends . Whose justice far as their own power extends.
quotes.name: John Denham

quotes.message: Truth Justice loves, and truth injustice fears, . Truth above all things a just man reveres.
quotes.name: John Denham

quotes.message: When justice on offenders is not done, . Law, government, and commerce, are o'erthrown.
quotes.name: John Denham

quotes.message: Justice with weight and measure must proceed . Yet when pronouncing sentence, seem not glad . Such spectacles, though they are just, are sad.
quotes.name: John Denham

quotes.message: Justice, when equal scales she holds, is blind . Nor cruelty, nor mercy, change her mind.
quotes.name: John Denham

quotes.message: WHAT do the scales of Justice hold . Poised even in that steady hand? . What is that measure closely scanned? . Is one side weighted down with gold? .
quotes.name: Bessie Rayner Parkes

quotes.message: With level brows this Justice stands . And weighs her duties one by one . And if she pleads, or if commands . It is lest these be left undone.
quotes.name: Bessie Rayner Parkes

quotes.message: Or slurred through weakness and constraint . This noble Justice was not bred . In hearts defiled with any taint . Of selfish seeking, dark and dead.
quotes.name: Bessie Rayner Parkes

quotes.message: It is my strong belief . God's justice will heal The wounds and griefs . I have suffered from that Years and years.
quotes.name: Ehsan Sehgal

quotes.message: Before we lose the word . That bids new worlds to birth, . Needs must we loosen first the sword Of Justice upon earth . Or else all else is vain . Since life on earth began . And the spent world sinks back again . Hopeless of God and Man.
quotes.name: Rudyard Kipling

quotes.message: TWO lawyers to their cause so well adhered . A country justice quite confused appeared . By them the facts were rendered so obscure . With which the truth remained he was not sure.
quotes.name: La Fontaine

quotes.message: When you've been denied justice... you are incomplete. It feels that God has abandoned you in a stark place. I asked God... I think we all did... what we should do, and he said do what is right. And I thought if I did, it would make me complete again.
quotes.name: Agatha Christie

quotes.message: Justice delayed is justice denied.
quotes.name: Edward Allen Bernero

quotes.message: The conviction that justice involves virtue as well as choice runs deep. Thinking about justice seems inescapably to engage us in thinking about the best way to live.
quotes.name: Michael J. Sandel

quotes.message: Modern theories of justice try to separate questions of fairness and rights from arguments about honor, virtue, and moral desert.
quotes.name: Michael J. Sandel

quotes.message: They seek principles of justice that are neural among ends, and enable people to choose and pursue their ends for themselves.
quotes.name: Michael J. Sandel

quotes.message: Justice discriminates according to merit, according to the relevant excellence.
quotes.name: Michael J. Sandel

quotes.message: Justice is primarily a possible, but not a necessary, quality of a social order regulating the mutual relations of men.
quotes.name: Hans Kelsen

quotes.message: The longing for justice is men's eternal longing for happiness. It is happiness that man cannot find alone, as an isolated individual, and hence seeks in sociaty.
quotes.name: Hans Kelsen

quotes.message: Justice is social happiness. It is happiness guaranteed by a social order.
quotes.name: Hans Kelsen

quotes.message: The desire for justice is so elementary, and so deeply rooted in the human mind, because it is a manifestation of man's indestructible desire for his own subjective happiness.
quotes.name: Hans Kelsen

quotes.message: The idea of justice is transformed from a principle guaranteeing the individual happiness of all subjects, into a social order protecting certain interests socially.
quotes.name: Hans Kelsen

quotes.message: Every system of values, especially a system of morals and its central idea of justice, is a social phenomenon, the product of a society, and hence different according to the nature of the society within which it arises.
quotes.name: Hans Kelsen

quotes.message: Death never takes a wise man by surprise; he is always ready to go.
quotes.name: Jean de la Fontaine

quotes.message: Six feet of earth makes us all equal.
quotes.name: Italian

quotes.message: No one wants to die. Even people who want to go to heaven don't want to die to get there. And yet death is the destination we all share. No one has ever escaped it. And that is as it should be, because Death is very likely the single best invention of Life. It is Life's change agent. It clears out the old to make way for the new.
quotes.name: Steve Jobs

quotes.message: Death is nothing, but to live defeated and inglorious is to die daily.
quotes.name: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.message: I would rather die a meaningful death than to live a meaningless life.
quotes.name: Corazon Aquino

quotes.message: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: I am not afraid of death, I just don't want to be there when it happens.
quotes.name: Woody Allen

quotes.message: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure.
quotes.name: J.K. Rowling

quotes.message: Life is for the living. Death is for the dead. Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid.
quotes.name: Langston Hughes

quotes.message: When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.
quotes.name: Laurie Halse Anderson

quotes.message: Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn.
quotes.name: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.message: I'm not afraid of death. It's the stake one puts up in order to play the game of life.
quotes.name: Jean Giraudoux

quotes.message: To himself everyone is immortal; he may know that he is going to die, but he can never know that he is dead.
quotes.name: Samuel Butler

quotes.message: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: A man does not die of love or his liver or even of old age; he dies of being a man.
quotes.name: Percival Arland Ussher

quotes.message: Death is a distant rumor to the young.
quotes.name: Andrew A. Rooney

quotes.message: Life is eternal, and love is immortal, and death is only a horizon; and a horizon is nothing save the limit of our sight.
quotes.name: Rossiter Worthington Raymond

quotes.message: To fear death, my friends, is only to think ourselves wise, without being wise: for it is to think that we know what we do not know. For anything that men can tell, death may be the greatest good that can happen to them: but they fear it as if they knew quite well that it was the greatest of evils.
quotes.name: Socrates

quotes.message: Every man must do two things alone; he must do his own believing and his own dying.
quotes.name: Martin Luther

quotes.message: Death is the wish of some, the relief of many, and the end of all.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Our dead are never dead to us, until we have forgotten them.
quotes.name: George Eliot

quotes.message: Good men must die, but death cannot kill their names.
quotes.name: Proverb

quotes.message: Thank Heaven! the crisis --The danger, is past, and the lingering illness, is over at last --, and the fever called ''Living'' is conquered at last.
quotes.name: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.message: Death - the last sleep? No, it is the final awakening.
quotes.name: Walter Scott

quotes.message: A single death is a tragedy, a million deaths is a statistic.
quotes.name: Joseph Stalin

quotes.message: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
quotes.name: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quotes.message: The boundaries between life and death are at best shadowy and vague.
quotes.name: Edgar Allen Poe

quotes.message: Death is the veil which those who live call life: They sleep, and it is lifted.
quotes.name: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.message: Dying is like getting audited by the IRS—something that only happens to other people ... until it happens to you.
quotes.name: Jerome P. Crabb

quotes.message: We all labour against our own cure, for death is the cure of all diseases.
quotes.name: Sir Thomas Browne

quotes.message: Dying is like coming to the end of a long novel—you only regret it if the ride was enjoyable and left you wanting more.
quotes.name: Jerome P. Crabb

quotes.message: Death is a new office building filled with modern furniture, A wise thing, but which has no purpose for us.
quotes.name: John Ashbery

quotes.message: For death is but a passing phase of Life; A change of dress, a disrobing; A birth into the unborn again; A commencing where we ended; A starting where we stopped to rest; A crossroad of Eternity; A giving up of something, to possess all things. The end of the unreal, the beginning of the real.
quotes.name: Edwin Leibfreed

quotes.message: Death is more universal than life; everyone dies but not everyone lives.
quotes.name: Andrew Sachs

quotes.message: Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: As long as you are not aware of the continual law of Die and Be Again, you are merely a vague guest on a dark Earth.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: When we finally know we are dying, and all other sentient beings are dying with us, we start to have a burning, almost heartbreaking sense of the fragility and preciousness of each moment and each being, and from this can grow a deep, clear, limitless compassion for all beings.
quotes.name: Sogyal Rinpoche

quotes.message: We do not die because we have to die; we die because one day, and not so long ago, our consciousness was forced to deem it necessary.
quotes.name: Antonin Artaud

quotes.message: For certain is death for the born, And certain is birth for the dead; Therefore over the inevitable, Thou shouldst not grieve.
quotes.name: Bhagavad Gita

quotes.message: Death is nothing to us, since when we are, death has not come, and when death has come, we are not.
quotes.name: Epicurus

quotes.message: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.
quotes.name: Isaac Asimov

quotes.message: I want to die in my sleep like my grandfather... Not screaming and yelling like the passengers in his car.
quotes.name: Will Shriner

quotes.message: Death keeps no calendar.
quotes.name: English

quotes.message: Death pays all debts.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: Death takes no bribes.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: The first breath is the beginning of death.
quotes.name: Thomas Fuller

quotes.message: The world's an inn, and death the journey's end.
quotes.name: John Dryden

quotes.message: Death is a law, not a punishment.
quotes.name: Jean Dubos

quotes.message: Death produced a state of gloom and emptiness in which life and hope were to be left behind.
quotes.name: Herbert Lockyer

quotes.message: Death was looked upon as a bitter, inevitable separation, which must be faced with a manly separation.
quotes.name: Herbert Lockyer

quotes.message: The deathbed was the great battlefield where man's enemy, the devil, staked his last throw and drew up all his strongest forces of one final and bitter assault.
quotes.name: Burrell and Lucas

quotes.message: To sleep! perchance to dream; aye, there's the rub. For in that sleep of death what dreams may come.
quotes.name: Tagore

quotes.message: Leaves have their time to fall . And flowers to wither at the north-wind's breath . And starts to set—but all .
quotes.name: Felicia Hermans

quotes.message: Tell me, my soul, can this be death? . Lend, lend your wings! I mount! I fly! . O grave, where is thy victory? .
quotes.name: Alexander Pope

quotes.message: Death moulded into calm completeness the status of his life.
quotes.name: John Greenleaf Whittier

quotes.message: The mode of death is sadder than death itself.
quotes.name: Latin Proverb

quotes.message: A thousand approaches lie to open death.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Oh sunderings short of body and breath. Oh battle, and murder, and sudden death.
quotes.name: Empress Josephine

quotes.message: It is folly to die of the fear of death.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: One person's illness or death will not indemnify others against death.
quotes.name: Yoruba Proverb

quotes.message: If thou expect death as a friend, prepare to entertain him; if as an enemy, prepare to overcome him. Death has no advantage except when he comes as a stranger.
quotes.name: Quarles

quotes.message: Death is the golden key that opens the palace of eternity
quotes.name: Milton

quotes.message: Death expecteth thee everywhere; be wise. therefore, and expect death everywhere.
quotes.name: Quarles

quotes.message: Be still prepared for death: and death or life shall thereby be the sweeter.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: Death opens the gate of fame, and shuts the gate of envy after it.—It unloosens the chain of the captive and puts the bondman's task in another's hands.
quotes.name: Sterne

quotes.message: Death is the crown of life.—Where death denied, poor man would live in vain; to live would not be life; even fools would wish to die.
quotes.name: Young

quotes.message: Death has nothing terrible which life has not made so.
quotes.name: Tyron Edwards

quotes.message: It is impossible that anything so natural, so necessary, and so universal as death, should ever have been designed by Providence as an evil to mankind.
quotes.name: Swift

quotes.message: We understand death for the first time when he puts his hand upon one whom we love.
quotes.name: Mad. Be Stael

quotes.message: They that love beyond the world cannot be separated by it. Death cannot kill what never dies, nor can spirits ever be divided that love and live in the same divine principle.
quotes.name: William Penn

quotes.message: Death hides, but it does not divide, they are but on Christ's other side. Thou art with Christ and Christ with me. In Him I am close to thee.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Urch

quotes.message: Death is like thunder in two particulars: we are alarmed at the sound of it, and it is formidable only from that which preceded it.
quotes.name: Colton

quotes.message: The Gods conceal from men the happiness of death, that they may endure life.
quotes.name: Lucan

quotes.message: The darkness of death is like the evening twilight; it makes all objects appear more lovely to the dying.
quotes.name: Richter

quotes.message: We sometimes congratulate ourselves at the moment of waking from a troubled dream; it may be so the moment after death.
quotes.name: Hawthorne

quotes.message: Death stamps the characters and conditions of men for eternity.— As death finds them in this world, so will they be in the next.
quotes.name: Emmons

quotes.message: Although the testimony of my mother's life helped mold me and taught me how to live, the testimony of her last years and her death gave me insight into how to die.
quotes.name: Billy Graham

quotes.message: Even in the darkest moment, before death snatches man's last breath. God is willing to save a lost soul.
quotes.name: Billy Graham

quotes.message: Death be not proud thou some have called thee. Mighty and dreadful for thou art not so.
quotes.name: John Donne

quotes.message: Don't be afraid of death so much as an inadequate life.
quotes.name: Bertolt Brecht

quotes.message: Death is nothing at all; it does not count. I have only slipped away into the next room.
quotes.name: Henry Scott Holland

quotes.message: Life is a great surprise. I do not see why death should not be an even greater one.
quotes.name: Vladimir Nabokov

quotes.message: Thou lovers be lost love shall not; And death shall have no dominion.
quotes.name: Dylan Thomas

quotes.message: Death is not an event in life: we do not live to experience death.
quotes.name: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.message: Death must be distinguished from dying, with which it is often confused.
quotes.name: Sydney Smith

quotes.message: Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark; and as that natural fear in children is increased with tales, so is the other.
quotes.name: Francis Bacon

quotes.message: Death, in itself, is nothing; but we fear, to be we know not what, we know not where.
quotes.name: John Dryden

quotes.message: These are two ways of life ending with death have been declared: death with one's will and death against one's will. Death against one's will is that of ignorant men...death with one's will is that of wise men.
quotes.name: Jaina Sutras

quotes.message: Death is not the opposite of life, but a part of it.
quotes.name: Haruki Murakami

quotes.message: We all die. The goal isn’t to live forever, the goal is to create something that will.
quotes.name: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.message: People living deeply have no fear of death.
quotes.name: Anais Nin

quotes.message: For life and death are one, even as the river and the sea are one.
quotes.name: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.message: He who is not busy being born is busy dying.
quotes.name: Bob Dylan

quotes.message: Cowards die many times before their deaths; the valiant never taste of death but once.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: If a man has not discovered something that he will die for, he isn't fit to live.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: If we lose love and self respect for each other, this is how we finally die.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: I intend to live forever, or die trying.
quotes.name: Groucho Marx

quotes.message: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.
quotes.name: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.message: If death meant just leaving the stage long enough to change costume and come back as a new character… Would you slow down? Or speed up?
quotes.name: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.message: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: It is difficult to accept death in this society because it is unfamiliar. In spite of the fact that it happens all the time, we never see it.
quotes.name: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quotes.message: The saddest truth that I have come to learn is that I was never your first, nor second, but last resort.
quotes.name: James Merrow

quotes.message: If they don't appreciate your presence, perhaps you should try giving them your absence.
quotes.name: Tinku Razoria

quotes.message: If you treat me like no one today, tomorrow you will be no one to me.
quotes.name: Cv Pillay

quotes.message: I might be difficult today. Not because I choose to. But my goodness was taken for granted.
quotes.name: Alfusainey jallow

quotes.message: Some won't appreciate you no matter how much you do for them. Release yourself. Go where you're appreciated and understood.
quotes.name: Robert Tew

quotes.message: Learn how to give your absence to those who don't appreciate your presence, in the end you will make them realize how important your present is.
quotes.name: Kemmy Nola

quotes.message: A lack of appreciation and respect can be a sad end to many wonderful relationships.
quotes.name: Bernajoy Vaal

quotes.message: Scientists tend to be unappreciated in the world at large, but you can hardly overstate the importance of the work they do.
quotes.name: Bill Bryson

quotes.message: You can be the nicest person, try your best to please everyone, but at the end of the day all your efforts still go unappreciated!
quotes.name: Rashida Rowe

quotes.message: I'm not going to hold onto someone, who wants to be held by someone else.
quotes.name: Lucas Hunter

quotes.message: Don't give everything to a person that isn't giving you anything.
quotes.name: Sonya Parker

quotes.message: If you can go days without talking to me, I'm obviously not that important to you.
quotes.name: Anurag Prakash Ray

quotes.message: She felt excluded, unappreciated and unloved. Never had been loved.
quotes.name: Suzie Wilde

quotes.message: Hanging with people who make you feel unappreciated, for the mere sake of appearing to be popular, is the loneliest place to be.
quotes.name: Ellen J. Barrier

quotes.message: Maybe its true that we don't know what we have until we lose it.
quotes.name: Aaron Chan

quotes.message: Sometimes you'll give your all to someone, and they won't appreciate you. That's life. Just don't become bitter because of it.
quotes.name: Sonya Parker

quotes.message: I give to you because I want to and not expecting anything back, when you start demanding it and expect it like its owed to you, that's when I turn my back.
quotes.name: Tanya Kanakaole

quotes.message: The very same person you are taking for granted today, is going to be your only chance of help in future.
quotes.name: Tshepo Koos Maluleke

quotes.message: Anything acquired without effort, and without cost is generally unappreciated.
quotes.name: Napoleon Hill

quotes.message: We can't be afraid to dismiss the unappreciative.
quotes.name: Dominic Riccitello

quotes.message: Even a speck of love should not go unappreciated, because, as Rumi said, love is the water of life.
quotes.name: Elif Safak

quotes.message: It's simple. Women only nag when they feel unappreciated.
quotes.name: Louis de Bernieres

quotes.message: Real people are destined to be hated and unappreciated by fools.
quotes.name: Isaiah Harden

quotes.message: Evil was seductive and easy, and virtue was difficult and unappreciated.
quotes.name: Melissa de la Cruz

quotes.message: When you let people bring you down, you've successfully made yourself a step upon which they'll climb and stand above you.
quotes.name: Terry Mark

quotes.message: Never feel empty when the person you like turns you down, because not all people are smart enough to appreciate you.
quotes.name: Kemmy Nola

quotes.message: Lonely isn't a feeling when you're alone, lonely is a feeling when no one cares.
quotes.name: James Merrow

quotes.message: Give all your pearls, and the swine will make a pearl necklace, then run off. Don't show all your glory.
quotes.name: Anthony Liccione

quotes.message: That person you took for granted today could turn out to be the only one person you will need tomorrow.
quotes.name: Kemmy Nola

quotes.message: Love goes unappreciated a lot of times, but you still gotta keep giving it.
quotes.name: Snoop Dogg

quotes.message: Hurt feelings occur from appraisals of low relational evaluation that arise from a perceived discrepancy between one's desired and perceived relational value.
quotes.name: Anita L. Vangelisti

quotes.message: The relational evaluation hypothesis suggests that hurt feelings should be highly related to the discrepancy between how much people wish a particular person to value their relationship and the degree to which they believe the relationship is actually valued.
quotes.name: Anita L. Vangelisti

quotes.message: Feeling unappreciated may result in resentment and jealousy.
quotes.name: Ifeoma Ikenze

quotes.message: For most people, growing up feeling unloved, unwanted, unaccepted and unappreciated is at the root of a poor self-image.
quotes.name: Fred Phillips

quotes.message: Nurture and nourish you feelings, rather than making the food an unappreciated stand-in.
quotes.name: Amanda Owen

quotes.message: When we feel unappreciated, when we feel that no one is taking care of and trying to please us, we run out of anything to give. We need to learn to increase the people in our lives who do appreciate us.
quotes.name: Hackney Evans

quotes.message: We can begin feeling appreciated when we give it to ourselves and simultaneously show appreciation towards others.
quotes.name: Hackney Evans

quotes.message: The poverty of being unwanted, unloved and uncared for is the greatest poverty - Mother Teresa
quotes.name: Jonathan Frejuste

quotes.message: Being unwanted, unloved, uncared for, forgotten by everybody, I think that is a much greater hunger, a much greater poverty than tha person who has nothing to eat.
quotes.name: Ahmed Abouleel

quotes.message: Even the rich are hungry for love, for being cared for, for being wanted for having someone to call their own.
quotes.name: Ahmed Abouleel

quotes.message: You are God's masterpiece, the apple to His eye. Never think you're forgotten or unloved.
quotes.name: La'Garien J

quotes.message: The worst feeling is feeling nothing when all you want to feel is loved.
quotes.name: R.H. Sin

quotes.message: A mighty pain to love it is, And 't is a pain that pain to miss; But of all pains, the greatest pain It is to love, but love in vain.
quotes.name: Abraham Cowley

quotes.message: The least we each ought to do for someone who treats us like a king or a queen is to treat them like a prince or a princess.
quotes.name: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.message: Feel what it's like to truly starve, and I guarantee that you'll forever think twice before wasting food.
quotes.name: Criss Jami

quotes.message: Life sometimes reminds us that it is sometimes heartless by giving something or someone we really need to someone who does not need or even want them or it.
quotes.name: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.message: Happiness is a simple game of lost and found: Lose the things you take for granted, and you will feel great happiness once they are found.
quotes.name: Richelle E. Goodrich

quotes.message: One may suffer the long-term in order to grow in appreciation for the small things. For in short-term suffering, one only notices the large.
quotes.name: Criss Jami

quotes.message: In a very tragic kind of way, sometimes things have to be gone before I fully realize that they were ever there.
quotes.name: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quotes.message: Appreciate what you have, while you have it, or you’ll learn what it meant to you after you lose it.
quotes.name: Frank Sonnenberg

quotes.message: Things you may take for granted, other people are praying for
quotes.name: Marlan Rico Lee

quotes.message: Happiness isn't something you should take for granted. It should be savored, because you don't know what tomorrow will bring.
quotes.name: Alisha Rai

quotes.message: At times in life we take our blessings for granted.
quotes.name: Angel Moreira

quotes.message: Ungrateful people forget what they are not grateful for.
quotes.name: Ana Monnar

quotes.message: Making the ungrateful grateful will bring tears to your eyes, tears of blood bleeding from the heart.
quotes.name: Ana Monnar

quotes.message: Unhappiness is a contagious disease caused by a chronic deficiency of gratitude.
quotes.name: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.message: You cannot, at the very same time, be grateful and unhappy, or ungrateful and happy.
quotes.name: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.message: The mind is inclined to zoom in on your problem, or few problems, to an extend that you cannot see your many blessings.
quotes.name: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.message: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.
quotes.name: William James

quotes.message: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: Feelings of worth can flourish only in an atmosphere where individual differences are appreciated, mistakes are tolerated, communication is open, and rules are flexible - the kind of atmosphere that is found in a nurturing family.
quotes.name: Virginia Satir

quotes.message: We seldom find people ungrateful so long as it is thought we can serve them.
quotes.name: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: Dispirited, unmotivated, unappreciated workers cannot compete in a highly competitive world.
quotes.name: Frances Hesselbein

quotes.message: It's honestly the worst feeling ever . to feel alone . like no one understands or even cares to try to understand how you feel.
quotes.name: Humming Bird

quotes.message: I thought my heart had known the whole Of love . but small its knowledge proved . For still the more my longing soul Loves on . itself the while unloved.
quotes.name: Bernard de Ventadorn

quotes.message: She stole my heart, myself she stole . And all I prized from me removed.
quotes.name: Bernard de Ventadorn

quotes.message: They have known shame, who love unloved . Even then . When two mouths, thirsty each for each, find slaking.
quotes.name: Rupert Brooke

quotes.message: Unloved­ I love . unwept­ weep . Grief I restrain ­hope I repress.
quotes.name: Charlotte Bronte

quotes.message: I'm feeling really unappreciated You takin' my love for granted . babe . I don't know how much more . I can take from you.
quotes.name: Cedric Williams

quotes.message: You don't do the things you use to do . You don't even say I love you too . And lately I've been feeling . Feeling unappreciated.
quotes.name: Cedric Williams

quotes.message: I feel so unappreciated for my absence . And I pull myself apart providing people access.
quotes.name: Dock Watch Hollow

quotes.message: Knocked down, unappreciated . Day is losing grip on the light . And everywhere I turn there is night.
quotes.name: Chris Braide

quotes.message: I feel like everything I've done before is different now . But I can see clearer than ever from a distance now.
quotes.name: Alex Stacey

quotes.message: Feelin' like maybe I'm unappreciated . Like my presence in your life has been alleviated.
quotes.name: Alex Stacey

quotes.message: Starts with a conversation . Then a number on a piece of paper . She's feeling unappreciated So she files it away for later.
quotes.name: Myron Avant

quotes.message: Hey, let me share a few words . Feeling unappreciated, let me cherish you first.
quotes.name: Jack Harlow

quotes.message: You can't erase the way I'm unappreciated . But I can't sleep tonight . Embrace of the drink.
quotes.name: Alexander Bois

quotes.message: New dirt covers up last week's bruise . My heart's been played so hard . now I'm out of tune . So unappreciated . I should walk away But my father's mind says, 'boy you better stay'.
quotes.name: Mark Francis Giovetti

quotes.message: Women are often overlooked . taken for granted. They can slip easily through a man's defense.
quotes.name: Stan Lee

quotes.message: Feeling unappreciated, used, or taken for granted describes thoughts and feelings of targets that the behavior of offenders.
quotes.name: Anita L. Vangelisti

quotes.message: Doing the right thing for someone else was like a tonic for me; it was like some magic ointment that made a wound disappear.
quotes.name: Susie Bright

quotes.message: You cannot make yourself feel something you do not feel, but you can make yourself do right in spite of your feelings.
quotes.name: Pearl S. Buck

quotes.message: Try not to become a man of success but rather try to become a man of value.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: You have to do the right thing... You may never know what results come from your action. But if you do nothing, there will be no result.
quotes.name: Mohandas K. Gandhi

quotes.message: Remember not only to say the right thing in the right place, but far more difficult still, to leave unsaid the wrong thing at the tempting moment.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: My basic principle is that you don't make decisions because they are easy; you don't make them because they are cheap; you don't make them because they're popular; you make them because they're right.
quotes.name: Heodore Hesburgh

quotes.message: The time is always right to do what is right.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: The right way is not always the popular and easy way. Standing for right when it is unpopular is a true test of moral character.
quotes.name: Margaret Chase Smith

quotes.message: Do what you feel in your heart to be right - for you'll be criticized anyway.
quotes.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.message: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
quotes.name: Gandhi

quotes.message: Next to doing the right thing, the most important thing is to let people know you are doing the right thing.
quotes.name: John D. Rockefeller

quotes.message: Happiness and personal fulfillment are the natural consequences of doing the right thing.
quotes.name: Epictetus

quotes.message: Doing the right thing is more important than doing the thing right.
quotes.name: Peter F. Drucker

quotes.message: Doing the right thing for someone else occasionally means doing something that feels wrong to you.
quotes.name: Jodi Picoult

quotes.message: If you have to do it, then you're doing the right thing.
quotes.name: Kathy Valentine

quotes.message: Goodness is the only investment that never fails.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: We must not allow ourselves to become like the system we oppose.
quotes.name: Desmond Tutu

quotes.message: Always do right - this will gratify some and astonish the rest.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: There is no wrong time to do the right thing.
quotes.name: Charles M. Blow

quotes.message: Do what you can with what you have where you are.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: Keep your feet on the ground and your thoughts at lofty heights.
quotes.name: Peace Pilgrim

quotes.message: Honestly, if you don't fit in then you're probably doing the right thing.
quotes.name: Lights Poxlietner

quotes.message: People will always try to stop you from doing the right thing if it is unconventional.
quotes.name: Warren Buffett

quotes.message: Doing the right thing daily, compounds over time.
quotes.name: John C. Maxwell

quotes.message: If you are doing the right thing for the earth, she's giving you great company.
quotes.name: Vandana Shiva

quotes.message: Doing the right thing isn't always easy - in fact, sometimes it's real hard - but just remember that doing the right thing is always right.
quotes.name: David Cottrell

quotes.message: Pissing people off doesn't mean you're doing the right things, but doing the right things will almost inevitably piss people off.
quotes.name: Colin Powell

quotes.message: Doing the Right Thing - Sometimes doing the right thing, is to do nothing at all.
quotes.name: Mike Gafka

quotes.message: What is right for one soul may not be right for another. It may mean having to stand on your own and do something strange in the eyes of others.
quotes.name: Eileen Caddy

quotes.message: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
quotes.name: Anne Frank

quotes.message: Easily say no when you want to... and feel great instead of guilty while doing so.
quotes.name: Shelley Rachanow

quotes.message: A duty dodged is like a debt unpaid; it is only deferred, and we must come back and settle the account at last.
quotes.name: Joseph Fort Newton

quotes.message: Where it is a duty to worship the sun it is pretty sure to be a crime to examine the laws of heat.
quotes.name: John Morley

quotes.message: Let us resolve to look on the bright side, to make the best of whatever may befall, to maintain faith that doing the right thing will ultimately bring victory.
quotes.name: B.C. Forbes

quotes.message: Politics is a jungle— torn between doing the right thing and staying in office.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: It takes less time to do a thing right than to explain why you did it wrong.

quotes.message: It is not only what we do, but also what we do not do, for which we are accountable.
quotes.name: Moliere

quotes.message: The world is divided into people who do things and people who get the credit. Try, if you can, to belong to the first class. There's far less competition.
quotes.name: Dwight Morrow

quotes.message: Thinking well is wise; planning well;, wiser; doing well wisest and best of all.
quotes.name: Persian Proverb

quotes.message: Doing is the great thing. for if, resolutely, people do what is right, in time they come to like doing it.
quotes.name: John Ruskin

quotes.message: Initiative consists of doing the right thing without being told.
quotes.name: Irving Mack

quotes.message: Motherhood is a choice you make every day, to put someone else's happiness and well-being ahead of your own, to teach the hard lessons, to do the right thing even when you're not sure what the right thing is... and to forgive yourself, over and over again, for doing everything wrong.
quotes.name: Donna Ball

quotes.message: The best time to do a thing is when it can be done.
quotes.name: William Pickens

quotes.message: I try to do the right thing at the right time. They may be just little things, but usually they make the difference between winning and losing.
quotes.name: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

quotes.message: One must learn by doing the thing. For though you think you know it, you have no certainty until you try.

quotes.message: The truth of the matter is that you always know the right thing to do. The hard part is doing it.
quotes.name: Norman Schwarzkopf

quotes.message: We are so busy doing the urgent that we don't have time to do the important.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.message: You must give some time to your fellow man. Even if it's a little thing, do something for those who have need of help., something for which you get no pay but the privilege of doing it. For remember, you don't live in a world all your own. Your brothers are here, too.
quotes.name: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.message: Never let your sense of morals get in the way of doing what's right.
quotes.name: Isaac Asimov

quotes.message: Our confidence in Christ does not make us lazy, negligent, or careless, but on the contrary it awakens us , urges us on, and maks us active in living righteous lives and doing good. There is no self-confidence to compare with this.
quotes.name: Ulrich Zwingli

quotes.message: When I have a problem of deciding right from wrong, I always give it three tests. First, I give it the common-sense test, and ask if it is reasonable. Then I give it a prayer test. I ask God if it is good and edifying. Then I give it a scripture test. I see if the Bible has anything to say for or against it.
quotes.name: Billy Garaham

quotes.message: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: With integrity, you have nothing to fear, since you have nothing to hide. With integrity, you will do the right thing, so you will have no guilt.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: Character is doing the right thing when nobody's looking. There are too many people who think that the only thing that's right is to get by, and the only thing that's wrong is to get caught.
quotes.name: J.C. Watts

quotes.message: What one thinks is right is not always the same as what others think is right; no one can be always right.
quotes.name: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.message: It is never wrong to do what is right.
quotes.name: Gift Gugu Mona

quotes.message: Life is too short to try and please everyone. Take charge and do what’s right -- not what’s popular.

quotes.message: Sometimes it's best to do what feels safe, and sometimes it's better to do what you know is right, even though the cost may be high.

quotes.message: The extraordinary thing about having absolute conviction that you're doing the right thing is that you’ll do it – whatever that may be, no matter how difficult, dangerous or improbable.

quotes.message: Doing the right thing even when no one is looking is easy if I remember that I am not in this life alone and that my task is to please God... not people.

quotes.message: Gangsters lived in the neighborhood. They weren't apart from it. Their relationships with people were both benevolent and scary.

quotes.message: Gangsta rappers can't fight, so they rap about guns.

quotes.message: You can get much farther with a kind word and a gun than you can with a kind word alone.

quotes.message: Everybody's a gangster until a gangster walks in the room.

quotes.message: A team is where a boy can prove his courage on his own. A gang is where a coward goes to hide.

quotes.message: Isolation from power makes men look for a mob in which they can be strong.
quotes.name: Herbert Gold

quotes.message: War is a thug's game. The thug strikes first and harder. He doesn't go by rules and he isn't afraid of hurting people.

quotes.message: Any distraction tends to get in the way of being an effective gangster.

quotes.message: Shoot first, ask questions last. That's how these so called gangsta's last.

quotes.message: It is a rule of law alone which hinders the rulers from turning themselves into the worst gangsters.

quotes.message: The only difference between the Government & the Mafia is that the Mafia actually turns a profit.

quotes.message: Every man is a mob, a chain gang of idiots.

quotes.message: The lawyer with the briefcase can steal more money than the man with the gun.

quotes.message: Every human being has a bit of gangster in him

quotes.message: When you're a kid and you see gangsters living the life, you kind of want to be like that.

quotes.message: Mafia is the best example of capitalism we have

quotes.message: A gangster doesn't think of himself a hustler, I assume he thinks of himself as a businessman.

quotes.message: You think I care about the money? I only care about makin' people do what I tell `em.

quotes.message: It's hard to tell whether there is more guns or flowers at a gangster's funeral. I would rather have the undertaker's privilege with some high-class gang, than to have a seat on the Stock Exchange.

quotes.message: Gangster warfare has ravaged the Americas, paradoxically when my nations appeared to be getting freer and wealthier.

quotes.message: Perhaps it is a combination of factors. When you mix broken families and gangster cultre with poverty, cartels, and impunity, it is a lethal cocktail.

quotes.message: We white people are merely modified Thugs; Thugs fretting under the restraints of a not very thick skin of civilization.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: A mob is a monster with heads enough, but no heart, and little brains.

quotes.message: Every numerous assembly is a mob; everything there depends on instantaneous turns.

quotes.message: A mob is the scum that rises upmost when the nation boils.

quotes.message: A crowd always think with its sympathy, never with its reason.
quotes.name: W.R. Alger

quotes.message: The multitude unawed is insolent; once seized with fear, contemptible and vain.

quotes.message: Passion may not unfitly be termed the mob of the man, that commits a riot on his reason.

quotes.message: They feared me because I feared Nothing.

quotes.message: When you understand the mechanics of stress and master the techniques to manipulate someone's fears and dreams, you will be powerful.
quotes.name: Gregory Hartley

quotes.message: Cuz even a gangsta rapper can find redemption . For the sins committed before revelation.
quotes.name: Carlos Salinas

quotes.message: It's always better to like a gangster from a distance anyway. Like a tiger cub in a cage. They always look soft and cute and warm behind those iron bars. Everybody's happy, smiling, waving, taking pictures. But you take away those bars and all that goes away. All that's left is the fear.

quotes.message: In my world, of course, it don't matter. You could be a gangster with a dress, you could be a gangster with baggy pants.

quotes.message: A lot of my friends are gangsters. Not like gangsters - well, yeah, all sorts of levels of criminality - but not the types that are preying on innocent people. I have no interest in the type of criminality that has no respect for collateral damage.

quotes.message: I would just as soon listen to a gangster lecture on honesty as watch Hollywood portray the Bible.

quotes.message: Everybody needs love. There are a lot of guys that you think are hard-core gangsters, but all these guys' weaknesses are women. Look at the movie Scarface. At the end of the day, all he wanted to do was to have kids with his woman.

quotes.message: A lot of these kids have no fathers, and they want to be gangsters. They don't believe in God and have no faith in anything but their own instincts. Boxing provides a way for them to express themselves in a positive way, and I'm happy to be able to help them.

quotes.message: Gun control? It's the best thing you can do for crooks and gangsters. I want you to have nothing. I'm a bad guy; I'm always gonna have a gun. Safety locks? You will pull the trigger with a lock on, and I'll pull the trigger. We'll see who wins.
quotes.name: Sammy Gravano

quotes.message: A well-read gangster is still a gangster.
quotes.name: Doris Hursley

quotes.message: Just don't raise them to be gangsters. Because to be a gangster is a foolish way to live.
quotes.name: Minoru Inuzuka

quotes.message: Gangsters are not nearly so frightening as you'd think. Some of them are quite ordinary looking.

quotes.message: If gangsters look like gangsters, the police would soon get after them.
quotes.name: Joseph Conrad

quotes.message: Gangsters: they act like big men, until they turn into rats.
quotes.name: Alan Burnett

quotes.message: Once a gangster, always a gangster.
quotes.name: Gary Glasberg

quotes.message: The spirit of Pancasilla Youth - which people accuse of being gangsters - Gangsters are people who work outside the system - not for the government.
quotes.name: Joshua Oppenheimer

quotes.message: The word 'gangster' comes from 'free men'.
quotes.name: Joshua Oppenheimer

quotes.message: Gangsters can create both security and riots.
quotes.name: Joshua Oppenheimer

quotes.message: Gangsters don't look like gangsters anymore - they look like businessmen.
quotes.name: Dean Riesner

quotes.message: There'll always be cops like there'll always be gangsters. There'll always be cops like there'll always be gangsters.
quotes.name: Jonathan Nolan

quotes.message: You need more than guts to be a good gangster. You need ideas.
quotes.name: Paulo Lins

quotes.message: Make up your mind to be a cop, not a gangster with a badge.
quotes.name: A.I. Bezzerides

quotes.message: All institutions of the American government are essentially a gangster syndicate; and everybody knows this.
quotes.name: Francis Richard Conolly

quotes.message: We need reliable candidates with solid military backgrounds or good social skills. Taking on wannabe gangsters will turn us into a bunch of thugs.
quotes.name: Sang-yoon Lim

quotes.message: When you mix broken families and gangster culture with poverty, cartels and impunity, it is a lethal cocktail.
quotes.name: Ioan Grillo

quotes.message: In communities scarred with violence, many don't know what peace looks like.
quotes.name: Ioan Grillo

quotes.message: Teenagers in Brazilian favelas, jamaican garrisons and honduran slums see these crime wars as a natural state of affairs.
quotes.name: Ioan Grillo

quotes.message: Gangster warlords nurture their culture, their pseudo religion, and their rhetoric of fighting for the poor.
quotes.name: Ioan Grillo

quotes.message: A gangster who does not want to stop living life gangster will not stop living life gangster.

quotes.message: One historian has also described New York as having a 'gangster era' of municipal government in the late 1800s when 'elections were decided by repeat voters and poll-box smashers, by the intimidation and beating of citizens before they could cast their votes.
quotes.name: K. Hirschfeld

quotes.message: Political gangsterism and kleptocracy are also readily visible in the 20th century histories of Cuba's closest neighbors.
quotes.name: K. Hirschfeld

quotes.message: Can you ever trust a cop to make real deal with a gangster? The answer is no. A cop is a cop.
quotes.name: Arturo Rossenaldo Romero DeLeone

quotes.message: If you are going to snitch on a brother and be protected by cops, you are making a mistake which can cost you your freedom.
quotes.name: Arturo Rossenaldo Romero DeLeone

quotes.message: Gangster Lean, Gangster Lean . Is he the baddest dude you ever seen? . Three piece suits, complete with a diamond ring.
quotes.name: Arturo Rossenaldo Romero DeLeone

quotes.message: He is a really nice guy, gives money to the poor . Thanks heaven above for even more . He does not hurt anyone because he so cool . But don't get him wrong . he is nobody's fool.
quotes.name: Arturo Rossenaldo Romero DeLeone

quotes.message: Catch him if you can, if you are so mean . Never leaves tracks because he is not in that seen . He makes the get away so complete . always so clean . Do you really know the Gangster Lean.
quotes.name: Arturo Rossenaldo Romero DeLeone

quotes.message: My role model were gangsters, criminals, drug dealers, and my father made me a wise guy. My mother was the only thing sane in my life.
quotes.name: Paul Tully

quotes.message: The lawyer with the briefcase can steal more money than the man with the gun.
quotes.name: Mario Puzo

quotes.message: A true gangster can smell out a person's strengths and weaknesses in a matter of minutes, but what they can sense most of all, what their bodies are most attuned to, is the scent of fear.
quotes.name: Lorenzo Carcaterra

quotes.message: The older you get, the deadlier you have to be and you use age to your advantage. You make it a strength. Most of us are more dangerous the longer we live. If we didn't care about dying when we were young, we're not going to be too concerned about it when we have two feet in our grave.
quotes.name: Lorenzo Carcaterra

quotes.message: Like many executives in the corporate world, a gangster is consumed with an insatiable desire to possess what belongs to someone else.
quotes.name: Lorenzo Carcaterra

quotes.message: Mobsters are not satisfies with a mere Wall Street-backed takeover, no matter how lucrative. They will not rest until they live to see their opponent buried.
quotes.name: Lorenzo Carcaterra

quotes.message: A gangster's survival depended not on the destruction of his enemies but on the strength of his allies.

A good may be transformed into an evil in the next second. And vice versa. Such was the way of the world that Dostoevksy depicted in The Brothers Karamazov. The most important thing is to maintain the balance between the constantly moving good and evil. If you lean too much in either direction, it becomes difficult to maintain actual morals. Indeed, balance itself is the good.
