quotes.message: Musician jokes are a kind of joke that usually have to do with how much money someone makes. Musicians are always starving, so they're really mean to each other about who makes what.
quotes.name: Jackson Browne

quotes.message: Jokes are unanswerable objections.
quotes.name: Mason Cooley

quotes.message: Jokes are grievances.
quotes.name: Marshall McLuhan

quotes.message: What we hope ever to do with ease, we must learn first to do with diligence.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: Hard work is rewarding. Taking credit for other people's hard work is rewarding and faster.
quotes.name: Scott Adams

quotes.message: Hard work pays off - hard work beats talent any day, but if you're talented and work hard, it's hard to be beat.
quotes.name: Robert Griffin III

quotes.message: For dreams to come true, it requires diligence.
quotes.name: Yunho

quotes.message: Diligence overcomes difficulties; sloth makes them.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: A diligent effort was made to eliminate matters that did not have evidentiary value.
quotes.name: Canady

quotes.message: Busy hands achieve more than idle tongues.
quotes.name: Matshona Dhliwayo

quotes.message: Self-belief and hard work will always earn you success.
quotes.name: Virat Kohli

quotes.message: Always make a total effort, even when the odds are against you.
quotes.name: Arnold Palmer

quotes.message: Leisure is time for doing something useful; this leisure the diligent man will obtain, but the lazy man never.
quotes.name: Franklin

quotes.message: Ordinary people who faithfully, diligently, and consistently do simple things that are right before God will bring forth extraordinary results.
quotes.name: David A. Bednar

quotes.message: The reward of a work is to have produced it; the reward of effort is to have grown by it.
quotes.name: Antonin Sertillanges

quotes.message: For every great success, diligence is desirable from the beginning to the very end.
quotes.name: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.message: To be diligent means to be serious and devoted to the work of God.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: You can do as much diligence as possible before you go somewhere to try to protect yourself and the people around you.
quotes.name: Jeremy Scahill

quotes.message: Diligence which, as it avails in all things, is also of the utmost moment in pleading causes. Diligence is to be particularly cultivated by us; it is to be constantly exerted; it is capable of effecting almost everything.
quotes.name: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.message: Focused, hard work is the real key to success. Keep your eyes on the goal, and just keep taking the next step towards completing it. If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
quotes.name: John Carmack

quotes.message: Diligence in employments of less consequence is the most successful introduction to greater enterprises.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: Few things are impossible to diligence and skill.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and diligence.
quotes.name: Abigail Adams

quotes.message: If you work hard, make good choices and excellent decisions, and do what you can do best, you are likely to be rewarded with a lucky future.
quotes.name: Dr T.P.Chia

quotes.message: The expectations of life depend upon diligence; the mechanic that would perfect his work must first sharpen his tools.
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.message: Work hard,and you will earn good rewards.Work smart,and you will earn great rewards.Work hard and work smart,and you will earn extraordinary rewards.
quotes.name: Matshona Dhliwayo

quotes.message: Prefer diligence before idleness, unless you esteem rust above brightness.
quotes.name: Plato

quotes.message: Focus means being diligent. Diligence always leads to wealth.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: If hard work were such a wonderful thing, surely the rich would have kept it all to themselves.
quotes.name: Lane Kirkland

quotes.message: Diligence, hard work, perseverance, excellence are the values that cause things to happen.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: With diligence it is possible to make anything run slowly.
quotes.name: Tom Duff

quotes.message: There is simply no substitute for hard work when it comes to achieving success.
quotes.name: Heather Bresch

quotes.message: Due diligence is still under way there, so we're not prepared to comment on that.
quotes.name: Gettelfinger

quotes.message: Being forced to work, and forced to do your best, will breed in you temperance and self-control, diligence and strength of will, cheerfulness and content, and a hundred virtues which the idle will never know.
quotes.name: Charles Kingsley

quotes.message: Through hard work, perseverance and a faith in God, you can live your dreams.
quotes.name: Ben Carson

quotes.message: Diligence is a very great help even to a mediocre intelligence.
quotes.name: Seneca The Younger

quotes.message: Diligence is a good thing, but taking things easy is much more restful.
quotes.name: Twain

quotes.message: Without hard work and discipline it is difficult to be a top professional.
quotes.name: Jahangir Khan

quotes.message: Diligence and hard work sensitize you to recognize opportunity.
quotes.name: David P. Ingerson

quotes.message: A plodding diligence brings us sooner to our journey's end than a fluttering way of advancing by starts.
quotes.name: Roger L'Estrange

quotes.message: Diligence without intelligence is tragedy, not success.
quotes.name: Kevin Keenoo

quotes.message: Diligence is not easy, but we can't reach our goals without it.
quotes.name: Henry Cloud

quotes.message: Hard work and diligence are essential to success, but they require an internal motivation.
quotes.name: Myles Munroe

quotes.message: Diligence is the mother of good fortune, and idleness, its opposite, never brought a man to the goal of any of his best wishes.
quotes.name: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.message: Be diligent daily,be efficient weekly,be proficient monthly,and you will be productive annually.
quotes.name: Matshona Dhliwayo

quotes.message: Work is doing it. Discipline is doing it every day. Diligence is doing it well every day.
quotes.name: Dave Ramsey

quotes.message: The harder you work, the luckier you are is not a law, but people who work extraordinary hard always keep bad luck away.
quotes.name: Dr T.P.Chia

quotes.message: Confidence and hard work is the best medicine to kill the disease called failure. It will make you successful person.
quotes.name: Abdul Kalam

quotes.message: He who labors diligently need never despair; for all things are accomplished by diligence and labor.
quotes.name: Menander

quotes.message: Diligence is the mother of good luck.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Believe in yourself, work hard, work smart and passionately present your best self to the world.
quotes.name: Hill Harper

quotes.message: It is diligence that is supposed to be your greatest possession.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: The leading rule for the lawyer, as for the man of every calling is diligence. Leave nothing for tomorrow which can be done today.
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: A diligent man ever finds that something remains to be done.
quotes.name: Roman Proverb

quotes.message: The diligent farmer plants trees, of which he himself will never see the fruit.
quotes.name: Roman Proverb

quotes.message: Diligence is a very great help even to a mediocre intelligence.
quotes.name: Roman Proverb

quotes.message: A slack hand brings poverty, but the hand of the diligent brings forth wealth.
quotes.name: Proverb 10:4

quotes.message: In doing what we ought, we deserve no praise.
quotes.name: St. Augustine of Hippo

quotes.message: Patience and diligence, like faith, remove mountains.
quotes.name: William Penn

quotes.message: I know no such thing as genius; it is nothing but labor and diligence
quotes.name: Hogarth

quotes.message: Be diligent as long as you live, always doing more than is commanded of you.
quotes.name: Khemetic Wisdom

quotes.message: Be industrious, let thine eyes be open, lest thou become a beggar, for the man that is idle cometh not to honor.
quotes.name: Khemetic Wisdom

quotes.message: Nothing is so difficult that diligence cannot conquer it.
quotes.name: Malagasy Wisdom

quotes.message: Do what is required of you and remain a slave. Do more than is required and become free.
quotes.name: Marcus Garvey

quotes.message: If you want to be the best, Baby, you've got to work harder than anybody else.
quotes.name: Sammy Davis Jr.

quotes.message: There is no obstacle in the path of young people who are poor or members of minority groups that hard work and preparation cannot cure.
quotes.name: Barbara Jordan

quotes.message: When a job is once begun, never stop until it's done. . Be the job large or small, . do it right or not at all.
quotes.name: Carol Moseley Braun

quotes.message: My philosophy is that not only are you responsible for your life but doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: Do not speak falsely for you are great; do not act lightly for you have weight; be not untrue for you are the balance and do not swerve, for you are the standard.
quotes.name: Book of Khun-Anup

quotes.message: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread.
quotes.name: Proverb 28:19

quotes.message: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer.
quotes.name: Proverb 30:25

quotes.message: By diligence and patience, the mouse bit in two the cable.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Few things are impossible to diligence and skill. Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
quotes.name: Johnson

quotes.message: If you thought you had three months to do, due to diligence a year ago, you now have three weeks.
quotes.name: Greeley

quotes.message: Care and diligence bring luck.
quotes.name: Thomas Fuller

quotes.message: I never could have done what I have done without the habits of punctuality, order, and diligence, without the determination to concentrate myself on one subject at a time.
quotes.name: Charles Dickens

quotes.message: I observe the physician with the same diligence as the disease.
quotes.name: John Donne

quotes.message: I believe in fate, but I also believe that hard work and diligence play a very important role in our lives.
quotes.name: Chanda Kochhar

quotes.message: Artists know that diligence counts as much, if not more, as inspiration; in art, as in politics, patience counts as much as revolution.
quotes.name: Tony Kushner

quotes.message: The reward of work is to have produced it; the reward of effort is to have grown by it.
quotes.name: Antonin Sertillanges

quotes.message: Common man's patience will bring him more happiness than common man's power.
quotes.name: Amit Kalantri

quotes.message: Even if you feel like you're giving it your all, but still not seeing the desired results; keep going. Sometimes the key to your breakthrough is to persevere and to not give up.
quotes.name: Jeanette Coron

quotes.message: aughter is the best medicine - unless you're diabetic, then insulin comes pretty high on the list.
quotes.name: Jasper Carrott

quotes.message: Laughter is the sun that drives winter from the human face.
quotes.name: Victor Hugo

quotes.message: Laughter connects you with people. It's almost impossible to maintain any kind of distance or any sense of social hierarchy when you're just howling with laughter. Laughter is a force for democracy.
quotes.name: John Cleese

quotes.message: A day without laughter is a day wasted.
quotes.name: Charlie Chaplin

quotes.message: Laughter is the sensation of feeling good all over and showing it principally in one place.
quotes.name: Josh Billings

quotes.message: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: Laughter is good for you. Nine out of ten stand-up comedians recommend laughter in the face of intense stupidity.
quotes.name: Jim Butcher

quotes.message: I know why we laugh. We laugh because it hurts, and it's the only thing to make it stop hurting.
quotes.name: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.message: Hearty laughter is a good way to jog internally without having to go outdoors.
quotes.name: Norman Cousins

quotes.message: A day without laughter is like living in darkness; you try to find your way around, but you can't see clearly.
quotes.name: Emily Mitchell

quotes.message: Laughter is an instant vacation.
quotes.name: Milton Berle

quotes.message: Laughter feels like our flotation device -- it won't pull us out of the storm, but it might carry us through, if we can just hang on.
quotes.name: Emery Lord

quotes.message: Laughter has no foreign accent.
quotes.name: Paul Lowney

quotes.message: Everybody laughs the same in every language because laughter is a universal connection.
quotes.name: Yakov Smirnoff

quotes.message: At the height of laughter, the universe is flung into a kaleidoscope of new possibilities.
quotes.name: Jean Huston

quotes.message: You don't stop laughing because you grow old. You grow old because you stop laughing.
quotes.name: Michael Pritchard

quotes.message: A good laugh heals a lot of hurts.
quotes.name: Madeleine L'Engle

quotes.message: I'm not up for laughing, but their laughter makes the room feel safer, so we begin to explore.
quotes.name: John Green

quotes.message: Laughter does not deny pain. Laughter - like a wail - acknowledges and replies to pain.
quotes.name: Tim O'Brien

quotes.message: Laughter is a tranquilizer with no side effects.
quotes.name: Arnold H. Glasow

quotes.message: Laughter is a sense of proportion and a power of seeing yourself from the outside.
quotes.name: Zero Mostel

quotes.message: Laughter brings out the child in all of us.
quotes.name: Bill Cosby

quotes.message: Laughter is much more important than applause. Applause is almost a duty. Laughter is a reward.
quotes.name: Carol Channing

quotes.message: The house of laughter makes a house of woe.
quotes.name: Edward Young

quotes.message: Laughter lets me relax.
quotes.name: Odette Pollar

quotes.message: Laughter serves as a blocking agent. Like a bulletproof vest, it may help protect you against the ravages of negative emotions that can assault you in disease.
quotes.name: Norman Cousins

quotes.message: There is little success where there is little laughter.
quotes.name: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.message: Laughter is the foundation of reconciliation.
quotes.name: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.message: Laughter is by definition healthy.
quotes.name: Doris Lessing

quotes.message: If you would wish another to keep your secret, first keep it yourself.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Secrecy is the enemy of efficiency, but don't let anyone know it.
quotes.name: Ric Ocasek

quotes.message: A secret's worth depends on the people from whom it must be kept.
quotes.name: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

quotes.message: Secrecy is a vacuum and nothing fills a vacuum like paranoid speculation.
quotes.name: Max Brooks

quotes.message: In the mind and nature of a man a secret is an ugly thing, like a hidden physical defect.
quotes.name: Isak Dinesen

quotes.message: Some secrets are like fossils and the stone has become too heavy to turn over.
quotes.name: Delphine de Vigan

quotes.message: Secrets tend to get revealed when you're feeling most loved and when you're feeling most betrayed.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.message: Secrecy can spring from the best motives; but as it grows it begins to exist only for itself, only for its own sake, only to cover its own abuses.
quotes.name: Christopher Dodd

quotes.message: Secrecy is the soul of all great designs. Perhaps more has been effected by concealing our own intentions than by discovering those of our enemy.
quotes.name: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.message: Privacy is something that we maintain for the good of ourselves and others. Secrecy we keep to separate ourselves from others, even those we love.
quotes.name: Mary Alice Monroe

quotes.message: Secrets are things we give to others to keep for us.
quotes.name: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.message: Secrecy has many advantages, for when you tell someone the purpose of any object right away, they often think there is nothing to it.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: Secrecy is the element of all goodness; even virtue, even beauty is mysterious.
quotes.name: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.message: Our secrets are the walls that separate us and the bridges that connect us with others and who we truly are.
quotes.name: Frank Warren

quotes.message: Secrecy sets barriers between men, but at the same time offers the seductive temptation to break through the barriers by gossip or confession.
quotes.name: Georg Simmel

quotes.message: Privacy seems not an illusion for those who want to believe in secrecy principle.
quotes.name: Toba Beta

quotes.message: People addicted to secrecy are so without knowing why; they are not so for cause, but for secrecy's sake.
quotes.name: William Hazlitt

quotes.message: Secrecy is best taught by starting with ourselves.
quotes.name: Nicolas Chamfort

quotes.message: Secrecy, being an instrument of conspiracy, ought never to be the system of a regular government.
quotes.name: Jeremy Bentham

quotes.message: Our secrets are what keep us sick and as soon as we are able to expose them to another person, that is when the healing begins.
quotes.name: Phillip L. Smith

quotes.message: Secret enmities are more to be feared than open ones.
quotes.name: Cicero

quotes.message: A secret is most valuable when it remains a secret.
quotes.name: Brian Herbert

quotes.message: Secrets are pleasant to each child of Eve.
quotes.name: Hannah Cowley

quotes.message: The man who can keep a secret may be wise, but he is not half as wise as the man with no secrets to keep.
quotes.name: Edgar Watson Howe

quotes.message: Secrecy is the chastity of friendship.
quotes.name: Jeremy Taylor

quotes.message: A secret is seldom safe in more than one breast.
quotes.name: Swift

quotes.message: Secrecy involves a tension which, at the moment of revelation, finds its release.
quotes.name: Georg Simmel

quotes.message: Secrets have a way of making themselves felt, even before you know there's a secret.
quotes.name: Jean Ferris

quotes.message: To keep your secret is wisdom; but to expect others to keep it is folly.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: Nothing is as irritating to a shy man as a confident girl.
quotes.name: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.message: There is a certain delightful sort of hope which the introvert can receive only by having company over...the hope that they will leave soon.
quotes.name: Criss Jami

quotes.message: I have reason to be shy. I've been hurt plenty.
quotes.name: Ethel Waters

quotes.message: A shy failure is nobler than an immodest success.
quotes.name: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.message: I've gotten better at not making people feel uncomfortable with my shyness.
quotes.name: Clea Duvall

quotes.message: The shell must break before the bird can fly.
quotes.name: Tennyson

quotes.message: Humility is so shy. If you begin talking about it, it leaves.
quotes.name: Timothy Keller

quotes.message: Shyness has a strange element of narcissism, a belief that how we look, how we perform, is truly important to other people.
quotes.name: Andre Dubus

quotes.message: When a shy person smiles, it's like the sun coming out.
quotes.name: Anita Diament

quotes.message: My feelings are too loud for words and too shy for the world.
quotes.name: Dejan Stojanovic

quotes.message: There is nothing that makes us feel more lonely than our shyness.
quotes.name: Maduwa Livhuwani

quotes.message: The introvert's anthem for not wanting to hang out is 'It's not you; it's me.
quotes.name: Criss Jami

quotes.message: The shy man does have some slight revenge upon society for the torture it inflicts upon him.
quotes.name: Jerome K. Jerome

quotes.message: Timidity is the silent acceptance of bondage.
quotes.name: Constance Friday

quotes.message: Everyone is shy it is the inborn modesty that makes us able to live in harmony with other creatures and our fellows. Achievement comes not by denying shyness but, occasionally, by setting it aside and letting pride and perspiration come first.
quotes.name: Kirkpatrick Sale

quotes.message: Social taboos are shy like virtue; once lost, there is no remedy.
quotes.name: Gunnar Myrdal

quotes.message: It is only through timidity that states are lost.
quotes.name: Voltaire

quotes.message: One is always half mad when one is shy of people.
quotes.name: Robert Walser

quotes.message: Shyness is just egotism out of its depth.
quotes.name: Penelope Kieth

quotes.message: A shy face is better than a forward heart.
quotes.name: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.message: There is safety in reserve, but no attraction. One cannot love a reserved person.
quotes.name: Jane Austen

quotes.message: The way you overcome shyness is to become so wrapped up in something that you forget to be afraid.
quotes.name: Claudia Lady Bird Johnson

quotes.message: Maybe shy is when you're lonely and you don't think anybody can help you.
quotes.name: C.K. Williams

quotes.message: I live in a shell, so I can't blame people when they don't want to crack me. But people like you are the reason I left the nest.
quotes.name: Maria Elena

quotes.message: I felt suddenly shy. I was not used to shy. I was used to shame. Shyness is when you turn your head away from something you want. Shame is when you turn your head away from something you do not want.
quotes.name: Jonathan Safran Foer

quotes.message: Just because you don't say much doesn't mean people don't notice you. It's actually the quiet ones who often draw the most attention. There's this constant whirlwind of motion and sound all around, and then there's the quiet one, the eye of the storm.
quotes.name: Amy Efaw

quotes.message: Introductions are hard to come by when your natural state is shyness.
quotes.name: Steve Martin

quotes.message: The flower that smells the sweetest is shy and lowly.
quotes.name: William Wordsworth

quotes.message: One must not be shy where language is concerned.
quotes.name: Ann Patchett

quotes.message: All the shy people are doomed! Natural selection favors the loud and the aggressive.
quotes.name: Dylan Moran

quotes.message: What troubles me is the Internet and the electronic technology revolution. Shyness is fueled in part by so many people spending huge amounts of time alone, isolated on e-mail, in chat rooms, which reduces their face-to-face contact with other people.
quotes.name: Philip Zimbardo

quotes.message: But hopes are shy birds flying at a great distance, seldom reached by the best of guns.
quotes.name: John James Audubon

quotes.message: Shyness is a curious thing, because, like quicksand, it can strike people at any time, and also, like quicksand, it usually makes its victims look down.
quotes.name: Daniel Handler

quotes.message: Shy, like a hospitable country hostess anxious to give pleasure, but afraid that she has not much to offer citizens of a larger world.
quotes.name: Phyllis Bottome

quotes.message: Do not be shy of those who are not shy.
quotes.name: Albanian Proverb

quotes.message: He that wants should not be bashful.
quotes.name: Italian Proverb

quotes.message: Who is shy dies from hunger.
quotes.name: Albanian Proverb

quotes.message: Once burnt, twice shy.
quotes.name: American Proverb

quotes.message: A shy cat makes a proud mouse.
quotes.name: Scottish Proverb

quotes.message: The fact of the matter is that most actors are shy people.
quotes.name: Roger Moore

quotes.message: Shyness isn't something that just children feel. Anybody can feel shy. And one reason we feel that way is that we're not sure other people will like us just the way we are.
quotes.name: Fred Rogers

quotes.message: Not till the reserve ceases towards one's self; and then the attraction may be the greater.
quotes.name: Emma

quotes.message: Shyness is only the effect of a sense of inferiority in some way or other.
quotes.name: Jane Austen

quotes.message: Home is where the heart can laugh without shyness.
quotes.name: Vernon Baker

quotes.message: In talking, shyness and timidity distort the very meaning of my words. I don't pretend to know anybody well. People are like shadows to me and I am like a shadow.
quotes.name: Gwen John

quotes.message: Clothe yourself with shyness and armor yourself with loyalty.
quotes.name: Ali Ibn Abi Talib

quotes.message: A place has almost a shyness of a person with strangers; its secret is not to be surprised by too direct interrogation.
quotes.name: Arthur Symons

quotes.message: Many a man is praised for his reserve and so-called shyness when he is simply too proud to risk making a fool of himself.
quotes.name: J. B. Priestley

quotes.message: I suffer as always from the fear of putting down the first line. It is amazing the terrors, the magics, the prayers, the straightening shyness that assail one.
quotes.name: John Steinbeck

quotes.message: There was a magnificent human shining brightly behind her shy.
quotes.name: Atticus

quotes.message: A woman's best jewellery is her shyness.
quotes.name: Fatimah Az Zahra

quotes.message: Some people are so self-conscious that they are unable to make eye contact for longer than a second, even when they are wearing dark sunglasses.
quotes.name: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.message: You know, if you could just overcome your shyness and learn not how to be so vague, speak your mind, yet, get to the point, you might get somewhere in this world.
quotes.name: Joe Willis

quotes.message: The marks humans leave are too often scars.
quotes.name: John Green

quotes.message: Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.
quotes.name: Khalil Gibran

quotes.message: The person may have a scar, but it also means they have a story.
quotes.name: Jodi Picoult

quotes.message: A scar does not form on the dying. A scar means I survived.
quotes.name: Chris Cleave

quotes.message: What doesn't kill you is gonna leave a scar.
quotes.name: Marilyn Manson

quotes.message: Be proud of every scar on your heart, each one holds a lifetime's worth of lessons.
quotes.name: Wallace Stegner

quotes.message: She wears her scars like a warrior, for they're a reminder she's alive.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: God will not look you over for medals degrees or diplomas, but for scars.
quotes.name: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.message: To be alive at all is to have scars.
quotes.name: John Steinbeck

quotes.message: Our scars are a witness to the world. They are a part of our story. Healed wounds that are symbols that God has restored us.
quotes.name: Louie Giglio

quotes.message: I think scars are like battle wounds - beautiful, in a way. They show what you've been through and how strong you are for coming out of it.
quotes.name: Demi Lovato

quotes.message: Our scars make us beautiful.
quotes.name: Danielle Orner

quotes.message: Turn your scars into stars.
quotes.name: Robert H. Schuller

quotes.message: Scars. A sign that you had been hurt. A sign that you had healed.
quotes.name: Benjamin Alire Sáenz

quotes.message: Wounds turn into scars and scars make you tough.
quotes.name: Aisha Tyler

quotes.message: Every scar that you have is a reminder not just that you got hurt, but that you survived.
quotes.name: Michelle Obama

quotes.message: Scars are a warrior's beauty marks.
quotes.name: Matshona Dhliwayo

quotes.message: Scars show us where we have been, they do not dictate where we are going.
quotes.name: David Rossi

quotes.message: Scars speak more loudly than the sword that caused them.
quotes.name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.message: Don't hide your scars. Wear them as proof that God heals.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: A scar nobly got is a good livery of honor.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: Scars are tattoos with better stories.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Scars are just a treasure map for pain you've buried too deep to remember.
quotes.name: Jodi Picoult

quotes.message: What the mind forgets, the scars keep remembering.
quotes.name: Edith L. Tiempo

quotes.message: Just because the scars have healed, doesn't mean that the pain has.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Even when the wound is healed the scar remains.
quotes.name: Publilius Syrus

quotes.message: I'm grateful for every scar, some pages turned, some bridges burned, but there were lessons learned.
quotes.name: Carrie Underwood

quotes.message: Life gives you enough scars, you don't need to manufacture your own.
quotes.name: Andy Biersack

quotes.message: The best people all have some kind of scar.
quotes.name: Kiera Cass

quotes.message: Scars show toughness: that you've been through it, and you're still standing.
quotes.name: Theo Rossi

quotes.message: Scars have the strange power to remind us that our past is real.
quotes.name: Cormac Mccarthy

quotes.message: Every winner has scars.
quotes.name: Herbert Newton Casson

quotes.message: Don't hide your scars. They make you who you are.
quotes.name: Frank Sinatra

quotes.message: It's a shallow life that doesn't give a person a few scars.
quotes.name: Garrison Keillor

quotes.message: The scars of others should teach us caution.
quotes.name: St. Jerome

quotes.message: Every scar has a life of its own and a space in my heart.
quotes.name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.message: Scars fade with time. And the ones that never go away, well, they build character, maturity, caution.
quotes.name: Erin McCarthy

quotes.message: From every wound there is a scar, and every scar tells a story. A story that says, 'I survived.
quotes.name: Craig Scott

quotes.message: My scars tell a story. They are reminders of when life tried to break me, but failed.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Never again will I justify the scars just because I loved the person holding the knife.
quotes.name: Steve Maraboli

quotes.message: The soldier, above all other people, prays for peace, for he must suffer and bear the deepest wounds and scars of war.
quotes.name: Douglas Macarthur

quotes.message: There is something beautiful about all scars of whatever nature. A scar means the hurt is over, the wound is closed and healed, done with.
quotes.name: Harry Crews

quotes.message: Some people see scars, and it is wounding they remember. To me they are proof of the fact that there is healing.
quotes.name: Linda Hogan

quotes.message: I just want to show off my scar proudly and not be afraid of it.
quotes.name: Carly Simon

quotes.message: Let our scars fall in love.
quotes.name: Galway Kinnell

quotes.message: Hate leaves ugly scars, love leaves beautiful ones.
quotes.name: Mignon McLaughlin

quotes.message: Scars are memory. Like sutures. They stitch the past to me.
quotes.name: China Miéville

quotes.message: He jests at scars who never felt a wound.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: Because nobody goes through life without a scar.
quotes.name: Carol Burnett

quotes.message: Have you ever been hurt and the place tries to heal a bit, and you just pull the scar off of it over and over again.
quotes.name: Rosa Parks

quotes.message: A scar is what happens when the word is made flesh.
quotes.name: Leonard Cohen

quotes.message: A really strong woman accepts the war she went through and is ennobled by her scars.
quotes.name: Carly Simon

quotes.message: I just don't want to die without a few scars.
quotes.name: Chuck Palahniuk

quotes.message: When I stand before thee at the day's end, thou shalt see my scars and know that I had my wounds and also my healing.
quotes.name: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.message: Children show scars like medals. Lovers use them as secrets to reveal. A scar is what happens when the word is made flesh.
quotes.name: Leonard Cohen

quotes.message: I like someone who is a little crazy but coming from a good place. I think scars are sexy because it means you made a mistake that led to a mess.
quotes.name: Angelina Jolie

quotes.message: I think it's one of the scars in our culture that we have too high an opinion of ourselves. We align ourselves with the angels instead of the higher primates.
quotes.name: Angela Carter

quotes.message: It is foolish to pretend that one is fully recovered from a disappointed passion. Such wounds always leave a scar.
quotes.name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.message: Be fond of the man who jests at his scars, if you like, but never believe he is being on the level with you.
quotes.name: Pamela Hansford Johnson

quotes.message: We are still living in the aftershock of Hiroshima, people are still the scars of history.
quotes.name: Edward Bond

quotes.message: The sudden disappointment of a hope leaves a scar which the ultimate fulfillment of that hope never entirely removes.
quotes.name: Thomas Hardy

quotes.message: Keeping score of old scores and scars, getting even and one upping, always makes you less than you are.
quotes.name: Malcolm Forbes

quotes.message: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not to wisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.
quotes.name: Wallace Stegner

quotes.message: A little talent is a good thing to have if you want to be a writer. But the only real requirement is the ability to remember every scar.
quotes.name: Stephen King

quotes.message: The wounds of conscience always leave a scar.
quotes.name: Publilius Syrus

quotes.message: Be proud of your scars. They remind you that you have the will to live.
quotes.name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.message: Be proud of your scars. They have everything to do with your strength, and what you've endured. They're a treasure map to the deep self.
quotes.name: Clarissa Pinkola Estés

quotes.message: A scar is not always a flaw. Sometimes a scar may be redemption inscribed in the flesh, a memorial to something endured, to something lost.
quotes.name: Dean Koontz

quotes.message: Only fools pity survivors their scars and you should never kowtow to fools
quotes.name: Jeaniene Frost

quotes.message: There is no shame in scars, Ismae.
quotes.name: R.L. LaFevers

quotes.message: Life might hurt, might bruise, might forever scar, but it was for living.
quotes.name: Nalini Singh

quotes.message: I can handle scars, especially ones that are on the outside.
quotes.name: Jessica Sorensen

quotes.message: But the scars are always there, waiting for something to poke them.
quotes.name: Tammara Webber

quotes.message: The Lord will not wish to count my trophies, but my scars.
quotes.name: Frank Laubach

quotes.message: Forgiveness is a scalpel that removes emotional scars.
quotes.name: Maxwell Maltz

quotes.message: It's easy for someone to joke about scars if they've never been cut.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: As a scar commemorates what happened, so is memory but itself a scar.
quotes.name: Carl Phillips

quotes.message: Whatever doesn't kill you leaves scars.
quotes.name: Susan Sontag

quotes.message: The scars left from the child's defeat in the fight against irrational authority are to be found at the bottom of every neurosis.
quotes.name: Erich Fromm

quotes.message: In the middle of the journey of our life I found myself astray in a dark wood where the straight road had been lost sight of.
quotes.name: Dante Alighieri

quotes.message: An adventure is only an inconvenience rightly considered. An inconvenience is only an adventure wrongly considered.
quotes.name: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.message: The journey between what you once were and who you are now becoming is where the dance of life really takes place.
quotes.name: Barbara De Angelis

quotes.message: We shall not cease from exploration and the end of all our exploring will be to arrive where we started... and know the place for the first time.
quotes.name: TS Eliot

quotes.message: The road of life twists and turns and no two directions are ever the same. Yet our lessons come from the journey, not the destination.
quotes.name: Don Williams, Jr.

quotes.message: Focus on the journey, not the destination. Joy is found not in finishing an activity but in doing it.
quotes.name: Greg Anderson

quotes.message: To get through the hardest journey we need take only one step at a time, but we must keep on stepping
quotes.name: Chinese Proverbs

quotes.message: It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end
quotes.name: Ursula K. Leguin

quotes.message: A journey is best measured in friends rather than miles
quotes.name: Tim Cahill

quotes.message: We have stories to tell, stories that provide wisdom about the journey of life.
quotes.name: Rabbi Saul Rubin

quotes.message: If you are facing in the right direction, all you need to do is keep on walking.
quotes.name: Buddhist Saying

quotes.message: Our life is an endless journey; it is like a broad highway that extends infinitely into the distance. The practice of meditation provides a vehicle to travel on that road.
quotes.name: Chogyam Trungpa

quotes.message: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view. May your mountains rise into and above the clouds.
quotes.name: Edward Abbey

quotes.message: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive, and the true success is to labor.
quotes.name: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.message: Even journey has an end.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.
quotes.name: Marcel Proust

quotes.message: I believe that life is a journey, often difficult and sometimes incredibly cruel, but we are well equipped for it if only we tap into our talents and gifts and allow them to blossom.
quotes.name: Les Brown

quotes.message: The only journey is the one within.
quotes.name: Rainer Maria Rilke

quotes.message: We advance on our journey only when we face our goal, we are confident and believe we are going to succeed.
quotes.name: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.message: If you can see your path laid out in front of you step by step, you know it's not your path. Your own path you make with every step you take. That's why it's your path.
quotes.name: Joseph Campbell

quotes.message: To get where you want to go you can't only do what you like.
quotes.name: Peter Abrahams

quotes.message: You can't get there by bus, only by hard work, risking, and by not quite knowing what you're doing. What you'll discover will be wonderful: yourself.
quotes.name: Alan Alda

quotes.message: There are roads out of the secret place within us which we must all move as we go to touch others.
quotes.name: Romare Bearden

quotes.message: The bottom line is: We must be working on arriving at the destination for which we were put on this planet.
quotes.name: Yehuda Berg

quotes.message: Everyday is a journey,and the journey itself is home.
quotes.name: Matsuo Basho

quotes.message: There are many trails up the mountain, but in time they all reach the top.
quotes.name: Anya Seton

quotes.message: Let your mind start a journey thru a strange new world. Leave all thoughts of the world you knew before. Let your soul take you where you long to be...Close your eyes let your spirit start to soar, and you'll live as you've never lived before.
quotes.name: Erich Fromm

quotes.message: If all difficulties were known at the outset of a long journey, most of us would never start out at all.
quotes.name: Dan Rather

quotes.message: We must get beyond textbooks, go out into the bypaths and untrodden depths of the wilderness and travel and explore and tell the world the glories of our journey.
quotes.name: John Hope Franklin

quotes.message: One of the greatest discoveries a man makes, one of his greatest surprises, is to find he can do what he was afraid he couldn't.
quotes.name: Henry Ford

quotes.message: All journeys have secret destinations of which the traveler is unaware.
quotes.name: Martin Buber

quotes.message: I soon realized that no journey carries one far unless, as it extends into the world around us, it goes an equal distance into the world within.
quotes.name: Lillian Smith

quotes.message: The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.
quotes.name: Marcel Proust

quotes.message: Exploration is really the essence of the human spirit.
quotes.name: Frank Borman

quotes.message: We may run, walk, stumble, drive, or fly, but let us never lose sight of the reason for the journey, or miss a chance to see a rainbow on the way.
quotes.name: Gloria Gaither

quotes.message: The journey is the reward.
quotes.name: Tao Expression

quotes.message: We are not human beings on a spiritual journey. We are spiritual beings on a human journey.
quotes.name: Stephen Covey

quotes.message: The journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
quotes.name: Lao Tzu

quotes.message: The journey you wish to take can only begin from where you are right now this very minute.
quotes.name: Ron Atchison

quotes.message: A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it.
quotes.name: John Steinbeck

quotes.message: One approaches journey's end. But the end is a goal, not a catastrophe.
quotes.name: George Sand

quotes.message: The soul of a journey is liberty, perfect liberty, to think, feel, do just as one pleases.
quotes.name: William Hazlitt

quotes.message: An involuntary return to the point of departure is, without doubt, the most disturbing of all journeys.
quotes.name: Iain Sinclair

quotes.message: Life is a journey of mind. And man is the vessel that carries this mind. Therefore based on this premise it is safe to conclude that man does not evolve, but mind does.
quotes.name: Mark-Anthony St. Rose

quotes.message: It is not the destination where you end up but the mishaps and memories you create along the way!
quotes.name: Penelope Riley

quotes.message: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
quotes.name: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.message: Sometimes we have to go through the darkness alone, before we can see the light.
quotes.name: Adele Comandini

quotes.message: The great difference between voyages rests not with the ships, but with the people you meet on them.
quotes.name: Amelia E. Barr

quotes.message: What is a journey? Is it just distance traveled? Time spent? No, it's what happens on the way. It's the things that shape you. At the end of the journey, you're not the same.
quotes.name: Mayor Richard Wilkins III

quotes.message: Never stop just because you feel defeated. The journey to the other side is attainable only after great suffering.
quotes.name: Santosh Kalwar

quotes.message: A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it.
quotes.name: John Steinbeck

quotes.message: A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it.
quotes.name: John Steinbeck

quotes.message: Sometimes it's worth lingering on the journey for a while before getting to the destination.
quotes.name: Richelle Mead

quotes.message: If you fuel your journey on the opinions of others, you are going to run out of gas.
quotes.name: Steve Maraboli

quotes.message: A journey will have pain and failure. It is not only the steps forward that we must accept. It is the stumbles. The trials. The knowledge that we will fail. That we will hurt those around us.
quotes.name: Brandon Sanderson

quotes.message: No journey out of grief was straightforward. There would be good days and bad days.
quotes.name: Jojo Moyes

quotes.message: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising every time we fail.
quotes.name: Confucious

quotes.message: Negative results are just what I want. They're just as valuable to me as positive results. I can never find the thing that does the job best until I find the ones that don't.
quotes.name: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.message: Success is not a good teacher, failure makes you humble.
quotes.name: Shah Rukh Khan

quotes.message: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: Sometimes by losing a battle you find a new way to win the war.
quotes.name: Donald Trump

quotes.message: There's always failure. And there's always disappointment. And there's always loss. But the secret is learning from the loss, and realizing that none of those holes are vacuums.
quotes.name: Michael J. Fox

quotes.message: I can accept failure, everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not trying.
quotes.name: Michael Jordan

quotes.message: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
quotes.name: Truman Capote

quotes.message: Like success, failure is many things to many people. With positive mental attitude, failure is a learning experience, a rung on the ladder, a plateau at which to get your thoughts in order and prepare to try again.
quotes.name: W. Clement Stone

quotes.message: If you try to be anyone but yourself, you will fail; if you are not true to your own heart, you will fail. Then again, there's no success like failure.
quotes.name: Bob Dylan

quotes.message: I think you have to try and fail, because failure gets you closer to what you're good at.
quotes.name: Louis C.K.

quotes.message: Any man can make mistakes, but only an idiot persists in his error.
quotes.name: Cicero

quotes.message: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
quotes.name: Winston Churchill

quotes.message: Failure after long perseverance is much grander than never to have a striving good enough to be called a failure.
quotes.name: George Eliot

quotes.message: The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want most for what you want right now.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.
quotes.name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.message: You build on failure. You use it as a stepping stone. Close the door on the past. You don't try to forget the mistakes, but you don't dwell on it. You don't let it have any of your energy, or any of your time, or any of your space.
quotes.name: Johnny Cash

quotes.message: Failure is unimportant. It takes courage to make a fool of yourself.
quotes.name: Charlie Chaplin

quotes.message: It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all, in which case you have failed by default.
quotes.name: J.K. Rowling

quotes.message: Failure is a bend in the road, not the end of the road. Learn from failure and keep moving forward.
quotes.name: Roy T. Bennett

quotes.message: There is no failure except in no longer trying.
quotes.name: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.message: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
quotes.name: Og Mandino

quotes.message: You have committed a double mistake, firstly by not keeping the engagement yesterday and secondly, by coming when you were not expected.
quotes.name: Visvesvaraya

quotes.message: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
quotes.name: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.message: If at first you don't succeed, destroy all evidence that you tried.
quotes.name: Steven Wright

quotes.message: Don't be afraid to fail. Don't waste energy trying to cover up failure. Learn from your failures and go on to the next challenge. It's ok to fail. If you're not failing, you're not growing.
quotes.name: H. Stanley Judd

quotes.message: My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them.
quotes.name: Jack Kerouac

quotes.message: I thank God for my failures. Maybe not at the time but after some reflection. I never feel like a failure just because something I tried has failed.
quotes.name: Dolly Parton

quotes.message: Life is full of screwups. You're supposed to fail sometimes. It's a required part of the human existance.
quotes.name: Sarah Dessen

quotes.message: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of a greater or equal benefit.
quotes.name: Napoleon Hill

quotes.message: Remember that failure is an event, not a person.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
quotes.name: Henry Ford

quotes.message: The wise say that our failure is to form habits: for habit is the mark of a stereotyped world.
quotes.name: Anthony C. Grayling

quotes.message: Why do I talk about the benefits of failure? Simply because failure meant a stripping away of the inessential. I stopped pretending to myself that I was anything other than what I was and began to direct all my energy into finishing the only work that mattered to me.
quotes.name: J.K. Rowling

quotes.message: Failing to prepare is preparing to fail.
quotes.name: John Wooden

quotes.message: Do not be embarrassed by your failures, learn from them and start again.
quotes.name: Richard Branson

quotes.message: My great concern is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with failure.
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: Far better is it to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure... than to rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy nor suffer much, because they live in a gray twilight that knows not victory nor defeat.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: Grief can be the garden of compassion. If you keep your heart open through everything, your pain can become your greatest ally in your life's search for love and wisdom.
quotes.name: Rumi

quotes.message: Grief is in two parts. The first is loss. The second is the remaking of life.
quotes.name: Anne Roiphe

quotes.message: Grief is the price we pay for love.
quotes.name: Queen Elizabeth II

quotes.message: Grief is perhaps an unknown territory for you. You might feel both helpless and hopeless without a sense of a 'map' for the journey. Confusion is the hallmark of a transition. To rebuild both your inner and outer world is a major project.
quotes.name: Anne Grant

quotes.message: Don't grieve. Anything you lose comes round in another form.
quotes.name: Rumi

quotes.message: In times of grief and sorrow I will hold you and rock you and take your grief and make it my own. When you cry I cry and when you hurt I hurt.
quotes.name: Nicholas Sparks

quotes.message: Only people who are capable of loving strongly can also suffer great sorrow, but this same necessity of loving serves to counteract their grief and heals them.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite.
quotes.name: Cassandra Clare

quotes.message: Grief is not as heavy as guilt, but it takes more away from you.
quotes.name: Veronica Roth

quotes.message: Grieving is a journey that teaches us how to love in a new way now that our loved one is no longer with us. Consciously remembering those who have died is the key that opens the hearts, that allows us to love them in new ways.
quotes.name: Tom Attig

quotes.message: There is no grief like the grief that does not speak.
quotes.name: Henry Wordsworth

quotes.message: Grief is not a disorder, a disease or a sign of weakness. It is an emotional, physical and spiritual necessity, the price you pay for love. The only cure for grief is to grieve.
quotes.name: Earl Grollman

quotes.message: All things grow with time -- except grief.
quotes.name: Yiddish Proverb

quotes.message: Grief is light that is capable of counsel.
quotes.name: Proverb

quotes.message: Mourning is not forgetting... It is an undoing. Every minute tie has to be untied and something permanent and valuable recovered and assimilated from the dust. The end is gain, of course. Blessed are they that mourn, for theyshall be made strong, in fact. But the process is like all other human births, painful and long and dangerous.
quotes.name: Margery Allingham

quotes.message: Grief is hard on friendships, but it doesn't have to be. Sometimes, all it takes is a little honesty between friends. If we gently and lovingly explain what we need from the relationship during our time of grief, and what we are willing to do in return, we can turn even a lukewarm friendship into something special.
quotes.name: Margaret Brownley

quotes.message: One often calms one's grief by recounting it.
quotes.name: Pierre Corneille

quotes.message: Tears are the silent language of grief.
quotes.name: Voltaire

quotes.message: Grief makes one hour ten.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: Grief is the price we pay for love.
quotes.name: Queen Elizabeth II

quotes.message: There is no pain so great as the memory of joy in present grief.
quotes.name: Aeschylus

quotes.message: We all want to do something to mitigate the pain of loss or to turn grief into something positive, to find a silver lining in the clouds. But I believe there is real value in just standing there, being still, being sad.
quotes.name: John Green

quotes.message: But grieving people are selfish. They won't let you comfort them and they say you don't understand and they make you feel useless when all your life you've been functional to them.
quotes.name: Melina Marchetta

quotes.message: That was the hard thing about grief, and the grieving. They spoke another language, and the words we knew always fell short of what we wanted them to say.
quotes.name: Sarah Dessen

quotes.message: Grieving, like being blind, is a strange business; you have to learn how to do it. We seek company in mourning, but after the early bursts of tears, after the praises have been spoken, and the good days remembered, and the lament cried, and the grave closed, there is no company in grief. It is a burden borne alone.
quotes.name: Ursula K. Le Guin

quotes.message: Deep grief sometimes is almost like a specific location, a coordinate on a map of time. When you are standing in that forest of sorrow, you cannot imagine that you could ever find your way to a better place. But if someone can assure you that they themselves have stood in that same place, and now have moved on, sometimes this will bring hope.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Gilbert

quotes.message: It is true that the grief journey is very lonely, but it is also up to you to decide just how lonely you will make it.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Berrien

quotes.message: To spare oneself from grief at all cost can be achieved only at the price of total detachment, which excludes the ability to experience happiness.
quotes.name: Erich Fromm

quotes.message: While grief is fresh, every attempt to divert only irritates. You must wait till it be digested, and then amusement will dissipate the remains of it.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: The time you spend grieving over a man should never exceed the amount of time you actually spent with him.
quotes.name: Rita Rudner

quotes.message: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
quotes.name: Epictetus

quotes.message: Since every death diminishes us a little, we grieve - not so much for the death as for ourselves.
quotes.name: Lynn Caine

quotes.message: He that conceals his grief finds no remedy for it.
quotes.name: Turkish Proverb

quotes.message: Tearless grief bleeds inwardly.
quotes.name: Christian Nevell Bovee

quotes.message: There is no grief like the grief that does not speak.
quotes.name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.message: If you suppress grief too much it can well redouble.
quotes.name: Moliere

quotes.message: Grief can take care of itself, but to get the full value of joy must have somebody to divide it with.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: In private grief with careless scorn. In public seem to triumph and not to mourn.
quotes.name: John C. Granville

quotes.message: You don't go around grieving all the time, but the grief is still there and always be.
quotes.name: Nigella Lawson

quotes.message: There's a general impulse to distract the grieving person - as if you could.
quotes.name: Joan Didion

quotes.message: The littlest thing can have the strongest connection when you're grieving. Your proustian, poetic nerve is turned up to ten.
quotes.name: Mike Mills

quotes.message: I think grieving is the same for everybody that lost someone you love deeply. It's the same. You know, you're really no different than anybody else who's lost somebody they adored.
quotes.name: Lee Radziwill

quotes.message: When people are grieving, it's kind of like a storm, and you need something to grab onto, but often you have to brave it on your own.
quotes.name: Clare Bowen

quotes.message: Grief is not a disorder, a disease or sign of weakness. It is an emotional, physical and spiritual necessity, the price you pay for love. The only cure for grief is to grieve.
quotes.name: Earl Grollman

quotes.message: Grief is like the ocean; it comes on waves ebbing and flowing. Sometimes the water is calm, and sometimes it is overwhelming. All we can do is learn to swim.
quotes.name: Vicki Harrison

quotes.message: Give sorrow words; the grief that does not speak whispers the o'er~fraught heart and bids it break.
quotes.name: Shakespeare

quotes.message: Emotionally, grief is a mixture of raw feelings such as sorrow, anguish, anger, regret, longing, fear, and deprivation. Grief may be experienced physically as exhaustion, emptiness, tension, sleeplessness, or loss of appetite.
quotes.name: Judy Tatelbaum

quotes.message: Grief is a passage, not a place to stay. Grief is not a sign of weakness, nor a lack of faith...it is the price of love.
quotes.name: Author Unkonwn

quotes.message: Grieving is not a short-term process; it's not even a long-term process; it's a lifelong process. 'Having a future' now means that although your life will flow again, it will flow differently as a result of the loss. Your grief will become incorporated into your life history, become a part of your identity. And you will continue now, and forever, to redefine your relationship with your deceased loved one. Death doesn't end the relationship, it simply forges a new type of relationship - one based not on physical presence but on memory, spirit, and love.
quotes.name: Ashley Davis Bush

quotes.message: Most people sell their souls, and live with a good conscience on the proceeds.
quotes.name: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.message: In England the only homage which they pay to Virtue — is hypocrisy.
quotes.name: Lord Byron

quotes.message: He combines the manners of a Marquis with the morals of a Methodist.
quotes.name: W.S. Gilbert

quotes.message: If I were two-faced would I be wearing this one?
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: In 1969 I published a small book on Humility. It was a pioneering work which has not, to my knowledge, been superseded.
quotes.name: Lord Longford

quotes.message: I hope you have not been leading a double life, pretending to be wicked and being really good all the time. That would be hypocrisy.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: I call it not humility, so long as we think there is any good remaining in us. Those who have joined together two things, to think humbly of ourselves before God and yet hold our own righteousness in some estimation, have . . . a pernicious hypocrisy.
quotes.name: John Calvin

quotes.message: There is nothing which God more abominates than when men endeavor to cloak themselves by submitting signs and external appearance for integrity of heart.
quotes.name: John Calvin

quotes.message: The human heart has so many crannies where vanity hides, so many holes where falsehood lurks, is so decked out with deceiving hypocrisy, that it often dupes itself.
quotes.name: John Calvin

quotes.message: It's gotten to the point that our ability to manufacture fraud now exceeds our ability to detect it.
quotes.name: Andrew Niccol

quotes.message: If you don't live it, it won’t come out of your horn.
quotes.name: Charlie Parker

quotes.message: Along with much bad thinking . . . goes split living.
quotes.name: J.I. Packer

quotes.message: Many a man who tries to talk as if he were standing on a mountain shows by what he says that he is up to his eyes in the mud.
quotes.name: Billy Sunday

quotes.message: Conventionality is not morality. Self- righteousness is not religion. To attack the first is not to assail the last. To pluck the mask from the face of the Pharisee, is not to lift an impious hand to the Crown of Thorns.
quotes.name: Charlotte Bronte

quotes.message: Keep up appearances; there lies the test; . The world will give thee credit for the rest. . Outward be fair, however foul within; . Sin if thou wilt, but then in secret sin.
quotes.name: Charles Churchill

quotes.message: In the mouths of many men soft words are like roses that soldiers put into the muzzles of their muskets on holidays.
quotes.name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.message: Hypocrisy is the most difficult and nerve-racking vice that any man can pursue; it needs an unceasing vigilance and a rare detachment of spirit. It cannot, like adultery or gluttony, be practised at spare moments; it is a whole-time job.
quotes.name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.message: I want that glib and oily art . To speak and purpose not.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: I sit on a man’s back, choking him and making him carry me, and yet assure myself and others that I am very sorry for him and wish to ease his lot by all possible means—except by getting off his back.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: Democracies cannot dispense with hypocrisy any more than dictatorships can with cynicism.
quotes.name: Georges Bernanos

quotes.message: Good now, play one scene . Of excellent dissembling, and let it look . Like perfect honor.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: One, by his own confession to me, that can put on two several faces, anti look his enemies in the face with as much love as his friends. But, good God! what an age is this, and what a world is this! that a man cannot live without playing the knave and dissimulation.
quotes.name: Samuel Pepys

quotes.message: Without some dissimulation no business can he carried on at all.
quotes.name: Earl of Philip Dormer Stanhope Chesterfield

quotes.message: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity.
quotes.name: George Orwell

quotes.message: If it were not for the intellectual snobs who pay-in solid cash — the tribute which philistinism owes to culture, the arts would perish with their starving practitioners. Let us thank heaven for hypocrisy.
quotes.name: Aldous Huxley

quotes.message: It is very noble hypocrisy not to talk of one's self.
quotes.name: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quotes.message: There is a false modesty, which is vanity; a false glory, which is levity; a false grandeur. which is meanness; a false virtue, which is hypocrisy; and a false wisdom, which is prudery.
quotes.name: Jean De La Bruyere

quotes.message: As hypocrisy is said to be the highest compliment to virtue, the art of lying is the strongest acknowledgment of the force of truth.
quotes.name: William Hazlitt

quotes.message: The best brought-up children are those who have seen their parents as they are. Hypocrisy is not the parents’ first duty.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: There is a certain satisfaction in coming down to the lowest ground of politics, for then we get rid of cant and hypocrisy.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: She heard the snuffle of hypocrisy in her prayer. She had to cease to pray.
quotes.name: George Meredith

quotes.message: Sincerity is the prime requisite in every approach to the God who . . . hates all hypocrisy, falsehood, and deceit.
quotes.name: Geoffrey B. Wilson

quotes.message: Of all the cants which are canted in this canting world, tho‘ the cant of hypocrites may be the worst, the cant of criticism is the most tormenting.
quotes.name: Laurence Sterne

quotes.message: What matters in Politics is what men actually do - sincerity is no excuse for acting unpolitically. and insincerity may be channelled by politics into good results.
quotes.name: Bernard Crick

quotes.message: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
quotes.name: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.message: But everybody agrees, somewhere in his heart, that there ought to be some connection between what you believe and how you behave, what you advocate for others and how you live yourself.
quotes.name: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.message: You don’t say ‘they all do it’ unless you know you’ve been doing it too.
quotes.name: Christopher Hitchens

quotes.message: Humans are very seldom either totally sincere or totally hypocritical. Their moods change, their motives are mixed, and they arc often themselves quite mistaken as to what their motives are.
quotes.name: C.S. Lewis

quotes.message: Let the world know you as you are, not as you think you should be, because sooner or later, if you are posing, you will forget the pose, and then where are you?
quotes.name: Fanny Brice

quotes.message: Woe to you. scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitewashed tombs, which outwardly appear beautiful, but within they are full of dead men's bones and all uncleanness.
quotes.name: The Bible

quotes.message: A criminal is twice a criminal when he adds hypocrisy to his crime.
quotes.name: Marie Corelli

quotes.message: Even man alone is sincere. At the entrance of a second person, hypocrisy begins.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: No man, for any considerable period, can wear one face to himself and another to the multitude, without finally getting bewildered as to which may be the true.
quotes.name: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.message: For neither man nor angel can discern . Hypocrisy, the only evil that walks . Invisible, except to God alone.
quotes.name: John Milton

quotes.message: In our interactions with people, a benevolent hypocrisy is frequently required — acting as though we do not see through the motives of their actions.
quotes.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.message: Hypocrisy in anything whatever may deceive the cleverest and most penetrating man, but the least wide-awake of children recognizes it, and is revolted by it, however ingeniously it may be disguised.
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: A humanitarian is always a hypocrite.
quotes.name: George Orwell

quotes.message: The first man was a hypocrite and a coward, qualities which have not yet failed in his line; it is the foundation upon which all civilizations have been built.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: If any teacher tries to persuade you that hypocrisy is not a part of your blood and bone and flesh, and can therefore be trained out of you by determined and watchful and ceaseless and diligent application to the job, do not you heed him; ask him to cure himself first, then call again.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: You say hypocrisy... absolutely! You're darn tooting! Hypocrisy! It's the latest fad. It's what the cool kids are into now, right? Let's not kid ourselves. We've gone from liberte egalite fraternite, to vanite letharge hypocrise. But in the words of Lord Byron, 'Let us have wine, women, mirth, and the laughter . Sermons and soda water the day after.
quotes.name: Dean Van Puddy

quotes.message: The human qualities can be expressed in one word: hypocrisy.
quotes.name: Joe

quotes.message: Ooh, hypocrisy, Franklin. Civilization's greatest virtue.
quotes.name: Michael De Santa

quotes.message: I studied at Oxford and Harvard. Majored in Western hypocrisy.
quotes.name: Colonel Moon

quotes.message: You can... Love the church for their good works, or you can hate the church for their... Hypocrisy.
quotes.name: Robert Goren

quotes.message: Hypocrisy is a boil. Lancing a boil is never pleasant. Although they could have been more careful with the blade.
quotes.name: High Sparrow

quotes.message: Oh, Thomas. I see now what it takes for a man to make his way in this world. He must make a practice of hypocrisy.
quotes.name: John Lambert

quotes.message: Do you think I'm a hypocrite? Well, you should. I wouldn't disagree with you. The road to power is paved with hypocrisy. And casualties. Never regret.
quotes.name: Francis Underwood

quotes.message: Let's be philosophical. People have lived like hypocrites since the dawn of time. That's what you call 'civilisation.
quotes.name: François Vasseur

quotes.message: Well, you can't really admit to being a hypocrite because well, then you're not a hypocrite.
quotes.name: Gordo

quotes.message: Rather a scoundrel than a hypocrite.
quotes.name: Jack Vincent

quotes.message: The great gift of human beings is that we have the power of empathy.
quotes.name: Meryl Streep

quotes.message: Every gift which is given, even though it be small, is in reality great, if it is given with affection.
quotes.name: Pindar

quotes.message: Love the giver more than the gift.
quotes.name: Brigham Young

quotes.message: The excellence of a gift lies in its appropriateness rather than in its value.
quotes.name: Charles Dudley Warner

quotes.message: Each day offers us the gift of being a special occasion if we can simply learn that as well as giving, it is blessed to receive with grace and a grateful heart.
quotes.name: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quotes.message: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
quotes.name: Winston Churchill

quotes.message: The older I get, the better I understand that every day is a gift.
quotes.name: Joel Osteen

quotes.message: The greatest gift you can give another is the purity of your attention.
quotes.name: Richard Moss

quotes.message: The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
quotes.name: David Viscott

quotes.message: The greatest gift that you can give yourself is a little bit of your own attention.
quotes.name: Anthony J. D'Angelo

quotes.message: The manner of giving is worth more than the gift.
quotes.name: Pierre Corneille

quotes.message: Your gift is not what you do but what you are.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: The secret of success lies in the perfection of one's gift and working frantically towards God's given potential.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
quotes.name: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.message: The greatest gift is a portion of thyself.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Your personal truth is your gift to the world.
quotes.name: Jennifer Elisabeth

quotes.message: There's no greater gift than thinking that you had some impact on the world, for the better.
quotes.name: Gloria Steinem

quotes.message: The most beautiful gift of nature is that it gives one pleasure to look around and try to comprehend what we see.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: It's so tempting to resist a little gift when you're expecting the otherwise.
quotes.name: Toba Beta

quotes.message: The most considerate gift you can offer to someone who gave you advice is to not saddle them with the fallout of you ignoring it.
quotes.name: Alan Robert Neal

quotes.message: In terms of instilling the values of mental toughness and work ethic, discipline is the gift that keeps on giving.
quotes.name: William Baldwin

quotes.message: The greatest gift is our own eyes, sense of smell, and abilities to deduce.
quotes.name: Patricia Cornwell

quotes.message: God wants nothing of you but the gift of a peaceful heart.
quotes.name: Meister Eckhart

quotes.message: I think relationships are work, but love is a gift.
quotes.name: Anne Hathaway

quotes.message: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.
quotes.name: Mary Oliver

quotes.message: Anything that had to do with art I been doing all my life. It was a gift. It's nothing I work real hard at doing.
quotes.name: Erykah Badu

quotes.message: The gift of learning to meditate is the greatest gift you can give yourself in this lifetime.
quotes.name: Sogyal Rinpoche

quotes.message: Realize that your gift does not belong merely to you.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: A gift of truth is the gift of love.
quotes.name: David Icke

quotes.message: I believe that the greatest gift you can give your family and the world is a healthy you.
quotes.name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.message: You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.message: With the gift of listening comes the gift of healing.
quotes.name: Catherine Doherty

quotes.message: Breath is the finest gift of nature. Be grateful for this wonderful gift.
quotes.name: Amit Ray

quotes.message: Give whatever you are doing and whoever you are with the gift of your attention.
quotes.name: Jim Rohn

quotes.message: A gift consists not in what is done or given, but in the intention of the giver or doer.
quotes.name: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quotes.message: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is God's gift, that's why we call it the present.
quotes.name: Joan Rivers

quotes.message: I look upon life as a gift from God. I did nothing to earn it.
quotes.name: Joyce Cary

quotes.message: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
quotes.name: Hubert H. Humphrey

quotes.message: If you love someone, the greatest gift you can give them is your presence.
quotes.name: Thich Nhat Hanh

quotes.message: The gift of life is so precious that we should feel an obligation to pay back the universe for the gift of being alive.
quotes.name: Ray Bradbury

quotes.message: A book is a gift you can open again and again.
quotes.name: Garrison Keillor

quotes.message: Make all you can, save all you can, give all you can.
quotes.name: John Wesley

quotes.message: The greatest gift you can ever give another person is your own happiness.
quotes.name: Esther Hicks

quotes.message: Love is a gift worth giving, sometimes you just give more than you revive.
quotes.name: Anonymous

quotes.message: The greatest gift that you can give to others is the gift of unconditional love and acceptance.
quotes.name: Brian Tracy

quotes.message: Greatness comes from the inside and once you believe you have it, it's yours to share with the world.
quotes.name: Chris Burkmenn

quotes.message: Every great person is always being helped by everybody; for their gift is to get good out of all things and all persons.
quotes.name: John Ruskin

quotes.message: Everytime you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.
quotes.name: Mother Teresa

quotes.message: The greatest gift is the ability to forget to forget the bad things and focus on the good.
quotes.name: Joe Biden

quotes.message: The best gifts come from the heart, not the store.
quotes.name: Sarah Dessen

quotes.message: I believe the Bible is the best gift God has ever given to man.
quotes.name: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.message: Blessed are they who have the gift of making friends,for it is one of God's best gifts.
quotes.name: Thomas Hughes

quotes.message: The Gift of Truth excels all other Gifts.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: In accepting the Gift you Honor the Giver.
quotes.name: Stephen R. Donaldson

quotes.message: Every gift from a friend is a wish for your happiness.
quotes.name: Richard Bach

quotes.message: Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
quotes.name: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

quotes.message: You don't choose your family. They are God's gift to you, as you are to them.
quotes.name: Desmond Tutu

quotes.message: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
quotes.name: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.message: The gift without the giver is rare.
quotes.name: James Russell Lowell

quotes.message: The greatest gift in life is to be remembered.
quotes.name: Ken Venturi

quotes.message: The gift you offer another person is just your being.
quotes.name: Ram Dass

quotes.message: Exercise to stimulate, not to annihilate. The world wasn't formed in a day, and neither were we. Set small goals and build upon them.
quotes.name: Lee Haney

quotes.message: Training gives us an outlet for suppressed energies created by stress and thus tones the spirit just as exercise conditions the body.
quotes.name: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quotes.message: Exercise is labor without weariness.
quotes.name: Samuel Johnson

quotes.message: Few people know how to take a walk. The qualifications are endurance, plain clothes, old shoes, an eye for nature, good humor, vast curiosity, good speech, good silence and nothing too much.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Other exercises develop single powers and muscles, but dancing embellishes, exercises, and equalizes all the muscles at once.
quotes.name: Jean Paul

quotes.message: If we could give every individual the right amount of nourishment and exercise, not too little and not too much, we would have found the safest way to health.
quotes.name: Hippocrates

quotes.message: Movement is a medicine for creating change in a person's physical, emotional, and mental states.
quotes.name: Carol Welch

quotes.message: It is a shame for a man to grow old without seeing the beauty and strength of which his body is capable.
quotes.name: Socrates

quotes.message: Exercise and application produce order in our affairs, health of body, cheerfulness of mind, and these make us precious to our friends.
quotes.name: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.message: True enjoyment comes from activity of the mind and exercise of the body; the two are ever united.

quotes.message: We do not stop exercising because we grow old - we grow old because we stop exercising.
quotes.name: Kenneth Cooper

quotes.message: Physical fitness is not only one of the most important keys to a healthy body, it is the basis of dynamic and creative intellectual activity.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: Those who think they have not time for bodily exercise will sooner or later have to find time for illness.
quotes.name: Edward Stanley

quotes.message: An early-morning walk is a blessing for the whole day.
quotes.name: Adam Smith

quotes.message: Fitness: if it came in a bottle, everyone would be in good shape.
quotes.name: Cher

quotes.message: Lack of activity destroys the good condition of every human being, while movement and methodical physical exercise save it and preserve it.
quotes.name: Plato

quotes.message: A vigorous five-mile walk will do more good for an unhappy but otherwise healthy adult than all the medicine and psychology in the world.
quotes.name: Paul Dudley White

quotes.message: To be good, we must do good; and by doing good we take a sure means of being good, as the use and exercise of the muscles increase their power.
