quotes.name: Terri Guillemets

quotes.message: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: Dreams come in a size too big so that we may grow into them.
quotes.name: Josie Bisse

quotes.message: Keep your head up, because SUCCESS doesn't come from giving up. Just dream big, WORK hard, and BELIEVE that you can do anything you put your mind to.
quotes.name: Nishan Panwar

quotes.message: Don't be afraid of the space between your dreams and reality. If you can dream it, you can make it so.
quotes.name: Belva Davis

quotes.message: If you can dream it, then you can achieve it.
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
quotes.name: Walt Disney

quotes.message: Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.
quotes.name: James Matthew Barrie

quotes.message: Now is the time for us to dream new dreams, move out into uncharted waters and stay positive
quotes.name: Jane Freeman

quotes.message: A dream doesn't become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
quotes.name: Colin Powell

quotes.message: The only place where your dream becomes impossible is in your own thinking.
quotes.name: Robert H. Schuller

quotes.message: If reality can destroy dreams, then dreams can destroy reality.
quotes.name: Conway Stone

quotes.message: No matter what we do in our life, to be a success we need to be consistent and determined towards our dream.
quotes.name: Anurag Prakash Ray

quotes.message: Don't let go of your dreams.
quotes.name: Catherine Pulsifer

quotes.message: The bigger the dream, the better the story.
quotes.name: Richelle E. Goodrich

quotes.message: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.
quotes.name: Khalil Gibran

quotes.message: Dream big dreams! Only big dreams have the power to move your mind and spirit.
quotes.name: Brian Tracy

quotes.message: Every great dream begins with a perspective; change the world with the power and strength within you
quotes.name: Kamal Khanzada

quotes.message: Dream big, talk big, and turn your faith loose!
quotes.name: Kenneth Copeland

quotes.message: All men who have achieved great things have been dreamers.
quotes.name: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.message: The important thing is to dare to dream big, then take action to make it come true.
quotes.name: Joe Girard

quotes.message: In our dreams lies our unfinished work for the world.
quotes.name: Joan Chittister

quotes.message: Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Begin it now.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: Fly without wings; dream with open eyes.
quotes.name: Dejan Stojanovic

quotes.message: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
quotes.name: Earl Nightingale

quotes.message: When the actions becomes frequent than the words, success becomes heavier than the dreams. Do more, say less.
quotes.name: Israelmore Ayivor

quotes.message: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: If you want to reach the highest peak of your dream, think big. You should always remember that there is nothing wrong if you set higher goals, aims or standards in life most especially if you know that you can do it.
quotes.name: Kellie Sullivan

quotes.message: If you can imagine it, You can achieve it. If you can dream it, you can become it.
quotes.name: William Arthur Ward

quotes.message: Sanity becomes the fantasy that keeps us sane; a rhetorical prop in an unplotted, threatening world.
quotes.name: Adam Phillips

quotes.message: Sanity, it would seem, was a dangerously contagious disease.
quotes.name: H. Beam Piper

quotes.message: Sanity that is the great virtue of the ancient literature; the want of that is the great defect of the modern, in spite of its variety and power.
quotes.name: Matthew Arnold

quotes.message: Sanity calms, but madness is more interesting.
quotes.name: John Russell

quotes.message: Sanity is not truth. Sanity is conformity to what is socially expected. Truth is sometimes in conformity, sometimes not.
quotes.name: Robert M. Pirsig

quotes.message: One of the definitions of sanity is the ability to tell real from unreal. Soon we'll need a new definition.
quotes.name: Alvin Toffler

quotes.message: Sanity brings pain but madness is a vile thing.
quotes.name: Euripides

quotes.message: Sanity is not something you find; sanity is something you either have or don't.
quotes.name: Byron Pulsifer

quotes.message: Our sanity depends essentially on a narrowness of vision the ability to select the elements vital to survival, while ignoring the great truths.
quotes.name: Josephine Hart

quotes.message: Sanity is only that which is within the frame of reference of conventional thought.
quotes.name: Erich Fromm

quotes.message: One means of sanity is to retain a hold on the natural world, Americans still have that chance, more than many peoples.
quotes.name: Wallace Stegner

quotes.message: Sanity remains defined simply by the ability to cope with insane conditions.
quotes.name: Anna Casttilo

quotes.message: Sanity is a madness put to good uses.
quotes.name: George Santayana

quotes.message: Sanity lies somewhere between the inhibitions of conventional morality and the looseness of the extreme impulse
quotes.name: Chogyam Trungpa

quotes.message: Sanity is very rare; every man almost and every woman has a dash of madness.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Sometimes, to regain sanity, one had to acknowledge and embrace the madness.
quotes.name: Morgan Rhodes

quotes.message: All sanity depends on this: that it should be a delight to feel the roughness of a carpet under smooth soles, a delight to feel heat strike the skin, a delight to stand upright, knowing the bones are moving easily under the flesh.
quotes.name: Doris Lessing

quotes.message: Sanity is, in essence, nothing more than the ability to live in harmony with nature's laws.
quotes.name: Freeman Dyson

quotes.message: Sanity, soundness, and sincerity, of which gleams and strains can still be found in the human brain under powerful microscopes, flourish only in a culture of clarification, which is now becoming harder and harder to detect with the naked eye.
quotes.name: James Thurber

quotes.message: Sanity is a sliding scale for we all hold beliefs that may not correspond to reality.
quotes.name: Julian Gold

quotes.message: The fight for sanity in our gun safety laws is not by any means over. In many ways it's just beginning.
quotes.name: Michael D. Barnes

quotes.message: Sanity is to be found in accurate honesty to oneself.
quotes.name: David Bain

quotes.message: Sanity is sometimes a matter of going on, outwardly, as if everything is all right.
quotes.name: Mary McMullen

quotes.message: For me, insanity is super sanity. The normal is psychotic. Normal means lack of imagination, lack of creativity.
quotes.name: Jean Dubuffet

quotes.message: Sanity can take one of only two forms: that of ignorance, or denial.
quotes.name: Derek R. Audette

quotes.message: Sanity is surely not about normality in the statistical sense: it is about an eternal and natural idea of the healthy personality which indeed may be a rare achievement.
quotes.name: Michael Leunig

quotes.message: The sanity of society is a balance of a thousand insanity's.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Too much sanity may be madness and the maddest of all, to see life as it is and not as it should be.
quotes.name: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.message: Sanity consists in not being subdued by your means. Fancy prices are paid for position, and for the culture of talent, but to thegrand interests, superficial success is of no account.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Sanity is a madness put to good uses; waking life is a dream controlled.
quotes.name: George Santayana

quotes.message: Sanity is an illusion. Created by the minds of people who fear the wicked.
quotes.name: Alexander Thol

quotes.message: Sanity is the lot of those who are most obtuse, for lucidity destroys one's equilibrium: it is unhealthy to honestly endure the labors of the mind which incessantly contradict what they have just established.
quotes.name: Georges Bataille

quotes.message: Sanity means the wholeness of the consciousness. And our society is only part conscious, like an idiot.
quotes.name: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.message: Don't show off every day, or you'll stop surprising people. There must always be some novelty left over. The person who displays a little more of it each day keeps up expectations, and no one ever discovers the limits of his talent.
quotes.name: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.message: You should encourage a child to show off. You can say to a child, 'Stop being rude,' 'Stop shouting,' 'Stop jumping around on the furniture.' But 'Stop showing off'? That's awful.
quotes.name: Charles Dance

quotes.message: He (the Sage) does not show off, therefore he shines.
quotes.name: Laozi

quotes.message: If you do something too good, then, after a while, if you don't watch it, you start showing off. And then you're not as good any more.
quotes.name: J.D. Salinger

quotes.message: A kung fu man lives without being dependant on the opinions of others, and a master, unlike the beginner, holds himself in reserve. He is quiet and unassuming, with no desire to show off.
quotes.name: Bruce Lee

quotes.message: Power doesn't have to show off. Power is confident, self-assuring, self-starting and self-stopping, self-warming and self-justifying. When you have it, you know it.
quotes.name: Ralph Ellison

quotes.message: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory.
quotes.name: Bruce Lee

quotes.message: You know the bad thing about being a survivor... You keep having to get into difficult situations in order to show off your gift.
quotes.name: Carrie Fisher

quotes.message: Knowledge is like underwear. It is useful to have it, but not necessary to show it off.
quotes.name: Nicky Gumbel

quotes.message: Vanity, showing off, is an attitude that reduces spirituality to a worldly thing, which is the worst sin that could be committed in the church.
quotes.name: Pope Francis

quotes.message: The disease that knowledge brings is arrogance, and the disease that worship brings is showing off.
quotes.name: Ibn Taymiyyah

quotes.message: He's a shy man. Life has taught him not to show off what is most precious to him.
quotes.name: Yann Martel

quotes.message: It is no use to keep private information which you can't show off.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: Knowledge and ability were tools, not things to show off.
quotes.name: Haruki Murakami

quotes.message: The church is never a place to show off. Do your good deeds quietly.
quotes.name: Max Lucado

quotes.message: The better you feel about yourself, the less you feel the need to show off.
quotes.name: Robert Hand

quotes.message: My mother helped me understand how not to show off what I knew, but how to use it so that others might benefit.
quotes.name: Dorothy Height

quotes.message: When everything seems to be set to show me off as intelligent, the fool I always keep hidden takes over all that I say.
quotes.name: Pablo Neruda

quotes.message: Don't pretend to be a great master and don't try to show off your strength.
quotes.name: Gichin Funakoshi

quotes.message: The man that shows off, to that one who wants to convince of his value is to himself.
quotes.name: Domenico Cieri

quotes.message: It takes guts to praise someone's nobility, instead of show off or self-praise.
quotes.name: Chetan Patel

quotes.message: Let your personality speak louder than the show off.
quotes.name: Upasana Gupta

quotes.message: Destiny is no matter of chance. It is a matter of choice. It is not a thing to be waited for, it is a thing to be achieved.
quotes.name: William Jennings Bryan

quotes.message: Happiness is a choice. You can choose to be happy. There's going to be stress in life, but it's your choice whether you let it affect you or not.
quotes.name: Valerie Bertinelli

quotes.message: We're always going to argue about abortion. It's a hard choice and it's controversial, and that's why I'm pro-choice, because I want people to make their own choices.
quotes.name: Hillary Clinton

quotes.message: Often people ask how I manage to be happy despite having no arms and no legs. The quick answer is that I have a choice. I can be angry about not having limbs, or I can be thankful that I have a purpose. I chose gratitude.
quotes.name: Nick Vujicic

quotes.message: Every man builds his world in his own image. He has the power to choose, but no power to escape the necessity of choice.
quotes.name: Ayn Rand

quotes.message: I'm single because I was born that way.
quotes.name: Mae West

quotes.message: Never open the door to a lesser evil, for other and greater ones invariably slink in after it.
quotes.name: Baltasar Gracian

quotes.message: You can have peace. Or you can have freedom. Don't ever count on having both at once.
quotes.name: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.message: There are no safe choices. Only other choices.
quotes.name: Libba Bray

quotes.message: I have seen the best of you, and the worst of you, and I choose both.
quotes.name: Sarah Kay

quotes.message: Life presents many choices, the choices we make determine our future.
quotes.name: Catherine Pulsifer

quotes.message: In every single thing you do, you are choosing a direction. Your life is a product of choices.
quotes.name: Dr. Kathleen Hall

quotes.message: Each person has a choice; the choice to do as one may wish and as one wants remains with the individual. If a person sees no benefit to change, they will not change.
quotes.name: Byron Pulsifer

quotes.message: Life is a choice - as is how you handle the pitfalls along its bumpy road.
quotes.name: Julie Donner Andersen

quotes.message: We are partners by fate. We become friends by choice.
quotes.name: Jacquie McTaggart

quotes.message: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities
quotes.name: Joanne Kathleen Rowling

quotes.message: Choose a job you love and you will never have to work a day in your life
quotes.name: Confucius

quotes.message: When you have to make a choice and don't make it, that is in itself a choice.
quotes.name: William James

quotes.message: A man is happy so long as he chooses to be happy and nothing can stop him.
quotes.name: Alexander Solzenitsyn

quotes.message: Life is a sum of all your choices.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: Choice means saying no to one thing so you can say yes to another.
quotes.name: Dan Millman

quotes.message: What we call the secret of happiness is no more a secret than our willingness to choose life.
quotes.name: Leo F. Buscaglia

quotes.message: A man is happy so long as he choose to be happy.
quotes.name: Gene Roddenberry

quotes.message: For what is the best choice, for each individual is the highest it is possible for him to achieve.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: Every person, all the events of your life are drawn there because you have them there. What you choose to do with them is up to you.
quotes.name: Richard Bach

quotes.message: Choice is nothing in itself; everything depends on what one is able to choose.
quotes.name: Harold O. J. Brown

quotes.message: The difficulty in life is the choice.
quotes.name: George Moore

quotes.message: Choice is free, and it is opposed to force and constraint, and a man is said to choose those things which he likes, which he loves, which his soul inclines to, when he is carried to them, not by the compulsion of an external principle, but by his own propension and inclination.
quotes.name: Thomas Manton

quotes.message: When you make a choice, you change the future.
quotes.name: Deepak Chopra

quotes.message: When you close your eyes to tragedy, you close your eyes to greatness.
quotes.name: Stephen Vizinczey

quotes.message: The tragedy of this world is that everyone is alone. For a life in the past cannot be shared with the present.
quotes.name: Alan Lightman

quotes.message: In this world there are two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it. The last is much the worst.
quotes.name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.message: Life is a comedy to those who think, a tragedy to those who feel.
quotes.name: Jean Racine

quotes.message: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
quotes.name: Joseph Stalin

quotes.message: A tragedy is the imitation of an action that is serious and also, as having magnitude, complete in itself with incidents arousing pity and fear, wherewith to accomplish its catharsis of such emotions.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: Here is the tragedy: when you are the victim of depression, not only do you feel utterly helpless and abandoned by the world, you also know that very few people can understand, or even begin to believe, that life can be this painful.
quotes.name: Giles Andreae

quotes.message: The tragedy about history - personally and globally is that while we may learn it we rarely learn from it.
quotes.name: Rasheed Ogunlaru

quotes.message: Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor.
quotes.name: Sholom Aleichem

quotes.message: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
quotes.name: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.message: You use everything. You use tragedy you use everything.
quotes.name: Shannon Hoon

quotes.message: There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it.
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: Life's tragedy is that we get old too soon and wise too late.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: Tragedy is like strong acid it dissolves away all but the very gold of truth.
quotes.name: D. H. Lawrence

quotes.message: The greatest tragedy in mankind's entire history may be the hijacking of morality by religion.
quotes.name: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.message: One of the greatest tragedies in life is to lose your own sense of self and accept the version of you that is expected by everyone else.
quotes.name: K.L. Toth

quotes.message: The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or of joy. The tragedy of this world is that everyone is alone. For a life in the past cannot be shared with the present. Each person who gets stuck in time gets stuck alone.
quotes.name: Alan Lightman

quotes.message: Tragedy, for me, is not a conflict between right and wrong, but between two different kinds of right.
quotes.name: Peter Shaffer

quotes.message: The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or joy.
quotes.name: Alan Lightman

quotes.message: There is nothing more tragic than to find an individual bogged down in the length of life, devoid of breadth.
quotes.name: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quotes.message: It's not the tragedies that kill us, it's the messes.
quotes.name: Dorothy Parker

quotes.message: Tragedy is a representation of action that is worthy of serious attention, complete in itself and of some magnitude bringing about by means of pity and fear the purging of such emotions.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: This world is a comedy to those that think, a tragedy to those that feel.
quotes.name: Horace Walpole

quotes.message: A great tragedy is occurring. Millions of people are dying prematurely. These people are killing themselves and they don't even know it.
quotes.name: Tim Loy

quotes.message: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
quotes.name: Mel Brooks

quotes.message: The tragedy is not that love doesn't last. The tragedy is the love that lasts.
quotes.name: Shirley Hazzard

quotes.message: You get tragedy where the tree, instead of bending, breaks.
quotes.name: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.message: A tragedy need not have blood and death; it's enough that it all be filled with that majestic sadness that is the pleasure of tragedy.
quotes.name: Jean Racine

quotes.message: Tragedy makes you grow up.
quotes.name: Jane Campion

quotes.message: The tragedy of life is not that man loses, but that he almost wins.
quotes.name: Heywood Broun

quotes.message: Only a great mind that is overthrown yields tragedy.
quotes.name: Jacques Barzun

quotes.message: A perfect tragedy is the noblest production of human nature.
quotes.name: Joseph Addison

quotes.message: The tragedy of life is what dies inside a man while he lives.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: Now that your eyes are open, make the sun jealous with your burning passion to start the day. Make the sun jealous or stay in bed.
quotes.name: Malak El Halabi

quotes.message: It's a new day. Yesterday's failure is redeemed at the sunrise.
quotes.name: Todd Stocker

quotes.message: Renew your mind every morning with pure thoughts.
quotes.name: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.message: You've got to get up every morning with determination if you're going to go to bed with satisfaction.
quotes.name: George Lorimer

quotes.message: I never wake up in the morning and wonder why I am here. I wake up and wonder why I am not making here better.
quotes.name: Jeffrey Fry

quotes.message: The world is new to us every morning - this is God's gift; and every man should believe he is reborn each day.
quotes.name: Baal Shem Tov

quotes.message: As we arise each morning, let us determine to respond with love and kindness to whatever might come our way.
quotes.name: Thomas S. Monson

quotes.message: Every morning brings new potential, but if you dwell on the misfortunes of the day before, you tend to overlook tremendous opportunities.
quotes.name: Harvey Mackay

quotes.message: There are two ways of waking up in the morning.
quotes.name: Fulton J. Sheen

quotes.message: Just one small positive thought in the morning can change your whole day.
quotes.name: Dalai Lama

quotes.message: Each morning brings a hidden blessing; a blessing which is unique to that day, and which cannot be kept or re-used. If we do not use this miracle today, it will be lost.
quotes.name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.message: My idea of a good morning is one when I open my eyes, take a deep breath, then go back to sleep.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Every morning you have two choices: continue to sleep with your dreams, or wake up and chase them.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: In the morning, instead of saying to yourself, ˜I got to wake up' say 'I get to wake up!'
quotes.name: Erykah Badu

quotes.message: I wake up every morning and I surprise myself. I wake up to a new me.
quotes.name: Gina Carano

quotes.message: Good morning is not just a word, its an action and a belief to live the entire day well. Morning is the time when you set the tone for the rest of the day.
quotes.name: Fain Blake

quotes.message: No matter how bad things are, you can at least be happy that you woke up this morning.
quotes.name: D. L. Hughley

quotes.message: Morning is a wonderful blessing, either sunny or stormy. It stands for hope giving us another start of what we call life.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Morning is an important time of day, because how you spend your morning can often tell you what kind of day you are going to have.
quotes.name: Lemony Snicket

quotes.message: Every morning I wake up saying, I'm still alive; a miracle. And so I keep on pushing.
quotes.name: Jacques Cousteau

quotes.message: When I first open my eyes upon the morning meadows and look out upon the beautiful world, I thank God I am alive.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Every morning you are reborn, and prove it worthwhile.
quotes.name: Jay Doll

quotes.message: Every morning a new sun greets us and our new life begins.
quotes.name: Marty Rubin

quotes.message: I'd like mornings better if they started later.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: If you want to be happy, be!
quotes.name: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.message: Every morning is new as the last one, uncreased as the not quite imaginable first.
quotes.name: Jane Hirshfield

quotes.message: I opened two gifts this morning. They were my eyes.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: You know that feeling when you wake up in the morning and you're excited for the day? That's one of my main goals in life.
quotes.name: Kirsten Dunst

quotes.message: Every morning is a fresh breath and blessings.
quotes.name: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.message: Each morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: The sun is new each day.
quotes.name: Heraclitus

quotes.message: God's mercy is fresh and new every morning.
quotes.name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.message: I get up every morning and it's going to be a great day. You never know when it's going to be over so I refuse to have a bad day.
quotes.name: Paul Henderson

quotes.message: Gloom and darkness are temporary. Joy comes in the morning.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: Every sunny morning is a great fountain; we quaff 'sweet hope' from it.
quotes.name: Mehmet Murat ildan

quotes.message: Every morning starts a new page in your story. Make it a great one today.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.
quotes.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.message: Every morning is a beautiful morning.
quotes.name: Terri Guillemets

quotes.message: No man knows till he has suffered from the night how sweet and dear to his heart and eye the morning can be.
quotes.name: Bram Stoker

quotes.message: No matter how dark the night, morning always comes, and our journey begins anew.
quotes.name: Lulu

quotes.message: You have to know why you get up every morning.
quotes.name: Dan Buettner

quotes.message: A horrible night might be hidden in a beautiful morning!
quotes.name: Mehmet Murat ildan

quotes.message: After every dark night comes a glorious morning of a new day.
quotes.name: Sunday Adelaja

quotes.message: Rise up, start fresh see the bright opportunity in each day
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: First thing every morning before you arise say out loud, 'I believe', three times.
quotes.name: Ovid

quotes.message: Welcome every morning with a smile. Look on the new day as another special gift from your Creator, another golden opportunity to complete what you were unable to finish yesterday.
quotes.name: Og Mandino

quotes.message: There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.
quotes.name: Bernard Williams

quotes.message: To get up each morning with the resolve to be happy is to set your own conditions to the events of each day. To do this is to condition circumstances instead of being conditioned by them.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Nothing is more beautiful than the loveliness of the woods before sunrise.
quotes.name: George Washington Carver

quotes.message: You've got to get up every morning with a smile on your face and show the world all the love in your heart.
quotes.name: Carole King

quotes.message: If you have only one smile in you, give it to the people you love. Don't be surly at home, then go out in the street and start grinning good morning at total strangers.
quotes.name: Maya Angelou

quotes.message: Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.
quotes.name: Meister Eckhart

quotes.message: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great
quotes.name: Zig Ziglar

quotes.message: Every day may not be good, but there's something good in every day.
quotes.name: Alice Morse Earle

quotes.message: When you do something noble and beautiful and nobody notice, do not be sad. For the sun every morning is a beautiful spectacle and yet most of the audience still sleeps.
quotes.name: John Lennon

quotes.message: The first hour of the morning is the rudder of the day.
quotes.name: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.message: Don’t judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
quotes.name: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.message: Every day brings new choices.
quotes.name: Martha Beck

quotes.message: Give every day the chance to become the most beautiful day of your life.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: When a new day begins, dare to smile gratefully.
quotes.name: Steve Maraboli

quotes.message: Wake up every morning with the thought that something wonderful is about to happen.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Early morning cheerfulness can be extremely obnoxious.
quotes.name: William Feather

quotes.message: When you rise in the morning, give thanks for the light, for your life, for your strength. Give thanks for your food and for the joy of living. If you see no reason to give thanks, the fault lies in yourself.
quotes.name: Tecumseh

quotes.message: Thank God every morning when you get up that you have something to do that day, which must be done, whether you like it or not.
quotes.name: James Russell Lowell

quotes.message: Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you'll start to see a big difference in your life.
quotes.name: Yoko Ono

quotes.message: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
quotes.name: Doug Larson

quotes.message: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
quotes.name: Len Wein

quotes.message: A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked.
quotes.name: Bernard Meltzer

quotes.message: True friends are those who came into your life, saw the most negative part of you, but are not ready to leave you, no matter how contagious you are to them.
quotes.name: Michael Bassey Johnson

quotes.message: True friends can communicate with their eyes.
quotes.name: Mary Rose Magnaye

quotes.message: True friends are not mirrors where we can always see ourselves reflected in a positive light.
quotes.name: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.message: The friend who holds your hand and says the wrong thing is made of dearer stuff than the one who stays away.
quotes.name: Barbara Kingsolver

quotes.message: You can always tell a real friend: when you've made a fool of yourself he doesn't feel you've done a permanent job.
quotes.name: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.message: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: Only your real friends will tell you when your face is dirty.
quotes.name: Sicilian Proverb

quotes.message: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart.
quotes.name: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.message: A loyal friend laughs at your jokes when they're not so good, and sympathizes with your problems when they're not so bad.
quotes.name: Arnold H. Glasgow

quotes.message: The friend is the man who knows all about you, and still likes you.
quotes.name: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.message: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
quotes.name: Arnold Glasow

quotes.message: Cherish the friend who tells you a harsh truth, wanting ten times more to tell you a loving lie.
quotes.name: Robert Brault

quotes.message: A friend can tell you things you don't want to tell yourself.
quotes.name: Frances Ward Weller

quotes.message: It's the ones you can call up at 4:00 a.m. that really matter.
quotes.name: Marlene Dietrich

quotes.message: 10. A friend shares the good times and helps out by listening during the bad times.
quotes.name: Molly Oliver

quotes.message: A true friend is someone you can disagree with and still remain friends. For if not, they weren't true friends in the first place.
quotes.name: Sandy Ratliff

quotes.message: A true friend encourages us, comforts us, supports us like a big easy chair, offering us a safe refuge from the world.
quotes.name: H. Jackson Brown

quotes.message: A friend knows the song in my heart and sings it to me when my memory fails.
quotes.name: Donna Roberts

quotes.message: Ah, how good it feels! The hand of an old friend.
quotes.name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.message: One measure of friendship consists not in the number of things friends can discuss, but in the number of things they need no longer mention.
quotes.name: Clifton Fadiman

quotes.message: Our most difficult task as a friend is to offer understanding when we don't understand.
quotes.name: Robert Brault

quotes.message: Tell me something only you know and make a new friend.
quotes.name: Dejan Stojanovic

quotes.message: What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.
quotes.name: C.S. Lewis

quotes.message: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
quotes.name: Elizabeth Foley

quotes.message: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
quotes.name: Edgar Watson Howe

quotes.message: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
quotes.name: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.message: One friend in a lifetime is much; two are many; three are hardly possible.
quotes.name: Henry Adams

quotes.message: The essence of true friends is to make allowances for another's little lapses.
quotes.name: David Storey

quotes.message: We need old friends to help us grow old and new friends to help us stay young.
quotes.name: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quotes.message: A friend is one who knows us, but loves us anyway.
quotes.name: Jerome Cummings

quotes.message: Never shall I forget the days I spent with you. Continue to be my friend, as you will always find me yours.
quotes.name: Ludwig van Beethoven

quotes.message: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
quotes.name: Charles R. Swindoll

quotes.message: If you live to be a hundred, I want to live to be a hundred minus one day so I never have to live without you.
quotes.name: A. A. Milne

quotes.message: Good friends help you to find important things when you have lost them your smile, your hope, and your courage.
quotes.name: Doe Zantamata

quotes.message: Are we not like two volumes of one book?
quotes.name: Marceline Desbordes-Valmore

quotes.message: We have been friends together In sunshine and in shade.
quotes.name: Caroline Sheridan Norton

quotes.message: We all take different paths in life, but no matter where we go, we take a little of each other everywhere.
quotes.name: Tim McGraw

quotes.message: Surround yourself only with people who are going to lift you higher.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: Friends are born, not made.
quotes.name: Henry Adams

quotes.message: Man's best friend is one who wishes well to the object of his wish for his sake, even if no one is to know of it.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: A sure friend is known in unsure circumstances.
quotes.name: Quintus Ennius

quotes.message: Have friends, not for the sake of receiving, but of giving.
quotes.name: Joseph Roux

quotes.message: Our triumphs seem hollow unless we have friends to share them, and our failures are made bearable by their understanding.
quotes.name: James Rachels

quotes.message: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
quotes.name: Helen Keller

quotes.message: Life is being on the wire, everything else is just waiting.
quotes.name: Karl Wallenda

quotes.message: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I . . . I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
quotes.name: Robert Frost

quotes.message: The secret to my success is that I bit off more than I could chew and chewed as fast as I could.
quotes.name: Paul Hogan

quotes.message: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten.
quotes.name: Tony Robbins

quotes.message: I always did something I was a little not ready to do. I think that's how you grow. When there's that moment of Wow, I'm not really sure I can do this,' and you push through those moments, that's when you have a breakthrough.
quotes.name: Marissa Mayer

quotes.message: Pearls don't lie on the seashore. If you want one, you must dive for it.
quotes.name: Chinese Proverb

quotes.message: You can't outwit fate by standing on the sidelines placing little sidebets about the outcome of life. Either you wade in and risk everything you have to play the game or you don't play at all. And if you don't play you can't win.
quotes.name: Judith Mcnaught

quotes.message: If things seem under control, you are just not going fast enough.
quotes.name: Mario Andretti

quotes.message: Whatever you can do, or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it.
quotes.name: Goethe

quotes.message: What you have to do and the way you have to do it is incredibly simple. Whether you are willing to do it is another matter.
quotes.name: Peter Drucker

quotes.message: Go out on a limb. That's where the fruit is.
quotes.name: Jimmy Carter

quotes.message: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
quotes.name: Pablo Picasso

quotes.message: Don't be afraid to take a big step. You can't cross a chasm in two small jumps.
quotes.name: David Lloyd George

quotes.message: Unless you choose to do great things with it, it makes no difference how much you are rewarded, or how much power you have.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: No man is worth his salt who is not ready at all times to risk his well-being, to risk his body, to risk his life in a great cause.
quotes.name: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.message: If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.
quotes.name: Jim Rohn

quotes.message: Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
quotes.name: E. E. Cummings

quotes.message: Life is inherently risky. There is only one big risk you should avoid at all costs, and that is the risk of doing nothing.
quotes.name: Denis Waitley

quotes.message: Some men see things as they are and say, Why ' I dream of things that never were, and say, Why not
quotes.name: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.message: Whenever you see a successful business, someone once made a courageous decision.
quotes.name: Peter Drucker

quotes.message: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
quotes.name: Dr. Martin Luther King

quotes.message: If we allow risk to be a fear, then we are sure not to succeed. But, if we approach risk with proper planning, and a good attitude, then most times we can minimize the risk and use it to our advantage.
quotes.name: Catherine Pulsifer

quotes.message: As we risk ourselves, we grow. Each new experience is a risk.
quotes.name: Fran Watson

quotes.message: Dare to reinvent yourself. Dare to allow yourself to change your mind. Dare to go against what everyone else wants for you. Dare to say no to what everyone else wants from you.
quotes.name: Claire Louise Hay

quotes.message: If you are not living on the edge, you are taking up too much room.
quotes.name: Jayne Howard

quotes.message: The policy of being too cautious is the greatest risk of all.
quotes.name: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.message: The men who have done big things are those who were not afraid to attempt big things, who were not afraid to risk failure in order to gain success.
quotes.name: B.C. Forbes

quotes.message: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
quotes.name: Will Rogers

quotes.message: A ship is always safe at the shore - but that is NOT what it is built for.
quotes.name: Albert Einstein

quotes.message: Take calculated risks. That is quite different from being rash.
quotes.name: General George S. Patton

quotes.message: Take risks: if you win, you will be happy; if you lose, you will be wise.
quotes.name: Unkown

quotes.message: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
quotes.name: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.message: Risk more than others think is safe. Care more than others think is wise. Dream more than others think is practical. Expect more than others think is possible.
quotes.name: Cadet Maxim

quotes.message: Never let the odds keep you from doing what you know in your heart you were meant to do.
quotes.name: H. Jackson Brown

quotes.message: We must walk consciously only part way toward our goal and then leap in the dark to our success.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Progress always involves risks. You can't steal second base and keep your foot on first.
quotes.name: Frederick B. Wilcox

quotes.message: Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.
quotes.name: Leonard Da Vinci

quotes.message: Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
quotes.name: African Proverb

quotes.message: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
quotes.name: Elinor Smith

quotes.message: There are three kinds of people: Those who make things happen, those who watch things happen, and those who ask, What happened
quotes.name: Casey Stengel

quotes.message: If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything, is ready, we shall never begin.
quotes.name: Ivan Turgenev

quotes.message: There are risks and costs to a program of action. But they are far less than the long-range risks and costs of comfortable inaction.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: There is a time for daring and a time for caution, and a wise man knows which is called for.
quotes.name: John Keating

quotes.message: Adventure is worthwhile in itself.
quotes.name: Amelia Earhart

quotes.message: If you let your fear of consequence prevent you from following your deepest instinct, your life will be safe, expedient and thin.
quotes.name: Katharine B. Hathaway

quotes.message: The possibility that we may fail in the struggle ought not to deter us from the support of a cause we believe to be just.

quotes.message: The truth is that our finest moments are most likely to occur when we are feeling deeply uncomfortable, unhappy, or unfulfilled. quotes.message: We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.

quotes.message: The more one judges, the less one loves.
quotes.name: Honoré de Balzac

quotes.message: When you meet a man, you judge him by his clothes; when you leave, you judge him by his heart.
quotes.name: Russian Proverb

quotes.message: In judging of others, a man laboreth in vain, often erreth and easily sinneth; but in judging and examining himself, he always laboreth fruitfully.
quotes.name: Thomas a Kempis

quotes.message: To judge a man by his weakest link or deed is like judging the power of the ocean by one wave.
quotes.name: Elvis Presley

quotes.message: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
quotes.name: Voltaire

quotes.message: A person that judges others will inevitably judge themselves harshly. It is only when one stops judging others that, that one can truly appreciate the beauty within.
quotes.name: Ando Oomae

quotes.message: None are more unjust in their judgments of others than those who have a high opinion of themselves.
quotes.name: Charles Spurgeon

quotes.message: If you find it necessary to judge someone by their past, don't be surprised when they find it necessary to put you there.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: When we come to judge others it is not by ourselves as we really are that we judge them, but by an image that we have formed of ourselves from which we have left out everything that offends our vanity or would discredit us in the eyes of the world.
quotes.name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.message: To judge a man means nothing more than to ask: What content does he give to the form of humanity? What concept should we have of humanity if he were its only representative?
quotes.name: Wilhelm Von Humboldt

quotes.message: I do not judge men by anything they can do. Their greatest deed is the impression they make on me.
quotes.name: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.message: Every man is entitled to be valued by his best moment.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Our natural egoism leads us to judge people by their relations to ourselves. We want them to be certain things to us, and for us that is what they are; because the rest of them is no good to us, we ignore it.
quotes.name: W. Somerset Maugham

quotes.message: By judging others, you make yourself easy to judge.
quotes.name: Ashly Lorenzana

quotes.message: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
quotes.name: Mother Teresa

quotes.message: Judge not, that ye be not judged.
quotes.name: The Bible

quotes.message: The least amount of judging we can do, the better off we are.
quotes.name: Michael J Fox

quotes.message: Don't pass judgement on others or you might be judged yourself.
quotes.name: Brian Cohen

quotes.message: Beware, so long as you live, of judging men by their outward appearance.
quotes.name: Jean de la Fontaine

quotes.message: Instead of judging people, we need to pray.
quotes.name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.message: I can usually judge a fellow by what he laughs at.
quotes.name: Wilson Mizner

quotes.message: If you judge, investigate.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: If you would judge, understand.
quotes.name: Seneca

quotes.message: Judge not according to appearance, but judge righteous judgment.
quotes.name: Bible

quotes.message: No accurate thinker will judge another person by that which the other person's enemies say about him.
quotes.name: Napoleon Hill

quotes.message: Do not judge, and you will never be mistaken.
quotes.name: Jean Jacques Rousseau

quotes.message: Judge not others unless you're prepared to be judged!
quotes.name: Johnny Rotten

quotes.message: People are always judging you based on where you're from, where you went to school, how you look, how you talk. But at the end of the day, you're going to have to look into the mirror and accept who you are. It's all about being authentic.
quotes.name: Andre Carson

quotes.message: The most dangerous leap is the leap to conclusions.
quotes.name: Woodrow Kroll

quotes.message: Never judge someone's character based on the words of another.
quotes.name: Suzy Kassem

quotes.message: Your judgments about another person say more about your own character than the character of the person you are pointing a finger at.
quotes.name: Alaric Hutchinson

quotes.message: Judging others is easy because it distracts us from the responsibility of judging ourselves.
quotes.name: Charles F. Glassman

quotes.message: When we generalize and judge people quickly without taking ample time, we've chosen a shortcut. It's superficial of us, and a lack of wisdom.
quotes.name: Assegid W. Habtewold

quotes.message: Praising God distracts us from the awful business of judging others and losing ourselves.
quotes.name: Brian A. Pankratz

quotes.message: He who judges himself will always judge others.
quotes.name: Vironika Tugaleva

quotes.message: Judge not, that ye be not judged. For with judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you again.
quotes.name: Matthew 7:1-2

quotes.message: Do you, my friend, pass judgement on others? You have no excuse at all, whoever you are. For when you judge others and then do the same things which they do, you condemn yourself.
quotes.name: Romans 2:1

quotes.message: If you spend time judging and criticizing people, you will not have time to heal from your pain or brokenness. You cannot love yourself when you judge or criticize others who are created in God's image and after His Likeness...in which you are also created.
quotes.name: Kemi Sogunle

quotes.message: Judgment separates us from the people we want to be close to incredibly quickly. Whether it’s our internal self-judgment that shuts down opportunity for connection or our judgment of others that makes it hard for loved ones to open up to us, judgment is cancer for authenticity in relationships.
quotes.name: Gina Senarighi

quotes.message: People make mistakes. When you judge them, you measure their weakness against your own strength. That’s not a fair measure. They have their strength, too. Their strength might be the weakest point in your life.
quotes.name: Nesta Jojoe Erskine

quotes.message: Only the shallow judge others, those with character know to judge themselves before they judge others.
quotes.name: Abhijit Naskar

quotes.message: We cannot judge either of the feelings or of the characters of men with perfect accuracy from their actions or their appearance in public; it is from their careless conversations, their half-finished sentences, that we may hope with the greatest probability of success to discover their real characters.
quotes.name: Maria Edgeworth

quotes.message: I know people can be judgmental and difficult. But if you shut yourself away from the world, you'll never see how beautiful it really is.
quotes.name: Imania Margria

quotes.message: Judging others is space-time wasted.
quotes.name: Rajesh

quotes.message: Judging the things you do not understand is like a game of gambling where setbacks are often than success.
quotes.name: Amit Kalantri

quotes.message: Let us not therefor judge one another any more: but judge this rather, that no man put a stumbling block or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.
quotes.name: Romans 14:12-13

quotes.message: Who judges others condemns himself.
quotes.name: Martin H. Manser

quotes.message: No man can justify censure or condemn another because indeed no man truly knows another.
quotes.name: Sir Thomas Browne

quotes.message: When it seems that God shows us the faults of others, keep on the safer side. It may be that thy judgment is false.
quotes.name: St. Catherine of Siena

quotes.message: You will not become a saint through other people's sins.
quotes.name: Anton Pavlovich Chekhov

quotes.message: The business of finding fault is very easy, and that of doing better very difficult.
quotes.name: St. Francis de Sales

quotes.message: The Lord knows those who are His. He will determine the saved and unsaved, and will never ask any man's opinion. So let's not give one.
quotes.name: Virgil Hurley

quotes.message: A desire to disgrace others never sprang from grace.
quotes.name: George Swinnock

quotes.message: Do not think of the faults of others but of what is good in them and faulty in yourself.
quotes.name: St. Teresa of Avila

quotes.message: A man's judgment of another depends more on the judging and on his passions than on the one being judged and his conduct.
quotes.name: Paul Tournier

quotes.message: Judging others makes us blind, whereas love is illuminating.
quotes.name: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quotes.message: The only measure of judging a human being is through that person’s character, because character is not determined by race, religion, gender or social status.
quotes.name: Abhijit Naskar

quotes.message: We are all flawed and creatures of our times.
quotes.name: Carl Sagan

quotes.message: Never judge people based on their nationality, religion, race, gender, skin colour or look. Humans are all the same. They’re God’s loving children.
quotes.name: Lily Amis

quotes.message: A man's judged by what he is and not what he was.
quotes.name: Jack Caldwell

quotes.message: Go a little easy on the people around you. Try to reel in judging thoughts. Think before you speak.
quotes.name: John Manning

quotes.message: We can learn how to stop judging and begin to accept and receive people where they are. Instead of judging them, we must become like them to win them.
quotes.name: Sandra M. Michelle

quotes.message: Real worship is that of the heart.
quotes.name: Henry Allen Ironside

quotes.message: Worship is love responding to love.
quotes.name: Judson Cornwall

quotes.message: Worship comes from a thankful heart.
quotes.name: Chris Tomlin

quotes.message: Worship is adoring contemplation of God.
quotes.name: R. A. Torrey

quotes.message: The worship of power is an old religion.
quotes.name: George Santayana

quotes.message: Worship is admiration becoming adoration.
quotes.name: Matt Papa

quotes.message: Worship is when we give God His breath back.
quotes.name: Louie Giglio

quotes.message: The worship of safety emasculates greatness.
quotes.name: Max Lucado

quotes.message: Worship is a way of seeing the world in the light of God.
quotes.name: Abraham Joshua Heschel

quotes.message: It is only when men begin to worship that they begin to grow.
quotes.name: Calvin Coolidge

quotes.message: We need worship for our spirit, fellowship for our soul and committed subservience for our body.
quotes.name: Larry Norman

quotes.message: To worship the product and ignore its development leads to dilettantism and reaction.
quotes.name: Hans Hofmann

quotes.message: He who desires to worship God must harbor no childish illusions about the matter but bravely renounce his liberty and humanity.
quotes.name: Mikhail Bakunin

quotes.message: When we really worship anything, we love not only its clearness but its obscurity. We exult in its very invisibility.
quotes.name: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.message: The instinct to worship is hardly less strong than the instinct to eat.
quotes.name: Dorothy Thompson

quotes.message: Genius worship is the inevitable sign of an uncreative age.
quotes.name: Clive Bell

quotes.message: We worship education but hate learning. We worship success but hate the successful. We worship fame but hate the famous.
quotes.name: Florence King

quotes.message: True worship doesn't keep looking at its watch.
quotes.name: N. T. Wright

quotes.message: The man who worships mere wealth is a snob.
quotes.name: Anthony Trollope

quotes.message: If worship bores you, you are not ready for heaven.
quotes.name: Aiden Wilson Tozer

quotes.message: Worship renews the spirit as sleep renews the body.
quotes.name: Richard Clarke Cabot

quotes.message: Worship your heroes from afar; contact withers them.
quotes.name: Bill Vaughan

quotes.message: Worship is giving God the best that He has given you.
quotes.name: Oswald Chambers

quotes.message: Real worship involves waiting.
quotes.name: Iris Murdoch

quotes.message: Worship is an attitude expressed.
quotes.name: Judson Cornwall

quotes.message: Worship the Silent Space in you.
quotes.name: Rajneesh

quotes.message: We worship God through our questions.
quotes.name: Abraham Joshua Heschel

quotes.message: Worship is the launching pad for life.
quotes.name: Rosaria Champagne Butterfield

quotes.message: In worship, God imparts himself to us.
quotes.name: C. S. Lewis

quotes.message: Worship is the grand theme of the Bible.
quotes.name: Reuben Morgan

quotes.message: Self worship is different from self love.
quotes.name: Vanna Bonta

quotes.message: Lawful worship consists in obedience alone.
quotes.name: John Calvin

quotes.message: To worship is to remember Who owns the house.
quotes.name: Walter Wink

quotes.message: Worship is not about having a fantastic voice.
quotes.name: Temi Peters

quotes.message: In the Lord's Prayer, the first petition is for daily bread. No one can worship God or love his neighbor on an empty stomach.
quotes.name: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.message: Those who worship God only, can get rid of anxiety of mind; others cannot.
quotes.name: Thiruvalluvar

quotes.message: Where it is a duty to worship the sun it is pretty sure to be a crime to examine the laws of heat.
quotes.name: John Morley

quotes.message: We worship money instead of honour.
quotes.name: Harry S. Truman

quotes.message: Songs of worship arise from a life of worship.
quotes.name: Tim Hughes

quotes.message: ...no worship is better than apathetic worship.
quotes.name: Francis Chan

quotes.message: Worship is the thank you that can't be silenced.
quotes.name: Max Lucado

quotes.message: Worship the work not the God, because work is God.
quotes.name: Amit Kalantri

quotes.message: Worship is just responding to the greatness of God.
quotes.name: Bob Rice

quotes.message: Worship of society and popular opinion is idolatry.
quotes.name: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.message: Worship is why we are born and why we are born again.
quotes.name: Aiden Wilson Tozer

quotes.message: To worship a crocodile is better to worship yourself.
quotes.name: Peter Kreeft

quotes.message: The highest form of worship is to answer God's prayer.
quotes.name: Agona Apell

quotes.message: If worship does not change us it has not been worship.
quotes.name: Richard J. Foster

quotes.message: Do not hate the player, nor the game...
quotes.name: T.F. Hodge

quotes.message: You need to be loyal to the people who have helped you in the past & gave you a break when you were not a big player.
quotes.name: Ziad K. Abdelnour

quotes.message: A fast car can make women 'like' a man; and a man 'like' women fast.
quotes.name: Mokokoma Mokhonoana

quotes.message: A trophy carries dust. Memories last forever.
quotes.name: Mary Lou Retton

quotes.message: Most people give up just when they're about to achieve success. They quit on the one yard line. They give up at the last minute of the game one foot from a winning touchdown.
quotes.name: Ross Perot

quotes.message: One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than 50 preaching it.
quotes.name: Knute Rockne

quotes.message: It isn't hard to be good from time to time in sports.
quotes.name: Willie Mays

quotes.message: Don't measure yourself by what you have accomplished, but by what you should have accomplished with your ability.
quotes.name: John Wooden

quotes.message: A lot of late nights in the gym, a lot of early mornings, especially when your friends are going out, you're going to the gym, those are the sacrifices that you have to make if you want to be an NBA basketball player.
quotes.name: Jason Kidd

quotes.message: Coaching is easy. Winning is the hard part.
quotes.name: Elgin Baylor

quotes.message: Great players are willing to give up their own personal achievement for the achievement of the group. It enhances everybody.
quotes.name: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

quotes.message: Bass players are always the intellectual kind, but nobody knows it.
quotes.name: Stanley Clarke

quotes.message: Every player should be accorded the privilege of at least one season with the Chicago Cubs. That's baseball as it should be played in God's own sunshine. And that's really living.
quotes.name: Alvin Dark

quotes.message: You don't think about anything because you just try to playevery game, every point. If you get some chance, you try to take this chance.
quotes.name: Nikolay Davydenko

quotes.message: I love the winning, I can take the losing, but most of all I love to play.
quotes.name: Boris Becker

quotes.message: The difference of great players is at a certain point in a match they raise their level of play and maintain it. Lesser players play great for a set, but then less.
quotes.name: Pete Sampras

quotes.message: Sports is human life in microcosm.
quotes.name: Howard Cosell

quotes.message: Champions keep playing until they get it right.
quotes.name: Billie Jean King

quotes.message: The medals don't mean anything and the glory doesn't last. It's all about your happiness. The rewards are going to come, but my happiness is just loving the sport and having fun performing.
quotes.name: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

quotes.message: To succeed...You need to find something to hold on to, something to motivate you, something to inspire you.
quotes.name: Tony Dorsett

quotes.message: Give your players something they can physically do - don't ask them to do something they can't do.
quotes.name: Lou Holtz

quotes.message: Practice does not make perfect. Only perfect practice makes perfect.
quotes.name: Vince Lombardi

quotes.message: A good coach will make his players see what they can be rather than what they are.
quotes.name: Ara Parseghian

quotes.message: We've been together since we've been teenagers. I can go away and disappear for two years, and when we get back together, it's like nothing ever has changed.
quotes.name: John Oates

quotes.message: You're breaking up, you're getting together, you're changing your life, you're arguing with your parents, you're making terrible mistakes, you're having great triumphs. It's what happens to teenagers.
quotes.name: Jason Katims

quotes.message: The thing that bums me out about 'The Real World' is I don't want to believe that teenagers are that stupid.
quotes.name: Kathy Griffin

quotes.message: Teenagers are more willing to experiment, and they'll find a way to wear something if they like it.
quotes.name: Bella Freud

quotes.message: Books are as dark as what is available to teenagers through the media every day.
quotes.name: Tamora Pierce

quotes.message: ... And these children that you spit on as they try to change their worlds are immune to your consultations.They're quite aware of what they're going through...
quotes.name: David Bowie

quotes.message: The biggest road block to action on genocide and other human rights crimes is ignorance. Most people just don't know that such things are happening, and often, if they have a vague idea they are happening, there is a feeling that there is nothing that can be done to stop these crimes.
quotes.name: John Prendergrast

quotes.message: Genocide is not just a murderous madness; it is, more deeply, a politics that promises a utopia beyond politics - one people, one land, one truth, the end of difference. Since genocide is a form of political utopia, it remains an enduring temptation in any multiethnic and multicultural society in crisis.
quotes.name: Michael Ignatief

quotes.message: As long as your ideology identifies the main source of the world's ills as a definable group, it opens the world up to genocide.
quotes.name: Steven Pinker

quotes.message: I think that the memory of Armenia's genocide opened my eyes at an early age to the existence of political cynicism.
quotes.name: Serj Tankian

quotes.message: Genocide is not a legitimate option. It's not ok to decide that an entire population has no right to live in the world. No matter whether these relationships are very proximate or very distant, there is no entitlement to expunge a population or to demean its basic humanity.
quotes.name: Judith Butler

quotes.message: In the aftermath of any war or genocide, healing and reconciliation are ultimate aspirations.
quotes.name: Janine de Giovanni

quotes.message: Genocide is an attempt to exterminate a people, not to alter their behavior.
quotes.name: Jack Schwartz

quotes.message: If human is capable of conducting genocide, no need for an asteroid to wipe out dinosaurs.
quotes.name: Toba Beta

quotes.message: Genocide begins, however improbably, in the conviction that classes of biological distinction indisputably sanction social and political discrimination.
quotes.name: Andrea Dworkin

quotes.message: The way to virtually eliminate genocide and mass murder appears to be through restricting and checking power. This means to foster democratic freedom.
quotes.name: Rudolph Rummel

quotes.message: The history of America is the history of a genocide that didn't end yet, the genocide of American civilizations.
quotes.name: Luis Bolognesi

quotes.message: Historical atrocities have certainly shown that dehumanizing any group is the first step toward genocide.
quotes.name: Robert Paul Weston

quotes.message: Nationalism of one kind or another was the cause of most of the genocide of the twentieth century. Flags are bits of colored cloth that governments use first to shrink-wrap people's minds and then as ceremonial shrouds to bury the dead.
quotes.name: Arundhati Roy

quotes.message: I don't think nations can stand aside for ethnic cleansing and genocide.
quotes.name: John Major

quotes.message: Recognition of the genocide is a triumph of human conscience and justice over intolerance and hatred.
quotes.name: Serzh Sargsyan

quotes.message: The cruel policy initiated by Columbus and pursued by his successors resulted in complete genocide.
quotes.name: Samuel Eliot Morison

quotes.message: Don't kill the goose that lays the golden egg.
quotes.name: Aesop

quotes.message: Enough is as good as a feast.
quotes.name: Sir Thomas Malory

quotes.message: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.
quotes.name: Aesop

quotes.message: He that is hard to please, may get nothing in the end.
quotes.name: Aesop

quotes.message: If you think your bundle of clothes too heavy, try picking up your neighbor's.
quotes.name: Virgin Islander

quotes.message: It pays to be content with your lot.
quotes.name: Aesop

quotes.message: It pays to be nice.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: It's the little things that count.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Make do with what you have.
quotes.name: unknown

quotes.message: Never look a gift horse in the mouth.
quotes.name: John Heywood

quotes.message: Never take anything for granted.
quotes.name: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.message: Play the hand you're dealt.
quotes.name: Jawahareal Nehru

quotes.message: Since we cannot get what we like, let us like what we can get.
quotes.name: Spanish Proverb

quotes.message: Thanks cost nothing.
quotes.name: Creole

quotes.message: The one being carried does not realize how far away the town is.
quotes.name: Nigerian

quotes.message: When eating fruit, remember the one who planted the tree.
quotes.name: Vietnamese

quotes.message: When you drink water, remember the mountain spring.
quotes.name: Chinese

quotes.message: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
quotes.name: John F. Kennedy

quotes.message: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.
quotes.name: Brian Tracy

quotes.message: Thank you' is the best prayer that anyone could say. I say that one a lot. Thank you expresses extreme gratitude, humility, understanding.
quotes.name: Alice Walker

quotes.message: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos to order, confusion to clarity. It can turn a meal into a feast, a house into a home, a stranger into a friend.
quotes.name: Melody Beattie

quotes.message: Gratitude can transform common days into thanksgivings, turn routine jobs into joy, and change ordinary opportunities into blessings.
quotes.name: William Arthur Ward

quotes.message: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
quotes.name: Melody Beattie

quotes.message: Let us be grateful to the people who make us happy; they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
quotes.name: Marcel Proust

quotes.message: Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
quotes.name: William Arthur Ward

quotes.message: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought; and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.
quotes.name: G.K. Chesterton

quotes.message: Gratitude is a currency that we can mint for ourselves, and spend without fear of bankruptcy.
quotes.name: Fred De Witt Van Amburgh

quotes.message: Gratitude is the completion of thankfulness. Thankfulness may consist merely of words. Gratitude is shown in acts.
quotes.name: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.message: There is no such thing as gratitude unexpressed. If it is unexpressed, it is plain, old-fashioned ingratitude.
quotes.name: Robert Brault

quotes.message: Gratitude is an art of painting an adversity into a lovely picture.
quotes.name: Kak Sri

quotes.message: Two kinds of gratitude: The sudden kind we feel for what we take; the larger kind we feel for what we give.
quotes.name: Edwin Arlington Robinson

quotes.message: Gratitude is a quality similar to electricity: it must be produced and discharged and used up in order to exist at all.
quotes.name: William Faulkner

quotes.message: Feeling grateful or appreciative of someone or something in your life actually attracts more of the things that you appreciate and value into your life.
quotes.name: Northrup Christiane

quotes.message: The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
quotes.name: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.message: To speak gratitude is courteous and pleasant, to enact gratitude is generous and noble, but to live gratitude is to touch Heaven.
quotes.name: Johannes Gaertner

quotes.message: Gratitude is the state of mind of thankfulness. As it is cultivated, we experience an increase in our sympathetic joy, our happiness at another's happiness. Just as in the cultivation of compassion, we may feel the pain of others, so we may begin to feel their joy as well. And it doesn't stop there.
quotes.name: Stephen Levine

quotes.message: We often take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.
quotes.name: Cynthia Ozick

quotes.message: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
quotes.name: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.message: Gratitude is one of the sweet shortcuts to finding peace of mind and happiness inside. No matter what is going on outside of us, there's always something we could be grateful for.
quotes.name: Barry Neil Kaufman

quotes.message: No one who achieves success does so without the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.
quotes.name: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.message: Do not indulge in dreams of having what you have not, but reckon up the chief of the blessings you do possess, and then thankfully remember how you would crave for them if they were not yours.
quotes.name: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.message: Gratitude goes beyond the 'mine' and 'thine' and claims the truth that all of life is a pure gift. In the past I always thought of gratitude as a spontaneous response to the awareness of gifts received, but now I realize that gratitude can also be lived as a discipline. The discipline of gratitude is the explicit effort to acknowledge that all I am and have is given to me as a gift of love, a gift to be celebrated with joy.
quotes.name: Henri J.M. Nouwen

quotes.message: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
quotes.name: Cicero

quotes.message: Gratitude is the moral memory of mankind.
quotes.name: Georg Simmel

quotes.message: To live a life of gratitude is to open our eyes to the countless ways in which we are supported by the world around us. Such a life provides less space for our suffering because our attention is more balanced. We are more often occupied with noticing what we are given, thanking those who have helped us, and repaying the world in some concrete way for what we are receiving.
quotes.name: Gregg Krech

quotes.message: At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lighted the flame within us.
quotes.name: Albert Schweitzer

quotes.message: Gratitude is merely the secret hope of further favors.
quotes.name: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

quotes.message: Gratitude is the best attitude. There is not a more pleasing exercise of the mind than gratitude. It is accompanied with such an inward satisfaction that the duty is sufficiently rewarded by the performance.
quotes.name: Joseph Addison

quotes.message: To the generous mind the heaviest debt is that of gratitude, when it is not in our power to repay it.
quotes.name: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.message: As each day comes to us refreshed and anew, so does my gratitude renew itself daily. The breaking of the sun over the horizon is my grateful heart dawning upon a blessed world.
quotes.name: Terri Guillemets

quotes.message: You simply will not be the same person two months from now after consciously giving thanks each day for the abundance that exists in your life. And you will have set in motion an ancient spiritual law: the more you have and are grateful for, the more will be given you.
quotes.name: Sarah Ban Breathnach

quotes.message: When we become more fully aware that our success is due in large measure to the loyalty, helpfulness, and encouragement we have received from others, our desire grows to pass on similar gifts. Gratitude spurs us on to prove ourselves worthy of what others have done for us. The spirit of gratitude is a powerful energizer.
quotes.name: Wilferd A. Peterson

quotes.message: But the value of gratitude does not consist solely in getting you more blessings in the future. Without gratitude you cannot long keep from dissatisfied thought regarding things as they are.
quotes.name: Wallace Wattles

quotes.message: Gratitude is a vaccine, an antitoxin, and an antiseptic.
quotes.name: John Henry Jowett

quotes.message: Gratitude is one of the least articulate of the emotions, especially when it is deep.
quotes.name: Felix Frankfurter

quotes.message: Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn't learn a lot today, at least we learned a little, and if we didn't learn a little, at least we didn't get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn't die; so, let us all be thankful.
quotes.name: Buddha

quotes.message: A man's indebtedness is not virtue; his repayment is. Virtue begins when he dedicates himself actively, to the job of gratitude.
quotes.name: Ruth Benedict

quotes.message: Emancipation of women has made them lose their mystery.
quotes.name: Grace Kelly

quotes.message: Emancipation from error is the condition of real knowledge.
quotes.name: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.message: Emancipation from the bondage of the soil is no freedom for the tree.
quotes.name: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.message: The emancipation of man is the emancipation of labor and the emancipation of labor is the freeing of that basic majority of workers who are yellow, brown and black.
quotes.name: W. E. B. Du Bois

quotes.message: True emancipation begins neither at the polls nor in the courts. It begins in woman's soul.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: Every emancipation has in it the seeds of a new slavery, and every truth easily becomes a lie.
quotes.name: I. F. Stone

quotes.message: Emancipation is the demand of civilization. That is a principle; everything else is an intrigue.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Every emancipation is a restoration of the human world and of human relationships to a man himself.
quotes.name: Karl Marx

quotes.message: Emancipation of belief is the most formidable of the tasks of reform and the one on which all else depends.
quotes.name: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.message: We shall never secure emancipation from the tyranny of the white oppressor until we have achieved it in our own souls.
quotes.name: W. E. B. Du Bois

quotes.message: We boast our emancipation from many superstitions; but if we have broken any idols, it is through a transfer of idolatry.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: The history of men's opposition to women's emancipation is more interesting perhaps than the story of that emancipation itself.
quotes.name: Virginia Woolf

quotes.message: The progression of emancipation of any class usually, if not always, takes place through the efforts of individuals of that class.
quotes.name: Harriet Martineau

quotes.message: What we call emancipation is always and of necessity simply the free choice of the soul between one set of limitations and another.
quotes.name: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.message: Emancipation of human nature inevitably brings with it scientific and technological progress.
quotes.name: Liu Cixin

quotes.message: For me emancipation will only be truly reached if a woman can wear makeup and skirts without having her abilities doubted as a result.
quotes.name: Kristina Schroder

quotes.message: The emancipation of woman will only be possible when woman can take part in production on a large, social scale, and domestic work no longer claims anything but an insignificant amount of her time.
quotes.name: Friedrich Engels

quotes.message: Emancipation, to be of any value to the slave, must be the free, voluntary act of the master, performed from a conviction of its propriety.
quotes.name: Elijah Parish Lovejoy

quotes.message: The first effect of emancipation from the Church was not to make men think rationally, but to open their minds to every sort of antique nonsense.
quotes.name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.message: The emancipation of women is practically the greatest egoistic movement of the nineteenth century, and the most intense affirmation of the right of the self that history has yet seen.
quotes.name: Ellen Key

quotes.message: Merely external emancipation has made of the modern woman an artificial being. Now, woman is confronted with the necessity of emancipating herself from emancipation, if she really desires to be free.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: Our emancipation means standing up for strong families, our emancipation means standing against the homosexuality agenda, emancipation for us means standing up against the repealing of the buggery law.
quotes.name: Alvin Bailey

quotes.message: True emancipation... will have to do away with the absurd notion of the dualism of the sexes, or that man and woman represent two antagonistic worlds.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: The best way to stimulate emancipation is to start to educate your sons to be humans instead of men, and to educate your daughters to be humans instead of women.
quotes.name: Annie M.G. Schmidt

quotes.message: Emancipation of mind is the greatest liberty.
quotes.name: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.message: Emancipation can only come from within; it cannot be dictated by someone else. A law banning the wearing of headscarves changes nothing, except perhaps external appearance. Naturally, Islamic feminism must also include the right to education, to work and the freedom to select one's own husband.
quotes.name: Tariq Ramadan

quotes.message: Emancipation should make it possible for woman to be human in the truest sense. Everything within her that craves assertion and activity should reach its fullest expression; all artificial barriers should be broken, and the road towards greater freedom cleared of every trace of centuries of submission and slavery.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: Emancipation was a proclamation, but not a fact.
